name: Caffeteria Doria

reviews.text: I had been told by a local that this place had the best sandwiches, and then told by another local when I finally visited for lunch that they had the best paninis in Italy. I can't argue with that! My panini, one of the seasonal specialties was absolutely delicious. The service was very friendly.

reviews.text: We were recommended to try this place and almost didn't bother.  It doesn't look anything special.  The panini it produces are very special though.  In a City with thousands of restaurants we went back the next day, to try some of the other recipes.  All the standard Italian combinations but some much more inventive recipes too - pork, figs, honey, mustard narrowly beat prosciutto pears and taleggio.  I am home now and i can still taste it.
reviews.title: Sublime sandwiches

reviews.text: Les paninis y sont tr√®s tr√®s bons. Afin un bon spritz!!! Ne passer pas √† c√¥t√©, je vous le recommande vivement.

reviews.text: Gironzolando per Venezia ci siamo imbattuti per caso in questo baretto. La scelta di tramezzini ci atratto subito. Cosi ci siamo scorpacciati due tramezzini e dei capuccini. I tramezzini ottimi e freschi, anche i cappuccini buni con una bella schiuma - di solito a Venezia non lo sanno fare il cappuccio :-D.

reviews.text: Tutte le mattine un caff√® e magari un aperitivo prima di cena, e se non si ha voglia di mangiare fuori un paio di tramezzini o fantastici panini da portare a casa, purtroppo stavolta abbiamo beccato l`acqua alta, ieri, 20 nov.ho visto un reportage sulla ZDF con un  intervista al proprietario sig.Favaro che disperato dai danni diceva che pensava di chiudere o vendere, p.f.NOOOOO

reviews.text:
Went to this place about 5 years ago on a previous trip and definitely wanted to try it again when we returned to Venice.
I am pleased to report it was just as good as the last time! I had the arrabiatta and it was hands down the best pasta I had in Venice. I also had the chicken breast which was really good as well. Hubby had the cheese gnocchi and the thin cut steak which were also really good.
The staff were all friendly and funny and there was a great vibe in the restaurant. 
Do not walk past this one!

name: Sagra Rooftop Restaurant
address: Isola delle Rose, Laguna di San Marco JW Marriott Hotel, 30133 Venice Italy

reviews.text:
We ate a light lunch outside near the pool and had dinner that night inside. The lunch was expensive (43 euros) for a small hamburger, scoop of bad gelato, and iced tea. 

The dinner was more expensive (almost 200 euros) and had even more disappointing food. Although the wait staff was adequate, the taste and quality of the food did not match the outrageous prices. The food wasn't even close to the quality you would get at a random spot in Venice, but you don't have to take an hour round-trip to eat it. 

I am not averse to paying for convenience, so I would have grumbled about the food and the inflated prices, but left a 3-star review. What added insult to injury was the ambience of the interior of this restaurant. It honestly looks like a cheap cafeteria with incredibly bright, blaring lights that they said cannot be dimmed and cheap furniture that you would expect in an Ikea restaurant. 

Such a lovely hotel deserves an equivalent restaurant. This is sadly deeply deeply lacking.
reviews.title: Expensive, poor quality food with an unpleasant interior

reviews.text: Had a very enjoyable dinner at Sagra and much of it was very well done. Especially the sea bass tatare, schia (Venetian baby prawns fried) and a good wine selection. The taglioni alla busara was only ok and had expected more taste to it. But worth a visit if you‚Äôre at the hotel.
reviews.title: Reasonably good food, but pricey

reviews.text:
Venezia e' magica, ma quest' isoletta e' un incanto. Fuori dai soliti percorsi classici, si raggiunge con una Lancia a disposizione dei clienti e si raggiunge l'hotel. 
in terrazza c'e' questo ristorante dove tutto e' curato nei particolari, ma la cosa che colpisce e rimane nel cuore e' la vista....non c'e' nulla che possa competere , anche se e' tutto perfetto. Cibo, location e servizio sono ottimi, ma la vista che si gode da questa terrazza, ti fa dimenticare qualsiasi cosa, anche quello che hai mangiato o bevuto.
reviews.title: UN ISOLA PRIVATA

reviews.text: le rapport qualit√© prix n'est pas pr√©sent. Tr√®s cher compar√© aux restaurants de Venise. Pour profiter de la vue il suffit de boire un verre au bar ou aller √† la piscine!

reviews.text:
This is just disappointing, and I wouldn't come here for the drinks or the food other than if there is an urge to take an amazing scenic shot for instagram.  Dopolavoro is on property but apparently a world away in terms of service and quality.  

Pricing is outrageous too.
reviews.title: Crazy prices for mediocre items

reviews.text:
We were at the pool and it started to get very windy and they closed the area so we decided to grab a bite at the attached restaurant 
I ordered the hamburger as I wanted something other than fish ,seafood ,pizza or pasta as that‚Äôs all we have eaten on our trip (by choice)
My wife ordered the burrata and tomatoes 
It took a very long time for the food to arrive and I was concerned as I asked for my burger medium rare When the food did arrive the burger I cut right away in half and of course it was well done .Our waitress saw and offered to order another and as we had waited 30 minutes I didn‚Äôt feel like waiting.
My wife‚Äôs salad was delicious and perfectly presented in a fresh tomato pur√©e 
Ps the fries with the burger we‚Äôre excellent 
Very unusual shape and perfectly seasoned and crisp
The moral in Italy don‚Äôt order a hamburger lol
reviews.title: Lunch at the pool in our hotel

reviews.text: Celebrating our marriage with 2 of our best friends that were in Venice for the night. Read reviews and noticed the trend of ‚Äúsmall plates‚Äù so we ordered kind of tapas style. 4 different apps, 2 different first course, and no main course. We did get 4 desserts and 2 bottles of champagne. The crab dish was not quite what we were expecting, but the risotto was so good that it balanced it out!
reviews.title: Amazing views for 'smart casual' dinner!

reviews.text: Das Rooftop-Restaurant bietet einen guten Blick auf Venedig. Das Essen ist gut, aber deutlich zu teuer. Vielleicht Venedig typisch; aber es sei trotzdem erw√§hnt: Viele Stechm√ºcken verleiden das Essen im freien.
reviews.title: Essen ok - aber √ºberteuert

reviews.text:
The hotel itself is extraordinary. Located on a private island. Reachable by "boot shuttle". The easy elevator access to the rooftop bar, Sagra is amazing.

Food: Burger with fries. Simple but flavorful and juicy.

Views: the views from the rooftop were stunning.

Service: Marina and Emanuele C. were so friendly and attentive, quick and efficient.
It was really a 5 star service experience, which made me feel welcome.
reviews.title: Great meal, great views & great service

reviews.text: The weather was perfect and so was the sunset.   The service was 5 star and the food was as well.  This place is described as casual dining but the food, service and atmosphere where top notch.
reviews.title: Lovely rooftop sunset view, great food and service !

reviews.text: This restaurant is located on the 4th floor of the JW Marriott Venice Resort, where my wife and I are currently staying on her birthday trip. The food is excellent; I had the scallops appetizer and grilled octopus while my wife had the Tagliolini with lobster (which I got to finish). Service from our server Giorgia and restaurant manager Emanuele was impeccable! And the view is spectacular especially when you are able to sit on the rooftop deck. It is a bit of a journey if you are not staying at the JW but they do have a free shuttle service to the resort (which is on its own island in the Venetian lagoon) to San Marco.
reviews.title: Excellent food; spectacular view

reviews.text: Senza dubbio una location eccezionale e un livello di servizio adeguato alla classe dell'albergo. Buona la qualit√† del cibo, a un prezzo che ci si poteva aspettare, ma lascia perplessi il "cover charge" di ‚Ç¨16.00 per un pranzo a bordo piscina. Giudicate voi.
reviews.title: Perplessi

reviews.text:
The restaurant is located on the roof of JW Mariott. Amazing view for sunset over Venice. 
The  view is fabolous. Food very nice but caprese from foam amazing experince. The pasta also very good. Drinks and wine a good selection.
Bery good place to be there.
reviews.title: Amazing caprese.  Must have experience

reviews.text: Nonostante la prenotazione abbiamo atteso il tavolo oltre 30 minuti e ci √® stato offerto un aperitivo nell'attesa solo dopo mia "provocazione" e lamentela. Per un ristorante dopo paghi 26 euro un piatto di pasta e dove lo chef fa il giro tra i tavoli accompagnato √® inaccettabile.
reviews.title: Non all'altezza

reviews.text: My husband and I made a reservation at Sagra while we were in Venice for part of our honeymoon. The staff were so friendly and the food was delicious. Views were beautiful. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Honeymoon dinner

reviews.text: Great food and service was even better! We had lunch and dinner here and both were great. I‚Äôm a red meat person and I was jealous that my husband got the chicken. Smaller portions but the chicken was the best I‚Äôve ever tasted.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of dining at the Sagra Rooftop Restaurant. Alessandro was able to accommodate us with a last minute reservation and provided us with great recommendations throughout the night. The cocktails and dinner were 5 stars, but the most memorable part of the meal was dessert, be sure to try their unique take on the traditional Tiramisu!
reviews.title: Beautiful views and even better food!

reviews.text: I‚Äôm reviewing the dinner experience we had at the restaurant (menu is tapas style), not the lunch or patio bar menu/experience. Our dinner was terrible. The selections on the menu (8-12 Euros each) consisted of a BITE or a few bites of food. They were NOT anywhere close to a typical small plate, certainly not enough for two adults to taste the dish. We ordered the gnoccho with duck as one of our selections and it was one dumpling, flavor was fine. We also tried the risotto, which was fine (I‚Äôve had much better risotto at other restaurants in Italy). We tried a few other things, same comments... one tasted like a spoon full of guacamole on the plate. The prices were exorbitant...AND they charged an 8 Euro/person cover charge. This was the first time I felt completely ripped off while traveling and dining throughout Italy. I woke up in the middle of the night hungry... maybe I‚Äôm crazy to think 170 Euros should buy a nice dinner for a family; even in Venice. Two of the tables around us got up and left before ordering, we should have done the same.
reviews.title: Terrible, worst dining experience in Italy

reviews.text: Quand il fait frais, le restaurant ne fonctionne qu‚Äô√† l‚Äôint√©rieur. Aucune vue sur le lagon. Les plats sont in√©gaux √† midi. Le soir uniquement des ¬´¬†tapas¬†¬ª √† 10‚Ç¨ pi√®ce ! Une bouch√©e 10‚Ç¨, si on a faim cela fait au moins 50‚Ç¨ !!! Concept √† revoir compl√®tement. Service in√©gal.
reviews.title: Pas de vue de l‚Äôint√©rieur et cuisine in√©gale

reviews.text:
Sono stata al Mariott JW Resort - Isola delle Rose, come espositore di TRAVELUX, una fiera del turismo di lusso a livello internazionale, organizzata da una primaria societ√† di eventi in modo ineccepibile.
La seconda sera, liberi da impegni di lavoro decidiamo per una cena leggera in hotel e chiediamo informazioni al responsabile dell'area bar, il quale ci presenta due alternative: uno il ristorante al piano terra, presentandolo come pi√π tradizionale e anche pizzeria, il secondo al 4 piano dedicato alla cucina regionale italiana, in forma di vari assaggi (ci consiglia di prenderne quattro-cinque).
Decidiamo per il SAGRA al 4^piano: siamo 4 donne.
Appena entrate in sala colgo subito un'aria di grande disorientamento tra il personale, tanto,ma affatto coordinato, gira a vuoto in lungo e largo nella sala., dove si percepisce subito che manda un coordinamento.
Portano 4 menu e ordiniamo: 3 fagottini di melanzana e mozzarella di bufala alla parmigiana, 1 fiore di zucca ripieno di ricotta, basilico,pomodoro secco e olive, 1 crudo  di ricciola, limone, caviale e lattuga di mare, 1 gnocco di patate al ripieno di rag√π d'anatra gratinato con pecorino toscano, 1 pacchero di Gragnano con ricotta, spinacino e gambero rosso di Mazzara del vallo, 1 filetto di vitello, con purea di patate novelle e fave. Per dessert 1 panna e fragole, con coulis di fragole fresche e meringa, 1 Rocher con mousse al cioccolato gianduia, nocciole del Piemonte caramellate e chantilly al caramello.
Voi direte: "Allettanti e variegate offerte" !!!!!!
In tempi cadenzati difformemente tra un commensale e l'altro, in ordine sparso, senza alcuno stile, si presentano con piatti dove dentro c'√® la pietanza ordinata, la cui quantit√† totale ha una permanenza in bocca pi√π breve del tempo impiegato a leggere la descrizione sul menu !!!!!
Un vero e proprio insulto.
Specifico meglio: il fagottino di melanzana √® freddo da frigorifero, presentato con un riccio in rilievo di mozzarella affettata con la mandolina, sopra una indistinta purea grigiastra (presumo polpa di melanzana passata) sdraiata sopra un altro disco affettato come sopra, di bufala. Diametro totale presunto 6 cm. Non c'√® tempo per assaporare !
Lo gnocco di patate √® 1 singolo gnocco 2x2 cm e il gusto ugualmente non pu√≤ riconoscersi n√® definire gli ingredienti, vista la dimensione dell'intera porzione....
Il crudo di ricciola, resta un'idea !
Il pacchero di Gragnano: 1 pacchero e mezzo, ......
Non voglio tediare i lettori di questa recensione, che forse crederanno sia tutta opera di una mente paranoica.
Invito lo staff di Tripadvisor ad indagare la situazione oltraggiosa !!!
reviews.title: Un insulto congiunto: alla clientela,alla ristorazione, all'accoglienza !

reviews.text:
We have been in this hotel for 3 days when we decided to try this restaurant. This restaurant was highly recommended by the front desk and its location is unbeatable. Rooftop with a great cityview.   What could go wrong?  We ate inside and the view could not be seen from the lack of windows. There is not much to see when you are inside the restaurant. 

We made reservations and was promptly seated upon check in. The waiter told us about the small plates and it can be shared. There were three of us and we ordered 7 dishes. When the food arrived it was quite amusing as the portions were really small. The description should have stopped at SMALL plates. There was nothing to share among ourselves. Perhaps we misunderstood nevertheless the food was average.
reviews.title: Small plates and not much to share

reviews.text: My wife and myself where at the JW Marriott for our 40th birthday celebrations, we ate in the sagra on the Saturday night, 23rd March, from the offset the staff where extremely professional and very friendly, the lady that assisted us explained all the dishes and what was best to order, she didn‚Äôt disappoint as we order from the taster menu to sample true Italian food. The food was exceptional and bursting with flavour, they truly helped make our trip a memorable one. Exceptional service

reviews.text: The food was ok.  The View and the ambiance was excellent.  Nice relaxing music.  A little cold since we were there in October, but blankets were available for guests to use.

Dropped in here before moving in to the excellent La Bitta.

For the experienced Negroni artiste (as I am) I never avoid the opportunity when presented.

This was a Negronj of serious proportion and quality.

Expertly prepared and served.

We had in addition, Spritzer and a couple of glasses of white (usual decent choice of whites by the glass).

Thoroughly enjoyed our 30 minutes early evening - the place must be humming later in the evening.

For me, it‚Äôs a real Venice experience - a must visit for those seeking a  real Italian bar.

Very competitive on the pricing too.

Have a Negroni - it will not disappoint.

The prices run $$

reviews.text: We visited with the familyin October 2019,  was very quite when we found it but looked great...and it was great.  By the time we left it was packed outside, quite inside.   Pizza were  AMAZING.  Lovely beers.  Nice outside location, very nice inside.  (Only slight negative ws that the toilet seat was missing, although generally had been refurbished and clean.)  Otherwise wonderful.  Would definitely return.  I would highly recommend.

reviews.text:
Early Friday evening, we hadn't booked, pleased we got a table for four. Very welcoming.
Fresh bread with oils and balsamic were placed on the table. We ordered lasagne, mushroom rissoto and side salads, with house wine. Only a short wait and the food was delicious. The staff were attentive, friendly and  humorous. We really did enjoy our enening. Would return and recommend.

reviews.text: Merita una (buona) recensione perch√® siamo arrivati fuori orario con un'altra coppia e hanno riaperto la cucina per noi. reviews.text: We tried daily special ravioli and risotto. Both of them was like a gourmet food. We enjoyed so much our food. I felt like a whole new experience in the middle of Venice trying new food. Service was really cool too. I recommend this place

reviews.text:
My host at Airbnb suggested this place as it was one of her favourite pizza places, shes not wrong!   The choice of pizza's were by far the best I had seen since I stayed in Venice, so many to choose from!   
My children and I both had a pizza and really enjoyed it!  I wouldn't rate it as the best I had in in Italy but it was still good, and service was great!  We sat outside, and saw lots of locals coming in and out (sign of a good restaurant!)  
Only wish they did serve slightly smaller pizzas for the little ones.....a full pizza is just to much for a small 7 year old!

reviews.text: Take the time and find your way to this amazing restaurant ! While visiting the local sights this is where you NEED to eat ! Delizioso.. nicely priced and authentic ! The fresh tomato sauce and home made pasta .. crispy pizza ... just top notch !

reviews.text: E' stata una piacevolissima scoperta trovare questo ottimo ristorante. Pesce fresco, cozze speciali tanto da fare una super "scarpetta"! Anche il servizio non √® da meno, le ragazze sono davvero simpatiche e professionali. Da suggerire sicuramente.

reviews.text:
Right around corner from our hotel.  Excellent food, service and atmosphere. We sat outside.  We did make reservations.  Very casual atmosphere with Venice flare.  I had rissotta with scrimp and my wife had black rissotta with squid.  Outstanding.  If you have not had black spaghetti, you have got to try.  Finished dinner with gelato.  
Very good prices.  With several drinks....$ 52.

reviews.text: Best meal in Venice hands down. A fillet steak you could cut with a spoon covered in white truffle was divine. As a non risotto liker the risotto was also to die for. Good service and very pleasant dinner.

reviews.text: I picked this place after seeing high average reviews and we were happy with the choice. My boyfriend picked the parma pizza with a side of bolognese (his invention) which was deeee-lish. Everyone should give it a try! Pizzas are very big - you have been warned. I had the pastry ravioli and the calamari polenta. I chose this over pizza as I wasn't too hungry but I prefered his pizza. The calamari was really, really small with the polenta mash so it felt like baby food... The pastry was fine but nothing to shout about.

reviews.text: Close to the vaperetto stop at San Stae, next to the museum of Mocenigo this very friendly cafe/ bar has lots to offer, some very tasty ciccheti big variety of fillings, excellent coffee plenty of wines and beers , whether on short sprint like the baker from across the Calle, or lingering longer in the afternoon as we were well worth the visit.

reviews.text: This quaint little caf√© is a must-visit when you're in Venice.  Tucked away in the back alleys of Santa Croce, this friendly place has everything from pizza to pastry and the best cappuccino I've ever had!  They speak English and the food is delicious (try the meatballs and the quiche-like pie and cream croissant).  There was not one thing that our party of 5 ordered that wasn't perfectly seasoned and delicious- and we ate for under 20 Euros for all of us!  Friendly service and great food- worth the hunt to find this place!  We'll be back next time we're in Venice! Thanks, Alessandro!
reviews.title: EAT HERE WHEN IN VENICE!

reviews.text: This is a great caf√© in Venice, where you can have an outstanding "continental" breakfast. If you go early enough in the morning, you will find a generous selection of croissants, and you can order different types of coffee, including good decaf. Later in the day, the place turns into a bar, with typical Venetian appetizers and a great choice of wines and other drinks. At certain evenings, there are small, free concerts of classical chamber music, on the street right in front of the caf√©/bar, and you can buy your appetizers and/or drinks and listen to the music. A really wonderful Venetian experience!
reviews.title: Excellent neighborhood bar/caf√© in venice.

reviews.text: Back again in this cosy cafe with local newspapers, good cicchetti and locals. Good coffe and nice white wine and a friendly staff. Perfect for your morning coffee after leaving your garbage bag at San Stae or in the afternoon just passing.

reviews.text:
Ho cenato in questo ristorante assieme a dei clienti, per una cena di affari. La qualit√† delle pietanze √® ottima, cibo fresco, cucinato benissimo, molto gustoso, ma non pesante. Men√π vario ed interessante e porzioni abbondanti. Il locale √® molto carino, di dimensioni ridotte, molto coccolo. Il servizio √® ottimo, il personale molto gentile e disponibile.

reviews.text:
We took the bost from outside our hotel across to the restaurant which is attached to the Hilton hotel. It is small, 30 covers, and is decorated like a cafe with a deli counter at the front. The head waiter had our booking and showed us to our table. We had had the obligatory bread as our starter and chose a prosecco which was good. We selected the specials: lamb stew, potatoes and grilled vegetables which tasted amazing, and the seafood lasagne which was good but not great. No dessert as we wanted to head up to the roof bar of the hotel for cocktails. 
Worth a trip across from Zattere for the evening.
reviews.title: Worth the trip.

Pur avendo uno stomaco di ferro sono stato davvero molto male la mattina dopo, non tornerei assolutamente. reviews.text:
Nous avons s√©journ√© √† l‚Äôh√¥tel Hilton Molino lors d‚Äôune visite de Venise et nous avons choisi pour d√Æner de mang√© √† ce restaurant qui est affili√© √† l‚Äôh√¥tel.  Celui-ci est s√©par√© de l‚Äôh√¥tel avec une salle √† manger int√©rieur, mais aussi une magnifique terrasse ext√©rieur √† la hauteur du canal avec une vue sur Venise.  Juste pour la vue et l‚Äôambiance ce restaurant m‚Äôavait d√©j√† conquis.  

C√¥t√© nourriture le menu est simple et j‚Äôai choisi la pieuvre et le calmar grill√© sur polenta.  Vraiment tr√®s bien cuit et succulent comme plat.  Ma conjointe a moins aim√© son plat de p√¢tes et boulette de viande, mais mon fils a ador√© le pain, ses p√¢tes blanches et la sauce aux tomates ¬´ √† part ¬ª. 

Pour ce qui est du service, tout le personnel √©tait accueillant et sympathique.  Vraiment une belle soir√©e.  Je le conseil √† tous ceux qui reste quelques nuits √† cet h√¥tel.  Ce n‚Äôest pas le charme du Grand canal et du pont Rialto, mais apr√®s 3 jours de visite, ce resto adjacent √† l‚Äôh√¥tel est tr√®s agr√©able.  Bon app√©tit.

reviews.text:
We visited on 25th August 2019 while staying at the Hilton. In summary, the restaurant is simple, well price with good food. We also experienced excellent service. 

We booked directly on the Fork app, I‚Äôd definitely recommend booking as we saw people being turned away. 

For a starter we had the shared antipasti. It was huge, plenty for three or four people.

For mains, my partner had the special of the day, a lasagna which was good - good but nothing to write home about. She did mention the pasta was fresh and very tasty.

I had the T-bone stake (medium rare). It was outstanding, a good cut which was perfectly cooked. It was massive (probably 700 - 800G) so i struggled to finish it. The side of grilled aubergine wasn‚Äôt a good paring if I‚Äôm honest! Grilled tomato or even some rocket would be better. 

For desert, we shared the pavlova. It was brilliant, just right! We both really enjoyed it. Wine selection was small but what we did get was brilliant. 

The service throughout was excellent, the waitress spoke perfect English and deserves special recognition. 

If your staying at the Hilton and don‚Äôt want to waterbus over to the main islands, I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place for an evening.
reviews.title: Very good - recommended

reviews.text: Bellissimo ristorante consiglio di prenotare anche se ha posto anche fuori con bellissima vista sulla laguna. La cucina tipica Veneziana con tradizioni di una volta. Spaghetti (fatti a mano freschi) alle vongole con un attimo sughetto al limone. Branzino con patate e funghi davvero buono. Personale cordiale e attento. Ci torner√≤ e lo consiglier√≥.

reviews.text:
Commento provocatorio.
La location molto bella √® sotto gli occhi vostri, faccio notare che purtroppo la riva di fronte non √® il massimo per essere a Venezia. 
La qualit√† √® discreta ma non vedo questa pretesa bravura descritta da altri. ( il risotto fatelo un po‚Äô meno abbondante, finisce per saziare troppo)
Servizio formale,  rapporto qualit√† prezzo squilibrato, anche per Venezia.

reviews.text:
We visited Bacaromi during our stay in Venice and had mixed feelings. Whilst the food was undoubtedly incredible, the management of the restaurant leaves a lot to be desired. 

It is worth noting from the outset that the cover charge is ¬£5 per person, however the first you will know of this is when your bill arrives.

When we arrived, there was a large table of guests with incredibly badly behaved children. The parents were shouting across the restaurant to each other and the kids were running-riot and bumping into other guest‚Äôs chairs. 

Despite having a reservation, we were unsure if we actually wanted to dine here. 

Whilst the food was lovely, the restaurant staff made no attempt to control the unruly guests who were making the whole experience unenjoyable for the remaining tables. 

For a restaurant expecting to charge these prices, there should‚Äôve been proper management of this situation. There were several other guests who felt distinctly uncomfortable with the experience.
reviews.title: Lovely food

reviews.text:
In bella posizione sulla Giudecca, Locale piccolo ma con una terrazza enorme sul canale. Personale cortese e professionale. Cicchetti buonissimi e molto vari. Primi piatti m9to buoni. Polpo e calamari gigliati con polenta una combinazione azzeccata.
Un fritto misto ottimo e porzioni veramente abbondanti tanto che abbiamo saltato il dessert. Prezzi un po‚Äô cari, ma ne vale la pena.

reviews.text: Mangiare in un posto non √® solo cibo. √à un accordo. Un contratto. Un impegno da due parti. Io mangio e pago, tu mi dai quello che mi prometti. Ma se la sera pi√π importante dell'estate, quando sono disposto ad accettare prezzi diversi dalla sera "normale" mi garantisci qualcosa in pi√π, un accesso alla vista dello spettacolo pirotecnico e non mantieni quello che prometti... non sei corretto. La sicurezza prima di tutto, ma se garantisci nel prezzo  di una sera, servizi che sai non potrai mantenere, sei scorretto. Promettere  qualcosa che non puoi mantenere √® una pratica commerciale scorretta. Qualcosa da aggiungere? Facile... Uno spritz 12 euro.

reviews.text:

reviews.text: Siamo tornati in questo ristorante mentre soggiornavamo all'Hotel Molino Stuky nell'isola della Giudecca. Si mangiamo piatti tipici della cucina veneta, l'ambiente √® davvero accogliente e preciso. Consigliato per una serata di coppia, ma anche tra amici.

reviews.text: Questo ristorante dell‚Äôhotel Hilton ha un ingresso indipendente che condivide con il pi√π sofisticato ristorante Aromi. Nel men√π alcune proposte in apertura, poi primi e secondi sia di carne che di pesce. Abbiamo cenato qui pi√π volte e ci siamo sempre trovati bene. Il servizio √® gentile, accogilente e veloce. I piatti buoni e abbondanti. Un posto a colpo sicuro.

reviews.text: Ottima location ed ambientazione. Sembra di soggiornare gradevolmente in un antico bacaro veneto. Mediocre la qualit√† e la preparazione dei cibi. Eccessivo il costo. Rapporto qualit√† prezzo non soddisfacente

reviews.text: We had a table closest to the water and it was a lovely evening and the food was delicious. My husband and I were celebrating our daughter and son in law's 14 wedding anniversary and the F&B manager Giuseppe Pozzuoli did everything to make it the special evening we wanted. We stayed at the Hilton Molino Stucky for our one night pre cruise and the Bacaromi turned out to be a fabulous experience. We were away from the crowds in the center of Venice and could 'look at the city' and enjoy it in a beautiful setting. Our service was superb and every dish was 'right on!"
reviews.title: Lovely dining experience for one night in Venice

reviews.text: Pernottavamo l√¨ vicino e quindi abbiamo deciso di provare entrambi i ristoranti dell'Hilton: "Aromi" e questo "Bacaromi", dove la cucina √® locale in chiave gourmet, ma con porzioni tutt'altro che gourmet, anzi piuttosto abbondanti, per cui alla delizia del palato non si accompagna la vuotezza di stomaco, piuttosto si esce completamente soddisfatti sotto ogni punto di vista. Io ho mangiato una frittura di pesce spaziale, leggerissima, non unta, variegata. Mia moglie polipo e calamari arrosto su una polenta meravigliosa. Ottimo il tiramisu (uno per due), non tradizionale, ma con qualche variante dello chef che l'ha reso ancora pi√π stuzzicante. Due calici di vino e il conto √® salito poco sopra i cento euro. Abbastanza caro, ma li valeva tutti. Se potessi, ci tornerei domani.
reviews.title: meraviglioso ristorante "glocal"

reviews.text: Sehr gutes Essen Nette Kellner sch√∂nes Ambiente zum angemessenen Preis Leistungsverh√§ltnis kommen gerne wieder

reviews.text: arrivato tardissimo, ci hanno comunque servito e coccolato, i piatti erano ben fatti e di ottima qualit√† i prodotti. Niente da dire in merito al servizio che √® stato impeccabile. Il conto va di conseguenza, ma non abbiate paura, si spende di pi√π in posti pi√π pessimi!

reviews.text: Where to begin... my partner and I ordered the cheese ravioli which was apparently home made. The presentation and service  was average however the taste was extremely disappointing.. 24 euros per dish and to be honest our plane food tasted more fresh. As we took the first bite of our food we could hear in the background a microwave beeping. Don‚Äôt expect this from a restaurant in a 5 star hotel. We both had one bite and it was safe to say it was horrible. The Waitress simply took it away without asking us how the food was, which you‚Äôd normally expect considering we had left most of it. We move on to the 14 Euro ‚Äúhomemade‚Äù tiramisu.... it was dry, bland and the cream was tough... tasted like bread...Nasty. By the end of the meal we simply got the bill and left. The waitress took no notice to the fact that our main and dessert was hardly touched. Would not recommend this place for your stay in Venice.
reviews.title: Terrible food, microwave fresh.

reviews.text: √à sempre un piacere per noi e la nostra famiglia tornare in un questo ristorante dove troviamo la cura nel mangiare con piatti tipici e l‚Äôattenzione per il cliente, ci fa sentire come fossimo a casa nostra..

reviews.text:
Locale e personale delizioso!
In particolare segnalo che sono uno dei rarissimi ristoranti messicani ad usare l‚Äôunica vera farina di mais che andrebbe usata x cucinare i loro tachos, tortillas, nachos & co.!E li cucinano loro, fritti al momento!
I loro TOTOPOS (nachos), da accompagnare alla guacamole o alle salsine varie, sono davvero come quelli originali del Messico, e non hanno nulla a che fare con le patatine salate: sono eccellenti!

Per chi ama la cucina messicana devo dire che c‚Äô√® una ottima scelta. Molto buoni i nachos fatti in casa con buone salse di contorno. Burrito nella media.
Purtroppo L attesa nelle serate affollate √® molto alta, ma ci ha lasciato di stucco il costo della sangria di 20‚Ç¨ (x 1litro o 75 cl non ricordo), peraltro non indicato nel menu sul qual√® c‚Äô√® solo L indicazione del costo del bicchiere. reviews.text:
La qualit√† del cibo servitoci √® stata pari solamente all‚Äôantipatia e boriosit√† del personale che c‚Äô√® l‚Äôha servita. Chili di carne che non si avvicinava minimamente a quello originale e un burritos che conteneva un pezzo piccolo di pollo, un pomodoro e una montagna di insalata! 
Una vergogna per la citt√†!

reviews.text:
A malincuore mi sento in obbligo di dover recensire questo ‚Äúristorante‚Äù, per tutti voi che vedete il termine  ‚ÄúVenezia‚Äù e ‚ÄúMessico‚Äù associati a questo loculo; non fatevi ingannare come me, di messicano c‚Äô√® solo la bandiera.
Questo locale e chi ci lavora dovrebbe essere banditi da Venezia, camerieri, cuochi e proprietari dovrebbero farsi un esame di coscienza; non si pu√≤ servire del cibo di questa qualit√†, personalmente non lo farei mangiare neanche al mio cane.
Prego le autorit√† di cacciare dalla nostra citt√† tale abominio e confinare tali persone, maleducate e ignoranti nel posto che meritano.
Siamo stati male tutti solo ad aver assaggiato quelle bestialit√† che ci sono state propinate.

reviews.text: Siamo state ieri sera in questo locale. Dopo esserci sedute, abbiamo aspettato 20 minuti per avere un men√π. Una volta ordinato da bere, ci hanno portato delle bibite sbagliate e, dopo averlo fatto notare, la cameriera si √® rivolta a noi in maniera un po' scortese. La sangria ordinata era un simil acqua detox. Un'altra mezz'ora abbondante per avere solo dei nachos. Il secondo piatto √® arrivato quasi 40 minuti dopo. reviews.text:
Siamo andati per la prima volta a San Valentino in questo ristorante messicano, sentendo pareri contrastanti a riguardo. Il personale √® molto cortese, nulla da dire; ambiente tranquillo, decorazioni tipiche messicane con musica contemporanea di sottofondo che non crea disturbo.
Per quanto riguarda la cucina non posso essere altrettanto positiva: le porzioni sono piccole e riempite di insalata per fare volume, riducendo cos√¨, spesso e volentieri il vero contenuto dei cibi. Il gusto, in ogni caso, non √® il massimo ed io, avendo esperienza con altri ristoranti messicani, mi sento di dire che non aveva troppo sapore il cibo. Non dico che il cibo sia cattivo, ma neanche eccellente o, almeno, come me l'aspettavo.

reviews.text: Molto spesso con la mia amica torno a Venezia apposta per mangiare all'Iguana. Tutto sempre buonissimo e dopo aver mangiato mi sento sempre piena e felicissima! Potrebbero solo ampliare il locale, perch√© se non prenoti o magari decidi spontaneamente di andare l√¨, ti danno un tavolino davanti alla porta ed √® troppo fastidioso avere alle spalle la gente che entra ed esce continuamente... La stessa cosa se si prenota e ti capita il tavolo nella prima parte del locale, √® difficilissimo alzarsi dal tavolo per andare in bagno o fare le conversazioni private, gli spazi tra i tavoli non sono ampi per niente... Per il resto ottimo!

reviews.text: Nei nostri viaggi non pu√≤ mancare la prova dei ristoranti messicani del posto.. In questo caso siamo rimasti contenti, peccato non ci sia nel men√π il classico piatto nachos con queso ma hanno rimediato portandoci la salsa di formaggio a parte. Personale cortese.

reviews.text:
Prima esperienza per me  in questo ristorante messicano consigliatomi dalla mia fidanzata, la titolare gentilissima e disponibile mi ha spiegato ogni piatto, ebbene si sono un rompiballe di prima categoria.
Abbiamo iniziato con lo spritz accompagnato da Nachos e Salse, una cosa meravigliosa, pensavo mi arrivassero le soli croste che si trovano dappertutto ed invece erano fatte in casa, leggere e croccanti.
Quindi ci siamo fatti portare due Chimichanga ai Gamberi (gamberoni freschi stupendi) ed √® stata un esperienza sublime, la qualit√† del piatto e le materie prime erano una cosa inaspettata, leggerissima delicatissima, quindi non contenti siamo passati ad un Burrito Asada con carne marinata, un burro, morbidissima. 
Abbiamo terminato con un dolce Bamba Flauta al mascarpone e noci per chiudere il pranzo in bellezza.
Adesso devo programmare il ritorno per assaporare gli altri piatti visto che √® stata una bont√†.
Consigliatissimo per tutti quelli a cui piace mangiare bene e sanno distinguere tra i prodotti freschi e quelli no, per tutti gli altri c'√® il McDonalds
Posso solo dire ECCEZIONALE!!!

reviews.text:
Il locale √® carino, in una stretta calletta a Cannaregio. Molto gradevole la possibilit√† di cenare all‚Äôaperto con tavoli correttamente e ampiamente distanziati.
Il servizio √® cordiale, ma troppo lungo con i tempi per un numero cos√¨ ridotto di coperti.
Ho la possibilit√° di assaggiare il piatto ‚Äúmacho nacho‚Äù come antipasto da condividere: scarico di sapore per una cucina messicana, mediocre e per di pi√π a un prezzo esagerato.
Come portata principale punto su un burrito di pollo, insapore e pieno colmo di insalata, scarsissimo il ripieno di carne. Avessi voluto mangiare vegetariano avrei scelto un altro locale

a parte cibo e bevande, tutto sommato gradevoli, non mi √® piaciuto che a alla mia famiglia, come ad altre due presenti, fosse dedicata una saletta squallidina in fondo ad uno stretto corridoio, mentre quella pi√π curata e gradevole fosse occupata solo da turisti .

Adoro le chips con le salse come antipasto: sono fritte ma non unte, croccanti e fanno passare il tempo di attesa per i piatti, consiglio bevendo un mojito, margarita o pi√±acolada. Le fajitas ottime ed anche queste sono porizioni giuste/abbondanti. Il dolce prendo spesso la bamba flauta, davvero buona: se dovessi fare un appunto direi che √® solo un po‚Äô piccola, finisce subito. Prezzo assolutamente medio, se non basso se penso che siamo a Venezia. Con meno di 30‚Ç¨ a testa mangi, bevi in abbondanza! Non smetter√≤ mai di andarci! Consigliato anche per chi viene da fuori perch√© penso sia il migliore della provincia di Venezia.

Y los taquitos ten√≠an el mismo relleno que una lasa√±a, pedimos cerveza y solo ten√≠an espa√±ola, nos dijeron que como era un restaurante mejicano era lo m√°s parecido. Unos tristes jajaja. reviews.text:
L‚Äôimpressione √® che sia tutto provvisorio, al banco una persona agitata, disorganizzata e poco cortese affaccendata in uno spazio ‚Äúincasinato‚Äù mentre confeziona burritos con mani prive di guanti, con i braccialetti che affondano nel ripieno, prima e dopo aver ritirato i soldi e con le stesse mani continua a ripiegare i burritos. Di fianco a lei un collega, sempre rigorosamente a mani nude, braccia tatuate divide l‚Äôimpasto dei nachos mentre sposta e disbriga l‚Äôangusto spazio. Ma dove sono i requisiti minimi d‚Äôigiene?
Peraltro,  il burritos con ripieno appena tiepido per velocizzare la realizzazione in uno piastra che ne contiene appena tre, risulta ovviamente immangiabile a soli tre passi dal takeaway.
DELUDENTE.

reviews.text:
Premetto che ieri sera c'era l'inaugurazione del take away l√¨ di fronte quindi una bella mole di persone euforiche da cibo e alcool free! Noi abbiamo iniziato la serata l√¨, mettendoci religiosamente in fila per il nostro bicchierello di vino ed il nostro burrito. I ragazzi dietro al bancone molto simpatici e disponibili. Poi abbiamo deciso di continuare la serata al ristorante perch√© il mezzo burrito oramai ci aveva aperto una voragine. Abbiamo chiesto un tavolo e ci √® stato detto che avremmo avuto un'ora per mangiare perch√© alle 21 il tavolo era prenotato. Hanno preso il nostro ordine e abbiamo iniziato a mangiare verso le 20.50. Io avevo due piatti quindi la faccenda si √® fatta complicata. I piatti non mi hanno soddisfatto. Ho preso una chimichanga ai gamberi (8 euro) e un taco al manzo (6 euro), in modo da assaggiare almeno due sapori diversi e non spendere troppo. L'unico sapore che ho sentito per tutta la durata del pasto √® stato quello di insalata. Insalata in quantit√† massicce everywhere. Diciamo che dalla cucina messicana mi aspetto sapori decisamente pi√π incisivi e ho trovato invece dei piatti un pelo troppo furbetti. Margaritas buonissimi. Il tempo di attesa per pagare snervante. Siamo sembrate invisibili davanti al bancone, piuttosto comune a Venezia per chi evidentemente non ha le sembianze di un nativo.
Il mezzo burrito gratuito assaggiato al take away √® valso molto di pi√π dei due piatti pagati al ristorante.
reviews.title: Mm.

reviews.text: We kwamen hier bij toeval. Vroeg of ik er kon eten in verband met mijn allergie, was geen probleem zeiden ze. Een tostada besteld, super lekker! De volgende dag zijn we er speciaal weer heen gegaan omdat we het zo lekker vonden. Toen een burrito gehad. Beide gerechten waren met rijst en bonen, salsa en guacamole. Heerlijk en dat voor een goede prijs! Zeker in veneti√´.

reviews.text: Cibo abbastanza buono e men√π vario. Rapporto qualit√† prezzo non buonissimo, molto lenti coi tempi. Da provare con prenotazione o quando c'√® poca gente senno si rischia di aspettare anche un'ora e mezza per un piatto di nachos.

reviews.text:
We loved it here, gresg food, friendly service and reasonable prices. 
Glasses of wine are very small in Venice but here I could have a nice carafe for a good price. 
Friendly and clean, popular with locals but we received a fantastic welcome and even had a take away on the last evening as an early start home.
reviews.title: A breath of fresh air

reviews.text:
We had been to Rome, Florence and arrived in Venice just looking for something different. We came upon this place in a back street that we chanced down . We were only looking for a drink at first and settled inside for a beer and a glass of red. 
The atmosphere was relaxed and the girls were friendly so we got a menu. The food was a reasonable price, and from other tables, looked tasty. The house red was only ‚Ç¨1.50 a glass, so that is always a bonus in my book.  
We set outside and our food was tasty and fresh. Overall our experience was fantastic and I would recommend here to anybody looking for a quirky out of the way place while in Venice.
reviews.title: Seek and you will find!

reviews.text: L'iguana √® una tappa fissa ogni volta che torniamo a Venezia, sia per ragioni sentimentali che per ragioni alimentari. Buon cibo messicano, portate abbondanti, Margaritas ottimi. ieri erano un po' incasinati per Carnevale e il servizio non √® stato attento come al solito. Ma vale la pena tornarci... sempre!

reviews.text:

Very kind and lovely staff, typical furniture and great presentation of Mexican dishes. Looking forward to come back again!

We were in Venice for 3 weeks this visit and wanted an alternative to Italian for a night. We visited here last night as it was in our neighbour of Cannaregio. We were pleasantly surprised with the food and the accompanying service. 
We had a ‚Äòmachos nachos‚Äô vegetarian to start (10‚Ç¨) which we shared then we both had a tostada for main with a side of beans and rice which was delicious! We‚Äôd recommend this place once you are a bit worn out with Italian cuisine as it was a lovely atmosphere with lots of locals present. Total bill was 36‚Ç¨

reviews.text:

reviews.text:
My family and I (including my mother-in-law who lives in Arizona) were looking for something a little different than pizza and pasta for our last night in Venice. We found the Iguana to be just what we needed. The food was delicious and fresh, all the different dips were really yummy. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was very relaxed.
We'd eat there again.
reviews.title: Great Mexican in Venice!

reviews.text:
Ho iniziato a frequentare il DHERO' Cafe'a Venezia centro storico, via Garibaldi 1813 in Sestiere di Castello, dalla inaugurazione. Mi ha colpito subito l'originalita' della struttura che si distingue da tutte le altre della zona e che attrae prevalentemente turismo di qualita' che di riflesso migliora anche la qualita' urbana, paesaggistica  del posto, gia' bella.Li' non si sentono volgarita' e nemmeno maldicenze. Punto forte la professionalita' amabile della titolare propretaria  Freddy e collaboratori altrettanto validi e gentili.
Chi gradisce un po' di fresco nelle serate d'estate, in pace, con una visuale paesaggistica suggestiva con l'ascolto anche di musica relax raffinata, proprio di fronte al viale alberato con la statua di Garibaldi e la vasca con le tartarughe, mangiando se lo desidera, uno sfizioso cicchetto e gustando cocktail, consiglio di cuore questo posto, unico nel suo genere.
Dove anche un residente veneziano che apprezza la qualita' passando un po' di tempo 
in ambiente originale, rilassante e pulito, al DHERO' e' semore bene accolto.
Io sono fortunata perche' ci abito vicino, ma e' molto apprezzato e frequentato da turismo di qualita' e garbato.   Rosita B
reviews.title: Provare per credere

reviews.text: After too many places in Venice that charge anything up to four euros for a black coffee, this wonderful little coffee shop was a breath of fresh air.  A great tasting cappuccino here is only 1.50 even to sit outside (most places increase the price to sit outside). The lady working there (maybe the owner?) was extremely friendly and singing as she worked.  There is a small amount of indoor and outdoor seating where you can look over the wide street and the beautiful park opposite (Go and check out the fountain statue, there are terrapins and fish in it).  The backround music's good (jazz) and all in all a lovely place to stop.  We went back, will definitely go there again next time we're in Venice.  Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great coffee, best price, excellent service

reviews.text: Un caff√® - bar / "hole in the wall", con una vista rilassante del parco. Dove persone autentiche e i loro cani possono gustare buon vino e caff√® senza pretese.( Non ho provato gli spuntini.) Abbastanza piccolo da incoraggiare le chiacchiere da bar. Di solito pieno, quindi si √® fortunati a trovare un posto. La poltrona d'oro "Thriller" nell'angolo √® la migliore! Di giorno si trova il panatiere del quartiere, la nonna, l'attrice e il meccanico marino, e di sera gusta un buon vino salentino a lume di candela, con un amante, (senza turisti rumorosi). Un luogo dove si diventa uno con Venezia e vorrebbe tornare di nuovo. Lascia il cellulare alla spalle. Ecco la vecchia ospitalit√†. Lo spirito comunitario vive qui, grazie agli splendidi proprietari...

Situato in via Garibaldi a Venezia questo piccolo locale si distingue dai vicini, la titolare, Alfredina, sapr√† consigliare un'ottimo cocktail per passare una serata in compagnia senza mai far mancare una piccola modifica per dare un indimenticabile tocco di originalit√† alle sue "creazioni". Non mancano ottimi vini, scelti personalmente dalla titolare; non √® raro che per scegliere un vino chieda i gusti del cliente per poterlo accontentare al meglio.

reviews.text: Locale veramente must in via Garibaldi a Venezia, impossibile non farci una visita! Personale caldo e accogliente, si distingue per la proprietaria, la Signora Freddy, veramente professionale e preparata nel mondo dei Lounge bar. Cocktail eccezionali e prezzi imbattibili per la zona, sono il fiore all'occhiello del Dher√≤ Caf√®, al quale non posso che riconoscergli tutto il mio apprezzamento. Vi invito a provare, non rimarrete sicuramente delusi!

reviews.text: Questo caf√® e lounge bar si distingue dagli altri caf√® di Via Garibaldi per il rapporto cordiale che la proprietaria, la Sig. Alfredina, sa instaurare con i suoi clienti. Non solo serve i cocktails (ottimi, come non si trovano nella Via, dove al massimo si beve il solito spritz) preparati personalmente da lei, ogni volta inserendovi una qualche novit√† dopo averne chiesto l'assenso, ma √® sempre pronta a instaurare un rapporto umano: si interessa del cliente, dei suoi gusti, delle sue aspettative e, quando √® il caso, consiglia luoghi segreti e sconosciuti di questa Venezia sempre da scoprire e ri/scoprire. Rimarchevoli anche le luci leggermente soffuse e la musica mai invadente e scelta anch'essa dalla proprietaria con gusto e competenza. Insomma il tempo passa piacevolmente in questo posto e, anche se √® la prima volta che ci si entra, sembra di averlo sempre conosciuto perch√© ha la capacit√† di adeguarsi alle aspettative di ogni cliente.

I had chosen a starter portion as my main which was delicious but sadly my husbands veg curry came in a very thin sauce and some of the veg looked like they had been stewed for a very long time. reviews.text: We so enjoyed our dinner that we we returned for a second experience.  A great restaurant recommended to us by our hotel receptionist. We loved the intimate atmosphere, the excellent choice of food, and the delicious wine. And the very good service. The deserts were especially divine! There were very few if any empty tables which is always a good sign that all is well in this gem of a restaurant.

reviews.text:
Located just off Campo San Luca, this is a cozy restaurant with a very nice interior. 
We ate lunch here on April 4 and when we entered at 1345, there were a few tables occupied but was not crowded. Service was OK; food was good, but on the high side. The Calamari was ‚Ç¨17, Caprese was ‚Ç¨12, Spaghetti Pomodoro was ‚Ç¨10. Not a lot high, about ‚Ç¨2 more per dish than other restaurants. Total for 3 for lunch was ‚Ç¨96 and this included 2 house desserts and a caffee americano on top of the lunch food. It was an enjoyable meal in a very comfortable atmosphere.

reviews.text:
Went to this place for dinner while in Venice right before a storm. The awning broke & the dining area flooded due to heavy rains  which happens. During this time they had us mill around the inside seating &  when rain stopped put us back outside in damp seating. 
  There was a 2 person wait staff & they were slow...the assistant server acted like she couldn‚Äôt be bothered by tourist & claimed they were busy...all the while folding napkins. Overall, avoid this place - much better places in venice
reviews.title: Poor service- better places in Venice

reviews.text: We stopped in for lunch on a hot day after visiting the basilica. We were seated right away in the back patio, which was cooler because it was all in the shade. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, and we enjoyed our pasta dishes. No complaints.

reviews.text: As an Italian, finding good food in Venice has been a mission. In this place we got normal tomato spaghetti and it was good. I don‚Äôt know how fresh the seafood is. Prices are moderate.

reviews.text: Good located, good menu but can provide better service. Take quite long to get the attention of he staff. Anyway, you can enjoy a good dinner if you go with your friends which is the most important.
reviews.title: Good location but can be better

reviews.text: We were visiting Venice few days ago and tried to have a nice meal here, but... we have ordered lasagna,half of it wascold and costed 13eur. There was also 2.5 eur per person service fee, no free water (usually restaurants offers water for free). While salads which other tables ordered looked quite good.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text:
This was our fourth visit to Venice and overall, we had much better food throughout our stay because of our reliance on online reviews.  The Osteria Leon Bianco would be near the bottom of our eight sit-down meals.  There was nothing very bad here, but nothing stood out as very good, either.

The bread was really sub-par.  I read in one management response that they source their bread from a famous nearby bakery...you can keep it.  The service was under-manned.  The mixed-seafood was just ok.  The one memorable highlight was desert.  

We've had much worse in tourist destinations in Italy.  If you're hungry and close by, you might give this place a try.  I don't understand how this place is so highly rated. 
 We wouldn't return here, as you could do so much better.
reviews.title: "Average" Means Just That

reviews.text: We stayed right around the corner and visited Leon Bianco for dinner on our second night. We were not disappointed! The food was very good, wine was great, staff was lovely, and the cozy garden was perfect on a beautiful Venice evening.
reviews.title: Cozy family dinner - perfect ambience

reviews.text: Si vous √™tes amateur de poissons, c‚Äôest l‚Äôendroit id√©al pour le d√©guster, vous ne serez pas d√©√ßu de la qualit√© et de la quantit√©. Le service est parfait, le personnel parle Fran√ßais et vous donne toutes les explications que vous souhaitez. De l‚Äôext√©rieur l‚Äôendroit ne paye pas de mine mais √† l‚Äôint√©rieur une belle salle et surtout √† l‚Äôarri√®re une belle petite cour ou vous pourrez passer un agr√©able moment.
reviews.title: Une table excellente

reviews.text: I went for dinner with my daughter, we sat inside although there was also a few tables outside. It wasn't too busy at all and we were served right away. The food was delightful! My daughter's duck was beautifully cooked and tender, the caprese salad was refreshing and the mozzarella was creamy, my spaghetti alla vongole was fresh and tasty and they were very generous  with  the clams. The waitress recommended the Venetian cream for dessert which was like a tiramisu without the coffee. It was perfect since my daughter hates coffee but loves cream! The service, atmosphere and food was wonderful and I would rate it all a 5 out of 5! Would defo recommend for families and couples visiting venice!
reviews.title: Great restaurant to visit in Venice

reviews.text: My wife and I went there on a rainy day close to our hotel and were amazed by the food. I had the lasagna and my wife had the ravioli in a butter sauce. It was incredible! Highly recommend for anyone in Venice!
reviews.title: Phenomenal food!

reviews.text: Ci siamo recati in questo ristorante. Personale cortese. Due primi a base di pesce, spaghetti al nero seppia, due secondi a base di pesce, frittura calamari e seppie in umido, due calici di bianco, una bottiglia acqua, due dolci e caff√®. Spesa 98 euro, proporzionata alla citt√†, direi buona la qualit√†.
reviews.title: Week end Venezia

reviews.text:
On our last trip to Venice 2 years ago we came across this osteria tucked away in a small  "street" just off Campo San Luca (where we were staying) and ended up dining there twice in 3 days.

Having spent 20+ hours in transit from Australia, and being dog-tired, we headed straight here for dinner as we knew the quality of the establishment wouldn't disappoint.

My wife had a simple Prosciutto and Melon starter followed by sardines and prawns - a generous serve whch didn't disappoint the taste buds.

My starter of mussels and vongole served in a broth was exceptional.  A generous serve of both molluscs filled the bowl and the mussels in particular were sweet and sizeable pieces of meat.  There was plenty of bread provided to sop up the juices!

I'm not a big offal fan, but decided on this trip that nothing was off limits, so my choice for mains was the local "delicacy" of Fegato Vitello (veal liver and onions).  A generous serving of small pieces of fried liver smothered in onions bathed in a sweet and not too acidic sauce.

The dish was exceptionally tasty and my only "complaint" was that the liver may have been slightly overcooked - I was expecting it to be a little pink inside, but that's just me.

We both struggled to clear both plates so dessert as a no-go. I'd perhaps only question the value for money aspect of the meal, 81 euros for 4 simple (but delicious) dishes plus 3 glasses of house wine - but then again, Venice is not a cheap place to eat generally.  The service on the other hand was faultless.

A very enjoyable experience and this place is definitely on our permanent dining list in Venice.

PS Weather permitting, there is a very pleasant outdoor courtyard at the rear of the main dining room which also accommodates plenty of seated dining space.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text:
This place is fantastic. The food was the best we had whilst in Venice, so good that we went twice in three days.

It is a very relaxed restaurant but the staff are attentive and friendly. 

The Spaghetti Ragu is so unbelievably good as is the Spaghetti Pomodoro. We didn't have desserts as we were too full after starters and mains, but the ones I saw being taken to other customers tables looked beautiful.

This place is a must for anyone visiting Venice.
reviews.title: Best we had

reviews.text:
The highly visible restaurants on the streets in Venice have a sameness about their menus and their appearance.  They all do the classics: lots of seafood, the classic pasta dishes for primi, predictable secundi both on the carne front and on the pesce front.  And it is difficult to tell the better restaurants by their appearance; they all look busy, overtraded, and a little jaded.

My wanderings of an aftternoon took me past Osteria Leon Bianco, 20 metres from the Campo Luca.  A peep at the menu showed a few unusual menu items.  Duck featured both as a ragu for a pasta primo and a roast duck breast as a secundo.  It also had a polenta and grilled cheese as a secundo.

Intrigued by duck ragu I went there for supper with my wife.  It was when I was given the wine list that everything changed.  There was a bottle of Farnito Cabernet Sauvignon 2012 on the wine list at E56.  The wine is regarded by some as a super-Tuscan and it is unquestionably an above average wine by any account.

When I showed an interest in above-average wines (I am a garagiste winemaker and have made 20 vintages of Cabernet Sauvignon myself) the host disappeared to his wine cabinet and trotted out a 2006 bottle of the same wine, a 1997 Sasscaia, a 2002 Sasssicia, and a 1999 Antinori Tignanello.  He could not immediately put a price to the vintage wines, apart from the Farnito, which he offered to me for E90.  The others, he said, were the preserve of his brother, who was responsible for the top-notch wines and with whom he would have to confer before sellilng them.  

I asked how they had been cellared.  The restaurant, he informed me, bought its own wines young and had cellared them all since their release.

The only one which was going to fall within my budget (at a stretch) was the other bottle of Farnito.  So we enjoyed our meal, made a reservation for the following day, and came back to finish off the 2006 bottle.

Both my wine and food, on both evenings, were good.  I had the duck ragu on the first evening, the roast duck breast (done to dark pink perfection.  My wife was had gnocchi with spinach and smoked ricotta, which she enjoyed, and I enjoyed my little taster too.  Caprese salads on both nights were good: fresh and light, with proper mozzarella di bufala.

Our welcome on both evenings was warm and not overly attentive.

I recommend this restaurant highly.
reviews.title: A gem of a restaurant - and what a wine list!

reviews.text: Situ√© au c≈ìur de Venise, un peu √† l'√©cart des rues tr√®s fr√©quent√©es. Accueil et service sympathiques. Les p√¢tes √©taient bonnes. Prix corrects.

reviews.text: One of the worst meals of my life. Mozzarella was terrible. The bread was frozen and just pulled out ‚Äî terrible.  The mixed seafood grill was inedible - no pinbones were pulled from the fish, old tuna, inedible calamari ‚Äî absolutely terrible. The lamb ‚Äúspecial‚Äù was a mockery.  Boiled lamb parts with barely any meat and mostly boiled fat.  I got 4 rib racks ‚Äî without the meat ‚Äî just the boiled bones.  Do not visit.

name: Club del Doge Restaurant
address: Campo Santa Maria del Giglio, 2467 c/o The Gritti Palace, 30124 Venice Italy

reviews.text:
Venezia √® una citt√† straordinaria e l'Hotel Gritti con l'annesso Ristorante Club del Doge non sono certamente da meno! 
Ho pranzato alcune volte al Ristorante e anche in quest'ultima occasione l'esperienza √® stata di altissimo livello. 
Il cibo mi √® stato servito da personale cortesissimo e attento, mai invasivo, sulla superlativa terrazza fronte Canal Grande. 
Il risotto alla Hemingway era eccezionale, tanto che ho richiesto in seguito la ricetta che mi √® stata prontamente inviata via mail, in maniera molto dettagliata, complimenti!
Dopo il risotto ho gustato un ottimo tiramis√π. 
Conto adeguato al cibo e alla location. 
Consiglio assolutamente il ristorante Club del Doge! 
Grazie ancora a tutto lo Staff con l‚Äôarrivederci alla prossima occasione!
reviews.title: Superlativo!

reviews.text: Location suggestiva tipica della stile veneziano. Il servizio ottimo ed il personale preparato. Ie portare sono ben presentate e quello che abbiamo scelto √® stato di nostro gradimento.

reviews.text: Both the restaurant and lounge bar overlook the Grand Canal and perhaps its most  stunning view.  But on hot summer  afternoons a canooy is rolled over the terrace that unfortunately obscures the magnificent Santa Maria della Salute as you sit at your shaded table.  Whether you enjoy an aperitive, a snack or something more adventurous it is the 'ensemble'  that one digests.  The elegant palace rooms, the obliging staff,  the menu and the knowledge that you're experiencing one of those " 100 places not to miss in your lifetime".  Food is good of course, but wouldn't be worth the price if it were not for the rest.  Two interesting starters, 2 fish mains (ample but not memorable), 2 satisfactory sweets, 2 glasses of Pinot Grigio, bottle sparkling water and one espresso.  TOTAL:  ‚Ç¨245,00.  Not to be missed - once !
reviews.title: NOT TO BE MISSED  -  ONCE !

reviews.text: Wow! This restaurant is amazing! The best and most friendliest service Venice has to offer and the food is amazing.
reviews.title: Wow! This restaurant is amazing!

reviews.text: If you are looking for a high status restaurant and ready to splurge, this is your place. The interior is top-notch and resembles that Italian-Renaissance artwork, with chandeliers and curving gold furniture. It captures the classic of Italian food, I ordered the assortment of Venetian Cicchetti and spaghettini with cuttlefish and spring onion. The food was delicious and the presentation was almost too pretty to eat. Everything was cooked just right and the flavor was bursting.
reviews.title: Magnificent First Class Resturant !

reviews.text:
The only thing I enjoyed was the view of the canal. My bf and I decided this would be the one restaurant we‚Äôd splurge on in hopes for a great fine dining experience. We‚Äôre both foodies and we were overall disappointed by our dishes- the taste was underwhelming and portion sizes were small for what you‚Äôre paying.
DISHES: 
 I got the lamb 3 ways and it was probably the worst dish I had in Italy, and most expensive. 
They do have great olive oil And the cuttlefish dish was decent. 
Overall: 
If I could do it again though I‚Äôd  go anywhere else in Venice.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the food

reviews.text:
Premier restaurant le soir de notre arrivee le 28/10.
Des prix au dela du pensable, des serveurs (pas tous mais la majorit√©) plus commerciaux que serveurs, on ne nous explique pas la carte, et le plus grand moment fut celui de l'addition dans laquelle on decouvre 30‚Ç¨ de "copperti". A savoir qu'en Italie on paye les couverts (c'est ce que nous a expliqu√© le serveur avec un air hautain quand on lui a pos√© la question), qu'en principe tous les restaurants doivent l'inscrire sur leur carte et qu'effectivement en se penchant sur le sujet on s'est rendu compte que soit c'etait de 2 √† 4‚Ç¨ soit environ 12% de l'addition. Non seulement l√† c'etait notifi√© nulle part mais en plus c'est tres √©lev√© et tres exager√© par rapport √†la soiree passee.
Nous sommes de√ßus. Avec un tarif de menus pareil ils pourraient s'abstenir ca ne fera pas baisser leur chiffre d'affaire!!!!
Je ne le conseille pas.
reviews.title: Voleurs!

reviews.text: A truly first-class restaurant in Venice. However, the prices go along with the restaurant's status so be prepared for sticker shock.  Please note that the dinner menu can be challenging, reflecting the latest trends of high class restaurants to outdo each other with their ‚Äúartistic‚Äù flair and presentation and unusual and creative (?) food combination skills. For us that regrettably loses sight of the principal focus of a great meal which should be on taste! Lunch, however, at the Gritti should not be missed.
reviews.title: Great but ....

reviews.text: Sehr sch√∂nes Restaurant mit Terrasse mit wundersch√∂ner Aussich auf la salute.. freundliche Bedienung, sehr gutes Essen.. eher gehobene K√ºche aber wunderbar,,, immer gerne wieder...

reviews.text:
Acceuil parfait, service professionnel et agr√©able.
Les plats (filets de sole)√©taient tr√®s savoureux, les desserts (souflets)√† tomber.

reviews.title: Parfait

reviews.text:
We went friends for drinks then dinner in the Gritti Palace and were overwhelmed by the beautiful view of the water and the magnificent rooms inside.  We found everyone to be gracious and welcoming.  

We had our drinks, a gentleman brought us numerous appetizers, and as we enjoyed them, we were able to look at the menu and order our dinners.

Once the dinners were ready, we were brought into the beautiful dining room  and were seated at our table that was set with lovely linens and a gorgeous floral arrangement.  Small stools were placed by the ladies‚Äô chairs to hold purses.  From the starters through the desserts, the staff could not have been more attentive.  This was truly an elegant evening to cherish.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.text: The restaurant was very beautiful and elegant. We enjoyed the meal very much. The amuse bouch√©e was a nice touch. The risotto and the fish of the day were both excellent, but I wish we had shared dished because neither of us could finish and it was expensive to waste. The tiramisu was the best I e ever had. I recommend going!
reviews.title: Beautiful Venice restaurant

reviews.text: Beautiful view by the canal. Gondolas everywere with singers made the atmosphere even more special. Food amazing but small portions. Loved the olive oil.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text:
We were fortunate to have a beautiful evening for dinner and were seated outside on the Grand Canal.  The restaurant looks across the water at the Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute and there may not be a better view in Venice.  

There were some missteps on our wine and food service but the food and the wine itself were good.  It was a busy time (with the Biennale and Film Festival) so the staff was running the whole night.  With all of that going on, I felt they did well.  Next time we may try lunch before we commit to dinner again.

All of that said, it really was beautiful and it is worth a visit.
reviews.title: Meal Was Good - the View Was Amazing.

reviews.text:
mi ero promesso di recensire questo ristorante, la mia vista risale a un po‚Äô di tempo fa.

reviews.text:
I pre booked this in advance so I would have a wonderful View. I wish I could remember my waiters name oh, he was quite lovely! The service was superb as it should be for the prices. I feel that they lived up to their expectations. I had an Aperol Spritzer, an appetizer tasting menu, pinot noir, the chef's tasting menu & coffee with my dessert- AND WHAT A VIEW!!! I was even lucky enough to have Gondolier's passing in front of my table serenading their customers :) I ate my entrees outside and took my dessert and coffee inside the bar lounge area. 
It is located inside the gritti palace right next to a Gondolier station. Was Lovely from start to finish!
reviews.title: Birthday Treat Fancy Venetian Style!

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Gritti Palace and ate two of our three dinners here as well as breakfast every morning.  The food was excellent.  They had a children‚Äôs menu for the kids.  The pasta, fish, and other food was excellent.  The wine list was also great with options at all price points.  Alessandro was particularly helpful and greeted us warmly every night and held a special table for us.  We highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Wonderful restaurant

reviews.text: Our dinner tonight was intended to be a memorable end to our two weeks in Europe. The setting on the terrace on the Grand Canal was perfect. The restaurant runs an Epicurean school so the prices are stratospheric. Unfortunately our meals were nothing special. I had the rabbit ravioli is a primo and while the pasta itself was tasty, I could not taste any rabbit. The main course was pigeon and it was bland. The only sign of seasoning was on the skin of the lone leg bone. And this was the dish the waiter recommended as emblematic of the chef‚Äôs style. There were glitches in the service too. The first table we were seated at had a dirty knife which had attracted ants. Later, after we ordered decaf cafe americano with dessert, we were served espresso instead.
reviews.title: Pretentious

reviews.text:
Great location and service good BUT tasting menu at ¬£160 was average and they try to rush courses to free up tables.  It was obvious.  Plate up plate down! We had to ask them to stop so we could digest!   Drinks extortionate, outside hotel an Aperol Spritz is 4/6 Euros, at Del Doge table it was 26 euros! 

Won‚Äôt be back as it just wasn‚Äôt good value 
DO GO TO Il Ridotto though superb food service and value

reviews.text: Rip off!!! I have been to fine dining restaurants all over the world and this one is not worth the hefty tag! The view is gorgeous, but you can go to Grand Canal restaurant for the same view or elsewhere. They messed up my husband‚Äôs first course and brought out a half sliced grape tomato and half piece of burrata to make up for it ( we laughed at the size). They then messed up what we each got twice. I ordered a pasta as my main dish. I got four tiny pieces of ravioli for $40. Let me tell you: each piece of tiny pasta was NOT worth $10. It should have been to die for! If someone orders a pasta as a main dish they should give you more than four tiny pieces. The prices of bottles of wine were RIDICULOUS! They started at over $100 and went up to $2,000 ( Stop it!). This establishment is not worth saying you went because some annoying or obnoxious Americans can prove they have the money to go! Avoid at all costs.

reviews.text: Top quality tasting menu, with perfect wine pairing. Service was as good as it‚Äôs gets. And when you combine that with the view it‚Äôs something you will remember for the rest of your life.

reviews.text:

Se√±alar que el servicio de este restaurante ( no incluyo al Chef ) es excelente tanto desde la chica de recepci√≥n que nos intent√≥ ubicar donde quer√≠amos y nos pidi√≥ disculpas por el retraso hasta los camareros y sumiller que fueron muy amables. El resto de platos as√≠ como los vinos fueron de lo mas aceptables y como colof√≥n me prometieron una "sorpresa" por ser nuestro aniversario de boda que supongo seria la factura porque sino a√∫n la sigo esperando... No lo recomiendo, por ese precio comes en un 3 Estrellas Michelin.

reviews.text: Wanting a nice restaurant for a romantic dinner in Venice I settled on this location based on reviews on several sites. Absolutely fantastic in no way did it disappoint. The food was fantastic, and the service was spectacular!!! Every course was as good or better then the next. We began with drinks and starters next door then went for a Gondola ride and back for our seating time 20 min early. We were immediately seated next to the water as requested in our reservation. From the time we were seated the service was spot on. Although this location is listed as a higher priced restaurant I would say it‚Äôs pretty average. But the food and service are well above average. This is a must stop and enjoy the evening restaurant. Read the dress code!!!!! If you can‚Äôt dress respectable for a few hours for a romantic dinner then go down the alley and eat a cafe pizza!!

reviews.text:

reviews.text:
Das beste war der Blick und der von uns ausgesuchte Wein.
Wir hatten einen Tisch f√ºr 19:00 Uhr reserviert. Wir kamen um 18:40 Uhr an und uns wurde gesagt: ‚Äû Das Restaurant √∂ffnet um 19:00 Uhr, Sie sind zu fr√ºh‚Äú.
Niemand sagte, ‚Äûnehmen Sie doch auf der Terrasse Platz f√ºr einen Apero oder so, man lie√ü uns einfach stehen.

reviews.text: This was our Honeymoon splurge meal for our last night. We did call the day before and made reservations at about 8:15pm no problem. The setting was perfect, on their floating canal view dining room. It was a bit chilly, but they had heating lamps on the patio which gave a rosy glow to the evening and also offered complimentary blanket shawls to keep everyone comfortable. The food is high price but absolutely worth it. We got a lower end bottle of wine [45 Euro], the Venetian seafood sampler, two courses each as well as dessert. With my cafe latte they brought a dish of complimentary cookies and they wrote a special "Happy Honeymoon" message on our dessert presentation. The server was wonderful! Not uppity, but still very professional and classy, he was very warm and friendly and we had alot of fun while still feeling very high class. It was the fanciest meal I've ever had and felt waited on hand and foot without feeling any stuck up vibes from the staff. The food was fabulous, each dish was very distinct. I highly recommend the veal cheek, it just melted in your mouth. Every dish was a treat and an experience of its own, nothing disappointed! We ended up paying about 350 euro for everything and added a tip for the waiter since he made our time there so special. I will definitely go here again when I return to Venice!
reviews.title: Last Night in Venice

reviews.text:
Magia allo stato puro!!! Da vivere almeno una volta nella vita. Lo chef bravissimo, il servizio √® attento e premuroso con nota di merito per la simpatia ed eleganza del maitre.
Ottimo i ravioli al baccal√† con crema di prezzemolo ed il baccal√† con carbonara. Mi √® piaciuta meno la tarte tatin. Ottimo, elegante, atmosfera accogliente e intima!!!
reviews.title: Ottimo!!

reviews.text:
Partiamo dalla cosa positiva: la location √® molto bella, adatta anche per una grande occasione, antica, in pieno stile veneziano e con un bellissimo panorama sul Canal Grande in caso di utilizzo della terrazza. 
La qualit√† del cibo era buona e quindi mi dispiace avere delle cose negative da dire ma bisogna farlo, e la nota negativa √® il prezzo. 
Va bene che siamo a Venezia e in un grande albergo e che quindi tutto √® pi√π caro, ma se mi chiedi 14‚Ç¨ di servizio e 10‚Ç¨ per una bottiglia di acqua mi devi offrire certi standard che in alcune cose sono mancati. 
Con tale costo del servizio mi aspetto un cestino del pane quanto meno con qualche preparazione particolare, non una cosa normale unita alla richiesta di aggiunta di olio. Viene s√¨ portato un pre antipasto ma questo viene portato anche in altri posti di questo tipo. Nota veramente dolente il secondo. Buono il rombo per carit√† ma, se ti metti in un certo standard, nel piatto devono trovarsi solo cose che si possono mangiare e quindi il rombo andrebbe servito senza le spine. Perch√© non spetta a me stare attento se ci siano o meno ma a fronte di certi costi i piatti penso vadano serviti in un certo modo. 
Niente da dire sulla cortesia del personale di sala che √® stato gentile e cortese in tutto ma a fronte di costo cos√¨ alti per me non ci deve essere niente che non va. Potevo fare presenti le mie rimostranze al momento ma ho voluto prendere del tempo per pensarci, e per quanto mi sia ripetuto che molte erano le cose positive,  quelle negative non mi sono proprio andate gi√π. 
Preciso che ero conscio di dove stavo andando, in quale contesto mi trovassi e che prezzi proponesse. 
E sono pi√π che disponibile a pagare una cifra pi√π alta del normale per una cena ma se lo faccio penso debbano osservarsi certi standard che qui sono mancati. 
Peccato davvero perch√© la cornice merita veramente, ma a fronte di certe richieste la location per me non √® sufficiente.
reviews.title: Bene ma non benissimo

reviews.text: We saved the best for our last night in magical Venice and dined at the Club del Doges in the Gritti Palace. Wonderful seating facing the Grand Canal & enjoyed the Gondolas passing by as we enjoyed our gourmet meal. A very special restaurant in a unique city - Venice.
reviews.title: Club del Doges in the Gritti Palace

reviews.text:
We thought the highlights are the ambiance/room, service, and food - in that order. Although some of the food was not all that memorable or supremely exquisite, the whole experience is greater than the sum of its parts because the service has GRACE. The service was well orchestrated, and we were served by many different gentlemen who each had a part to play. 
Hemingway risotto was good. The highlight of food was the beef filet for two, carved tableside. This was truly the best beef (most tender, and also most flavorful) of our lives, costly but well worth it. I do recommend this beef as top choice!  Other reviews I noticed complaining of tough beef, wow, that is not our experience whatsoever. I think they would quickly remedy if that complaint was made.
It's hard to convey the comfortable warmth of the room and the surroundings in general. I think it suffices to say that the ambiance is as good as most Michelin 1-2 star places, and the service is also at that level, but it is friendly and not snobby. If the food got a bit more creative, this could easily be a 1 star.
Note that prices are high as befitting what you get. Total for three of us with one bottle of wine was about $550 USD. The cover charge is high, not clear what is provided for that cover...we felt, not much. Perhaps another in-between amuse bouche would make it more justified to charge this cover. The wine prices are also high but not outrageous, it feels like they made a decision not to go overboard on the wine price and just mark up 1.5x or 2x, NOT the 3x or even up to 4x that seems to pervade the highest level luxury hotel restaurants.
Do dress up to befit the room. We saw a variety of dress styles, although we were in jackets. It calls for at least a khakis and long-sleeve collared shirt for men, at a minimum.
I would absolutely go again.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience, the whole package

reviews.text:
Six of us dined here for lunch on Christmas day and we were all delighted with the experience. The food was delicious, wine excellent and service just right. The atmosphere was sophisticated and unhurried, perfect for a special occasion. 
We had a bottle of Prosecco, 2 bottles of red wine, starters, main courses and a few of us had a pudding and the bill came to around ¬£120 each which was very good value considering the venue and quality of food.
reviews.title: Perfect Christmas lunch
