My main course was spaghetti with clams...all excellent! The service was very good except at the end when I ordered a tiramisu and mentioned to the waiter I wanted to finish my dessert in my room....he said it wasn't allowed! Wow, really? I also want to mention that I feel the restaurant is a bit over-priced.

Nous avons tellement aim√© que nous y avons pris tous nos repas du soir. Nous avons visit√© toute la carte sans jamais √™tre d√©√ßus. Bons produits, bien cuisine et bien pr√©sent√©s. reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel and booked dinner at this charming restaurant. The food was average but the view spectacular. Unfortunately,  my request for a table by the waiter was met with the rudest treatment, verbally and physically, I have ever experienced by wait staff. Having a waiter on staff who is so rude to your customers is a way to lose business fast. I approached the manager on the other side of the restaurant and we were seated by the waters edge. No tip and I will never return (We recently moved to Trieste and expect to bring our visitors to Venice from time to time)

reviews.title: Top quality and very professional

reviews.text: Cibo di livello ,cucina molto curata ,prezzi al di sopra della norma ma come del resto su tutta Venezia ,servizio ottimo

reviews.text: Il primo maggio a Venezia rovinato dal pranzo. Il ristorante come cucina(abbiamo mangiato solo primi) nella media, ma manca totalmente il fattore igiene, le tovaglie monouso messe sopra la tovaglia di tessuto nn vengono cambiate se non presentano le macchie evidenti... il personale sprepara il tavolo e toglie eventuali briciole dalla tovaglia monouso  utilizzato tovagliolo  del cliente precedente. Il ghiaccio per  le bevande viene messo dentro i bicchieri con le mani... rimangono perfino le posate del cliente precedente se non sembrano usate... il pane messo nei cestini con le mani di personale che prima porta via piatti sporchi ..., aggiungo che per nostra sfortuna il tipo tossiva di continuo su tutto. Concludo -vergognatevi.

reviews.text: Having been recommended to visit here we were excited to visit. Unfortunately it did not live up to expectation. The surrounding inside was a nice old fashioned style hotel restaurant. The food was mediocre. The starters were nice and tasty but the huge portions were off putting.  The duck was rubbery and inedible. The pizzas were fine but noting special. Unfortunately our waiter was particularly  rude and made us Feel u welcome. I will not return.
reviews.title: Very disappointing restaurant in a beautiful setting

reviews.text: Elegantly stylish and romantic inside, with attentive but unobtrusive waiters. Well presented, delicious food, including seafood risotto, venetian style liver and onions (with a gorgeous glass of Barolo) and Vin Santo & biscotti to finish. Molto buona! Grazie mille!

Bref une tr√®s bonne surprise que cette ancienne Pensione!

reviews.text: We had heard good things about the hotel, and booked lunch as part of our whirlwind 36 hours in Venice.  We were rather too early in the season to enjoy the pontoon tables but we had requested an outdoor table in case the weather was good, and it was a balmy 20 degrees and wonderful to sit outdoors under the canopy, which staff lowered a little more for us.  Sardine saor (delicious) was shared between three of us; delicious prosecco; and spaghetti a la vongole to die for.  Flavoursome, nicely proportioned dishes, served beautifully.

reviews.text: We arrived to Venice today and spited the place on the way to the hotel. Atmosphere is very relaxed and quite, no bright lights. Service is great. Food and wine are great. Tried spaghetti with calmi, melagnese and for desert tiramisu and panna cotta, with local wine. Prices are reasonable 100‚Ç¨ for 2 people. Would recommend this place for quite romantic dinner.

reviews.text: A pesar de q fuera marzo, sol, vistas a la Giudecca, buen servicio, precio bastante contenido (esto es Venecia) y buena calidad de la comida (ensalada Caprese, Lasa√±a, y Pizza Diavola)  y para finalizar un caf√© rico . Con este cocktail de terraza .... que se quite el Flori√°n

reviews.text: We had a great meal at this restaurant. Food was full of flavour and great sized portions. Service was excellent. Yes it‚Äôs not the cheapest place to eat but it‚Äôs worth the extra cost in my opinion. We ate inside the beautiful restaurant with it being March but will definitely try the terrace in summer.
reviews.title: Wonderful evening

reviews.text:
We had spent a week in Italy tasting the very best cuisine in Florence and Venice.
The look and spot of this restaurant catches the eye immediately, so excitedly we got a beautiful spot looking out to the Laguna....Unfortunately the view did not mirror the poor service and tasteless food. 

The lasagne looked like baby food with no taste, I had one mouthful and couldn‚Äôt eat anymore, it was dreadful. The waitress came and took plates, I said it was not good! I got a shrug, no apologies and still got charged.

This was the only bad meal and bad service we had in Venice. Do not eat here!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Ein offensichtlich liebevoll eingerichteter Speiseraum hat uns eingeladen. Leider waren sowohl das milanese wie auch die lasagne von sehr mittelm√§√üiger Qualit√§t, sodass wir das Lokal, zumindest abends nicht empfehlen k√∂nnen - tags√ºber auf der Terrasse √ºber dem Kanal sicher nett...das Personal war sehr nett und aufmerksam

reviews.text: A great terrace close to the water. Good to drink a cocktail but definitely not to eat because of the bird that invite themselves to eat with you. Service not very good...
reviews.title: Nice view

reviews.text: Genoten van het rustgevend uitzicht op het terras tijdens de lunch. Lekker gegeten. Vriendelijkheid personeel kon wat beter.
reviews.title: Prachtig terras!

reviews.text:
We hebben twee keer bij La Calcina geluncht. Beide keren hadden we (51 en 56 jaar) ruim voldoende aan een antipasto, een pasta en dessert (wij sloegen dus het hoofdgerecht, de secondo, over).
Wij waren enthousiast over de antipasto van mosselen en schelpen, de risotto met saffraan, de spaghetti met schelpen, de radicchio salade met spek en over klassiekers zoals de spaghetti met tomaat en basilicum en de tiramisu met Siciliaanse  accenten (sinaasappel...).
Als je binnen eet, bij regen of kou, raden we je aan om van te voren een tafel aan het raam te reserveren. Wanneer de zon schijnt moet je echt buiten op het terras zitten en de zilte zeelucht ruiken wanneer je een spaghetti alle vongole eet.
De bediening is vriendelijk en attent en hebben plezier in hun werk. Klasse!
reviews.title: Prima restaurant voor vis en schaaldieren op een schitterend terras

reviews.text:
Annesso alla pensione da cui prende il nome questo.piccolo ristorante ha il suo punto di forza in un pontile estivo attaccato alle Zattere ma anche in inverno,  cenare nella sua accogliente sala, √®  piacevole. I tavoli sono un po' piccoli e  vicini e il locale non √®  arioso a causa del soffitto piuttosto basso e alle tappezzerie scure  pero' si sta benone.
 I camerieri sono cortesi e il menu' offre piatti tradizionali piuttosto buoni. Stonano sul menu' dato la pretesa  chic del locale,  le pizze e le insalatone che proporrei solo nel menu ' a pranzo.

Les tasses n'√©taient pas hyper clean, √ßa rajoute √† la d√©ception. De plus, la baie vitr√©e semblant en excellent √©tat mais laissant passer l'air ext√©rieur, il y avait un fort courant d'air froid √† certains endroits du salon... We were meandering along looking for a place for lunch and came across this busy trattoria. I‚Äôm always happy to go somewhere busy, because it usually means the food is good.
It was! And plentiful-portions are enormous, so if you don‚Äôt have a big appetite, order one plate between two.
We ordered a plate of Italian cheeses to share, which probably would have fed four and included a delicious ginger-flavoured jam accompaniment.
My husband had prosciutto and burrata and I had cod brandade (which had lovely fish mousse topped crostini and slivers of grilled polenta)
All in all, the food was really good. We were watching steaming plates of pasta going past, as well as giant rounds of freshly cooked pizza.
I would highly recommend.
Prices fair

Una bottiglia d‚Äôacqua 4‚Ç¨ mi sembra davvero caro. reviews.text: This lovely little restaurant was close to our hotel and we had dinner there 5 times in a week. We took our American friends there and they asked to go back again as the food and service was much better than their 4* hotel. There's a good variety of dishes on the menu, even though neither of us can eat fish. Every day they had special offers, which were exceptionally good value and very tasty. Sam and Fridi are both superb waiters, with Sam being very helpful explaining dishes as he served us every time we went in there. All the dishes are cooked to order and the liver cooked Italian style is amazingly tasty so I ordered it on two occasions! Shame this lovely little restaurant isn't near where we live in England as we'd be in there on a very regular basis!

Mi era stato consigliato dal Direttore del mio Hotel, e sono passata di persona a prenotare un tavolo al
Mattino, x verificare la
Location ( dovevo organizzare 3 pranzi cn gruppi di giornalisti tv e operatori della Rai, in una trattoria della zona ) ed essendo con la mia famiglia con un bimbo piccolo ho chiesto un tavolo lontano dalla porta x evitare a cena di far prendere freddo a mio figlio! Ho specificato l'orario e il tavolo che desideravo, e il cameriere mi ha assicurato che tutto era confermato! Verso sera passo davanti al locale x rientrare in hotel e vedo che il tavolo era occupato e mancava poco piu' di mezz'ora! Chiamo il ristorante per chiedere rassicurazioni sul fatto che alle 19.30
Il tavolo fosse libero per il ns arrivo, il ragazzo che mi risponde al telefono mi conferma che il tavolo verra' liberato ma che l'orario della prenotazione era alle 20, peccato perche' mio figlio piccolo cena sempre vs le 19-19.30.... comunque mi rassicura che alle 20 il tavolo sara' disponibile!!! E invece....al ns arrivo il tavolo era ancora occupato e indovinate dove ci hanno spostato con il tavolo? In quello all'ingresso con la porta aperta, e anche se la chiudevano ogni volta che entravano o uscivano i clienti mio figlio avrebbe preso freddo...
Per tutta risposta uno dei cameriere mi dice: Signora sono dalle 18 che sono qui! 
Affari vostri! Se non avete la capacita' e la professionalita' di saper gestire tavoli e prenotazioni 
Non immaginate il disagio!
A mai piu'.......

Ein sehr tolles Angebot ist das zweig√§ngige Menue, das am Eingang h√§ngt, aber nicht nochmal extra in der Karte steht: zwei vollwertige G√§nge f√ºr 16‚Ç¨, sehr gut.  Die Bedienungen sehr nett, aufmerksam und witzig.  Beim Bezahlen gibt es immer ein Getr√§nk aufs Haus.  Wir kommen wieder nach Venedig und wir werden wieder hier einkehren.

reviews.text:
Wir sind auf den Tipp eines Guides hier zum Mittagessen gewesen. Als wir ankamen - etwas nach 14.00 am Sonntag - war der Laden sehr gut gef√ºllt. Gef√ºhlt waren fast alle G√§ste Italiener - vielleicht sogar Venezianer.
Das Personal war etwas gestresst, gab sich aber M√ºhe allen gerecht zu werden. 
Die Gerichte waren eher einfach, ohne gro√üe Raffinesse, aber ordentlich gemacht. Das Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis ist f√ºr das Zentrum von Venedig zuemlich gut. Alle Gerichte kosten zwischen 15 und 20 Euro und der Hauswein war mit 14 Euro pro Liter g√ºnstig und v√∂llig OK.

reviews.text: Cercavamo un locale tipico, frequentato dai veneziani, in mezzo a tanti ristoranti ‚Äúturistici‚Äù e ci √® stato consigliato l‚ÄôAntico calice: mai scelta fu pi√π azzeccata! Nel menu spiccano i primi con pasta fatta in casa, io ho optato per uno spaghetto allo scoglio fuori menu, porzione davvero abbondante e piatto gustosissimo. Con un primo ero gia sazia, ma si sa che c‚Äô√® sempre spazio per il dolce, cos√¨ ho avuto modo di provare la crostata con marmellata ai frutti di bosco, sempre fatta in casa, e anche qui abbondantissima, sarebbe andata bene per due persone! I prezzi sono onesti, la pasta va dai 15 ai 20‚Ç¨, il dolce 5‚Ç¨, l‚Äôacqua 2! L‚Äôambiente √® rustico, pulito e con la cucina a vista. Se dovessi tornare a Venezia sarebbe tra le prime scelte.

reviews.text: I went in because there were quite a few locals tucking into what looked like decent pasta etc. Huge mistake. Like the previous reviewers this place is not for tourists - the staff are rude and make no effort at all. Although there is clearly a local following the food is really average. My pasta con vongole was a big plate of fat dry noodles with clams the size of clothes moths, and took bloody ages to arrive. There was no steam, no aromatics, no joy. I can make a better vongole! As I was waiting all the tables around me were cleaned and relaid, a personal hate as the bleach always stinks. Nobody asked if my food was ok, or gave a toss. At the end, having spent 51 EUR on lunch, I was not even offered a limoncello. Not that I care because I hate limoncello. But you get my point - they know you are a tourist, but they don't play the game. A horrible, awful, Paris in 1994 type tourist experience. And everywhere else in Venice has been wonderful, so far....Avoid, avoid, avoid.
reviews.title: Arrogant, expensive and average. AVOID!

reviews.text:
Siamo stati in questo ristorante sotto consiglio del nostro B&B, che ci aveva anche "messi in guardia" sulle porzioni molto abbondanti; seguendo il loro consiglio, abbiamo ordinato un primo e un secondo in due (una pasta alla pescatora e un fritto di pesce); abbiamo fatto bene, perch√® abbiamo mangiato abbondantemente dividendo le porzioni. Entrambi i piatti decisamente buoni, siamo rimasti soddisfatti. Il personale gentile e cortese, servizio veloce ed efficiente. P.S. cucina a vista come chicca del locale, nonch√® garanzia di qualit√† e pulizia.
Se vi trovate a Venezia (e volete evitare i soliti posti turistici dove non si mangia granch√® bene e si paga tanto) vi consiglio caldamente questo locale!
reviews.title: Cibo super e porzioni abbondanti

reviews.text:
Me and my friend had dinner in Antico Calice the first night we arrived to Venice. Our first surprise was when we learned that there is no printed menu, but some notes written on a blackboard only in Italian (no English translation). We thought, perhaps that is a sign of rather a local place and were looking forward for a nice meal. We have chosen to go for a mixed vegetable salad and rice risotto with a cuttlefish - a typical Venetian dish. The salad was served without any type of seasoning and nothing was offered on side, the risotto was even more disappointing since it looked and tasted like pre-cooked and reheated dish. The staff was not terrible but neither friendly, we had a feeling that we are not very welcome. In addition, the menu was very poor and not compared to the images shared by other reviewers in TripAdvisor.
It might be that there is a staff shortening or other kind of problems related to pandemics, but currently the restaurant is not worth a visit.
reviews.title: Re-heated risotto and unfriendly staff

reviews.text:
Abbiamo cenato all'antico calice di suggerimento del responsabile del B&B. L'antico calice √® una trattoria, senza fronzoli, semplice, genuina, non c'√® da aspettarsi la cena a lume di candela ma state certo che non delude, anzi, sareste pronti a ritornarci! La freschezza del pesce e la semplicit√† delle preparazioni √® la chiave del successo, per non parlare delle porzioni: abbondantissime! 
Abbiamo mangiato un piatto fuori men√π, tagliatelle al granchio che non dimenticher√≤ facilmente, uno spaghetto allo scoglio (in realt√† lo chiamano in un altro modo) buonissimo ed infine una frittura di pesce molto fresca. Unico neo, delle verdurine fritte congelate nella frittura. L'ho fatto notare al momento del conto e qui l'altra sorpresa, il personale ci ha tenuto a mostrarmi la freschezza dei loro prodotti, cosa di cui assicuro non dubitavo, e sono stati gentilissimi nell'ascoltare il consiglio di un cliente che se potesse ci tornerebbe senza dubbi. Un litro di vino della casa abbiamo pagato 75 ‚Ç¨. Grappa ed amaro offerti al momento del conto. Ultima menzione alla cameriera, molto simpatica e sempre attenta! Speravo di mangiare cos√¨ in centro a Venezia, mi avete sorpreso!
reviews.title: Se si tramanda dal 1500 ci sar√† un motivo...

reviews.text: Eine sehr typische Trattoria nahe dem Markusplatz. Man m√∂chte kaum glauben, dass man so nah an den touristischen Zentren der Stadt ein Lokal findet, das so typische und unverf√§lschte Gerichte anbietet. Die Speisekarte steht auf der Tafel an der Wand. Im Juni 2020 fast nur von Einheimischen besucht und von solchen empfohlen kann die K√ºche mit ihren Fisch- und Fleischgerichten voll √ºberzeugen. Hoffentlich bleibt alles so, auch wenn wieder viel mehr Touristen Venedig besuchen werden. Filetto di Manzo f√ºr 22,00 ‚Ç¨, Tagliata 18,00 ‚Ç¨, jeweils √ºppig und auf den Punkt gebraten. Hauswein gut und g√ºnstig, insgesamt ein in jeder Hinsicht voll befriedigendes Erlebnis.
reviews.title: Essen bei den Venezianern

reviews.text:
Ogni anno in occasione del Carnevale, pronotiamo qui la cena del sabato.
Anche quest'anno (22/02/2020) terremo fede a questa buona abitudine.
reviews.title: Piacevole consuetudine!!!

reviews.text: Attirati dalla presenza di un sacco di gondolieri abbiamo scelto di consumare qui il pranzo. Infinita disponibilit√† nel preparare subito un piatto di pasta per la nostra piccola ci hanno conquistato con un antipasto misto di pesce e con un fritto misto infinito e un fegato alla veneziana fantastico. Porzioni importanti, prezzo super vista quantit√† e qualit√†.
reviews.title: Una meraviglia

reviews.text: Beau cadre, belle cuisine, on en peut que recommander ce petit restaurant situ√© au coeur de la ville magique.
reviews.title: Belle cuisine italiennne

reviews.text:
Il rischio a Venezia √® di mangiare men√π turistici e pagare molto: qui invece cucina tipica, genuina e con ottimo rapporto qualit√†/prezzo. Abbiamo mangiato circondati da gondolieri e questo √® una garanzia che il locale non √® frequentato da turisti.
Ottimo il baccal√† e molto buono anche il tris in saor e i bigoli in salsa.
Consigliatissimo.
reviews.title: Fuori dalle tratte turistiche

reviews.text: Tr√®s joli restaurant a l'accueil chaleureux entre San Marco et le Pont de Rialto. On y mange tr√®s bien. Les fetuccines √† l'encre de seiches sont parfaites, la viande est extra mais attention les l√©gumes ne sont pas compris. Les desserts sont bons. On recommande.
reviews.title: Tr√®s bon resto entre San Marco et Rialto

reviews.text: We stopped in for lunch on the recommendation of a nearby clothing store saleslady.  We asked for a good pasta place and her tip was spot on! My wife and I chose the pasta with mussels for two.  Service was "relaxed" but that's part of dining in Italy.  The food was worth the wait.  The pasta was perfectly prepared "al dente" and the sauce was delicious.  We wish we had time to come back to try some other dishes, but we were on a cruise ship and left that afternoon.
reviews.title: Great pasta of course.

reviews.text: I read reviews that they do not like tourists here.  This was not our experience and they treated us wonderfully.  This is a favorite spot for the gondoliers to eat at.  We sat next to two of them and they were so fun. In fact, after lunch, we found one of them and he took us around the canal.  Our waitress was the only one that spoke English at the restaurant and she was nice and helpful in what to order.  We had the appetizer platter as we wanted to have a taste of everything followed by the clams vongole and husband had the pasta ragu.  Portions are huge and enough for sharing.  It was our first lunch in Venice and ate more than we should.  Perfect spot to go for lunch.  It is very casual so think lunch is the better option.
reviews.title: GREAT LUNCH

reviews.text: Abbiamo mangiato un ottimo spaghetto alle vongole (porzione generosissima) e un eccellente tris in saor. Buon prezzo. Bravissimo il personale di sala nonostante il pienone. Consiglio anche il prosecco.
reviews.title: Ottimo pranzo di pesce

reviews.text: Cibo ottimo, accoglienza cordiale, locale tipico e caldo. Durante la nostra gita di 5 giorni a Venezia ci abbiamo cenato 2 volte per poter provare pi√π piatti di pesce, tutti da 10 e lode. In particolare il fritto √® il migliore che abbia mai assaggiato. Rapporto qualit√†/prezzo tanto buono che non pare di essere nella Laguna.
reviews.title: Da non perdere

reviews.text: Arrivati quasi per caso, consigliati da una barista del posto abbiamo mangiato degli ottimi Spaghetti con le vongole e pomodorini! Era veramente tanto tempo che non ne mangiavo di cos√¨ buoni!! Ho fatto i complimenti al cuoco! Ambiente piacevolmente rustico, personale cortese e sorridente. Ci torner√≤ sicuramente alla mia prossima visita a Venezia!!
reviews.title: Una Splendida Sorpresa!!

reviews.text: We ‚Äòfound‚Äô this place because we saw people waiting for the doors to open. Friendly staff (siblings and children of Venetian owner), fresh seafood and house made desserts. Make a point of eating here while in Venice.
reviews.title: Delicious dinner

reviews.text:
This such a nice place!
The food was Delicious!
Great Location and staff very helpful &
Friendly! 
Highly Recommend! üòäüòä
reviews.title: Venice for Lunch!

Il ristorante √® molto curato e piacevole, e il personale gentilissimo. Purtroppo non siamo rimasti molto convinti dal men√π: il risotto di pesce era decisamente scotto e il baccal√† mantecato di difficile digestione. Buone le sarde in saor cos√¨ come gli spaghetti al nero di seppia. 
Conto parecchio alto rispetto all'offerta.

Donc parmi 3 options a moins de 7 minutes ma femme a choisi celui ci.  bon service, agr√©able serveuse, des pallordes tellines et moules suivi par une brochette de poson et des pates aux calamars.  Du vin blanc dd la maison. Tout tres bien pour 85‚Ç¨.
reviews.title: Bonne reference de notre h√¥telier

reviews.text: We arrived after a referral from a boat tour.  We were told no tables,then told to wait, then brought upstairs and left to wait.  You could see a difference on how they treated the locals vs tourists.  When we got our food it was delicious and the house wine was wonderful, but there was very little service and they did not even acknowledge us as we left.
reviews.title: Food Great, but they do not like tourists and make no bones about it

reviews.text: Nous avons d√Æn√© dans ce restaurant suite au conseil de notre r√©ceptionniste de notre h√¥tel. Une cuisine v√©nitienne simple et familiale. Des plats copieux √† un prix tr√®s raisonnable pour une ville touristique. Un bel accueil du staff. Merci pour ce moment
reviews.title: Cuisine familiale

reviews.text: Tutto molto buono personale cortese , ci ritorner√≤ volentieri, con un posto bellissimo , ringrazio a tutti

reviews.text:
This restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel and wow it did not disappoint. Tucked away in a little hidden alley, it is beautifully decorated inside and the seafood is stunning. We had the mixed seafood platter to share and all the food was cooked perfectly. Some of the best salmon we've ever had.
Service was excellent and the whole place had a lovely atmosphere.
reviews.title: Excellent Food

reviews.text:
Ristorante consigliatissimo,  specialmente agli italiani che faticheranno a trovare qualche luogo all'altezza della nostra arte culinaria.
Consiglio vivamente come antipasto le cozze, piatto tipico veneto e a seguire lascio  a voi la scelta che qualunque sia non vi deluder√†.
reviews.title: V E N E Z I A

reviews.text:
Asking our Gondola person in Venice where he would eat, we decided to listen and try this place on Easter Sunday for dinner. We had to wait 40 minutes for a table and it was well worth it. 
We knew it must‚Äôve been a great place to eat as there were no other tourists there and it was full of locals - some with their dogs.
The house wine was brought to our table in a artsy decanter and it complemented my steak - which was tender and juicy. Normally, I like my steak cooked more; however, it didn‚Äôt matter because it was so good, I ate the whole thing. And the tiramisu- that was the absolute BEST I have ever eaten. It was smooth, creamy and incredible! 
If you want a real Italian experience of eating a great meal, I recommend this place!
reviews.title: Great Italian gem in Venice

reviews.text:
Came here for dinner on the last night of our holiday in Venice. Meal was very good, octopus salad to start and then spaghetti with clams for main. Portions were a good size. The house red wine went down well and was reasonably priced at ‚Ç¨14 a litre. 
Staff were very efficient and professional. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely meal

reviews.text:
Volevamo assaggiare qualche pietanza tipica e hanno capito al volo: baccal√† mantecato e polenta e schie. 
L‚ÄôAbbinamento pesce/ polentaBianca ha superato tutte le perplessit√† dei commensali...
reviews.title: Polenta bianca e pesce della laguna

reviews.text: Restaurante aut√©ntico con comida de buena calidad. El men√∫ no es muy variado pero todo hecho con productos frescos.
reviews.title: Correcto

reviews.text: La trattoria classique, on peut m√™me dire banale. Le cadre est sans relief et la cuisine aussi. On n'y mange ni bien, ni mal et le service est un peu exp√©ditif.
reviews.title: Sans surprise, mais sans relief

reviews.text: Veneza tem pre√ßos altos, mais que os praticados em Roma; j√° est√°vamos preparados, por√©m quer√≠amos sair daqueles restaurantes pega turista ou com menu tur√≠stico; e conseguimos. A caminho da ponte Rialto, saindo da pra√ßa da S√£o Marcos, vimos a fachada simp√°tica e da janela o tamanho dos pratos, sim s√£o bem servidos. O restaurante e pautado em frutos do mar, ao chegar j√° sentimos o cheiro de peixe, que eu gosto. A cozinha √© aberta. O servi√ßo foi uma pouco demorado, por√©m atendentes simp√°ticos; o sabor do spaguetti a s√©pia e do spaguetti com aclamaria estava muito bom. A entradinha, salada de polvo, √≥tima bem fresca e o molusco no ponto certo: pedimos o vinho da casa -1L - Chardonnay por 14 euros que n√£o decepcionou ; as sobremesas estavam √≥tima tb; tiramisu divino; enfim, bom custo beneficio e voltar√≠amos certamente
reviews.title: Adoramos o restaurante / bom custo beneficio

reviews.text:
C'est vraiment selon moi un incontournable de Venise ... et apr√®s 3 s√©jours √† Venise on commence √† connaitre pas mal d'adresses !
donc allez y les yeux ferm√©s !
tout y est excellent ! et le service est TOP !
reviews.title: Venise 02.2019 Carnaval

reviews.text: Non solo ottima cucina veneziana ma anche pizza e dolci preparati nello stesso ristorante.Personale gentile e preparato.
reviews.title: cucina veneziana

reviews.text: Arriviamo a pranzo in questo locale  consigliati da gente del posto. Ordiniamo 2 spaghetti alle vongole (orrendamente scotti) e una porzione di pasta con calamari pi√π decorosa. Dolci buoni. 9 euro di coperto in 3 persone. Conto totale 67 euro per 3 primi 2 tiramis√π 1 acqua naturale. A voi l'ardua sentenza
reviews.title: Prezzi alti pasta scotta

reviews.text:
Cibo: tutti i piatti che ho provato nelle mie 4 visite erano molto buoni e saporiti. Si mangiano piatti tipici veneziani. Porzioni abbondanti.
Location: posto semplice. Si esce sempre che si puzza di cibo, questo fa perdere un punto.
Prezzi: giusti, considerando che siamo a Venezia e le porzioni sono veramente generose.

Servizio rapido ed efficiente.
reviews.title: Tutto molto interessante

reviews.text:
Personale estremamente gentile e disponibile.
Piatti molto abbondanti e rapporto qualit√†/prezzo eccezionale.
Da provare assolutamente per chi si trova in zona!
reviews.title: Dove poter mangiare tanto e bene!

name: Cantina Vecia Carbonera
address: Cannaregio 2329, 30121 Venice Italy

reviews.text:
Entrato su consiglio di amica veneziana, cicchetti buoni e vino e affini scarsi. Il personale di servizio pessimo, anzi maleducato!
Serve uno spritz alla mia ragazza con dentro un insetto, glielo si fa notare e risponde seccato"te lo levo". Si rifiutava di rifare lo spritz, che dopo per√≥ insistendo ha riversato. 
Uscendo manco saluta e risponde al saluto...ristoratori e baristi abituato troppo bene negli ultimi anni a Venezia. Un periodo di "magra" non fara' male a rieducarli su cosa vuol dire avere clienti.
reviews.title: Servizio voto 0

reviews.text:
Sono stata in questo bacaro per caso.

I cicchetti non erano male (ma comunque nulla di eccezionale) e anche il prosecco si lasciava bere.

Il minus per√≤ √® dato dalla scortesia, soprattutto di una delle due ragazze dietro al banco, che sembrava piuttosto scocciata di esser li‚Äô a far quel lavoro.

L‚Äôoste e‚Äô un mestiere che richiede parecchie qualit√† relazionali e una certa passione per le materie che si trattano.
reviews.title: Scortesi

reviews.text: Stopped here for a drink on our first evening in Venice. Not many seats outside but manage to get a table. Staff were helpful and friendly.  Prices were good and it was a very pleasant experience!
reviews.title: Lovely location for drinks!

reviews.text:
Locale incontrato per caso durante il nostro passeggio veneziano poco distante dal Ponte delle Guglie di Cannaregio
Un angolo prezioso autentico veneziano e curato da personale giovane.
I "cicheti" proposti tutti irresistibili: dalle polpette alle sarde marinate e in saor; radicchio e gamberetti cos√¨ come salmone e burro senza dimenticare la morbida rosettina col salame nostrano
Ampi tavoli distanziati che permettono una sosta veramente rilassante e gradevole.
Da tener presente sicuramente per un prossimo passaggio in Laguna
reviews.title: Pranzi Veneziani

reviews.text:
La tappa fissa del nostro giro per Venezia. 
Cicchetti di carne e pesce, sempre freschissimi.
Vini gradevoli con cui accompagnarli.
Prezzi onesti, anche in considerazione della qualit√†. 

I tavoli rustici all'interno, e la recente aggiunta di qualche tavolino all'esterno, garantiscono la possibilit√† di goderseli con la giusta calma, senza necessariamente fare il tipico boccone al volo.

Il servizio al tavolo non √® previsto, ma il personale √® sempre molto gentile e piacevole.
reviews.title: Il nostro baccaro

reviews.text:
Beautiful cantina. Perfect for lunchtime Cicchetti. 

The aubergine parmigiana is not to be missed. 

The staff were so friendly and the drinks were great.
reviews.title: Beautiful cantina. Don‚Äôt miss the aubergine parmigiana

reviews.text:
Nonostante sia lungo il percorso principale turistico di Venezia la cantina Vecia Carbonera davanti a Campo della Maddalena mantiene molti elementi tipici dei bacari storici.
Buona scelta di vini, tantissimi cicchetti tra cui scegliere (e non i soliti panini imbottiti), un ampio salone dove accomodarsi (rigidamente senza servizio al tavolo) e personale sempre cordialissimi. I prezzi non sono tra i migliori di Venezia, ma ricordiamoci dove siamo...
reviews.title: Uno dei miei bacari preferiti di Venezia

reviews.text: Cerquita de santa lucia. Vino y cicchetti. Variedad de tapas. El camarero habla un poco de castellano. Tienen dos mesitas junto al canal para sentarse
reviews.title: Tapeando por venecia

reviews.text:
Per noi, amanti di cicchetti e ombretta, √® una m√®ta obbligata. Il punto forte √® lo spazio interno molto ampio, l'atmosfera un po' retr√≤, la qualit√† dell'offerta.
Non serve dilungarsi molto su questo posto, andateci e non rompete le scatole
reviews.title: Tour bacaristico posto lockdown

reviews.text: E' uno dei pochi bacari in Strada Nova - se non l'unico - che ha mantenuto l'atmosfera tradizionale di una taverna d'altri tempi nonostante sia posizionato lungo una delle arterie pi√π frequentate della citt√†. Grossi tavoli in legno, colonne in pietra e soffitti a travicelli creano un atmosfera rustica ma accogliente, popolare ma giovanile. I prezzi non sono proprio economici. L'ingresso √® esattamente ai piedi del ponte S. Antonio e gi√† dall'esterno si intuisce il suo carattere casereccio ma d'impronta dinamica. Pregevole la "porta d‚Äôacqua" da cui si accede direttamente nel canale che fa comprendere come avviene la singolare movimentazione delle merci a Venezia.
reviews.title: Un bacaro d'altri tempi

reviews.text:
Abbiamo preso cicchetti e spritz il risultato?!?
Due spritz a base di formiche, DA DIMENTICARE!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Spritz con formiche

reviews.text:
We came upon Ristorante dell'Osmarin while strolling around Venice.  The waiter moved some table so we could have a better view and be separated from the other tables due to Covid.  He was especially attentive, professional and funny!

The Prosecco, food, wine and value were top notch. We will definitely visit again on our next trip to Venice.

Our waiter was awesome, sorry I do not recall his name, but he was a nice young gentleman from Pakistan.  In fact, when we left, my wife forgot her iPhone on the table, and did not realize it until we returned to our hotel.  We immediately called the restaurant and the receptionist told us to worry, our waiter had secured it immediately and it was waiting at the hotel desk for us to retrieve it...impeccable character!!  

You don't see or hear about that everyday!!
reviews.title: Delicious Food, Beautiful setting, Wonderful Staff!

reviews.text: A short walk from St Marks square - just a couple of small bridges to cross - brings you to a really unique location. A canal side seat at the Ristorante dell ‚Äòosmarin where you can enjoy sumptuous food and watch the Gondoliers negotiate a tight corner and the tiny ponte  diavola. The staff are warm and engaging particularly the waiter Sabir and the manager who gave us a complementary glass of Prosecco on arrival and a glass of grappa to cheer us on our way. Steak cooked to perfection and roasted vegetables presented beautifully. Not cheap but similarly priced to most of the other Venetian restaurants we visited. The main attraction for this place has to be the Gondolas which pass by every couple of minutes but in second place was the old guy playing ‚Äòo solo mio‚Äô On the accordion. Famtastico
reviews.title: Canal side restaurant - watch the Gondolas glide past

reviews.text: Lovely dinner on our 2nd night in Venice. All staff were lovely & very attentive. Food was delicious! As was the wine & Prosecco!

reviews.text: Molto carina l'atmosfera ma gli adesivi di eccellenza TripAdvisor sicuramente sono relativi all'hotel, e non al ristorante. Cucina non male ma certamente non all'altezza dei prezzi o del servizio.

reviews.text:
Abbiamo pranzato il giorno di Ferragosto in questo ristorante affacciato a un canale trafficato di gondole con ottima vista sui palazzi di Venezia vicini a San Marco. Ci erano stati assegnati dei tavolini fuori. Abbiamo mangiato veramente bene e Max, ottimo intrattenitore, ci ha messo subito a nostro agio offrendoci un prosecco di benvenuto e interessandosi per tutta la permanenza a offrirci il miglior servizio.
Ci ritorneremo di certo perch√© c'√© stata l'atmosfera giusta di convivialit√° abbinata a ottime pietanze e unicit√¢ della posizione.
Bravi !
reviews.title: Ottimo pranzo di Ferragosto

reviews.text:
We had a very good dinner yesterday at this restaurant. At the water, nice views, not too crowded but people passing by. All of the staff, especially Max, had been super super friendly and kind. Well trained. Always checking if we are happy. Food was good, homemade desserts recommend. 
A glas of sparkling wine before and a Limoncello after dinner on the house. Thanks for that.

reviews.text:
The restaurant is ideally situated away from the hustle and bustle of nearby Piazza San Marco. If seated outside you will be able to see the Gondolas passing by while savouring the restaurants specialities and having a glass of wine. Prices were a tad higher than those of the tourist joints around San Marco, but accordingly, the quality and service were much better as well. The staff was very attentive and friendly, the chef de service (Sabir?) outdid himself in being sociable - he reminded us somewhat of ‚ÄûSunny‚Äú in the movie ‚ÄûThe Best Exotic Marigold Hotel‚Äúü§ó
We‚Äòd definitely recomnend this restaurant to anyone staying in Venice!

The tables are nicely set up along the canal  and we were expecting a nice enough dinner. Even though they have quite a large wine menu none of the wines were offered by the glass, so we opted for a glass of bier instead. The bread wasn‚Äôt fresh and the pasta was decent, although presentation could have been better. All in all it would have been a normal dinner, however we confronted the waiter since nobody was coming to cash the bill and we were told to go to the cashier like everybody else. At the cashier we were enquiring why is there a 12% service charge if none of the waiters was able to come to the table to take the card and we were laughed at by the cashier at the same time as the waiter was telling us that this is the way they work there. What could have been a perfectly normal and pleasant dinner was ruined by the rudeness of the restaurant staff. There are three or four other restaurants just next to this one with similar menus, I am positive they will offer you a better service than this one
reviews.title: Average food and service with an attitude

reviews.text: Pedi uma salada de frango onde o frango estava fervido na √°gua e sem nenhum tempero. Nem pro meu cachorro sirvo um frango assim.

reviews.text: Lovely restaurant alongside a quiet canal.  Watch the gondolas go by!  Staff excellent - very attentive.  Good service.  Menu varied and well priced.  Particularly enjoyed the seafood but wide range of other choices possible.  Wine sold in half bottles as as well as 0.75l.  Would definitely return when next in Venice.

reviews.text:
Selected this restaurant due to its agreeable setting and reasonable prices. Food and service were fine, however due to its location we were hassled by street vendors trying to sell roses etc, however I suspect this is the case in many restaurants. Pasta dishes were good and there is a good selection for children at a reasonable price. 

Don‚Äôt expect anything special, many patrons were moved around so more customers could be fitted in, manager clearly working the restaurant very hard to maximise profits. Perhaps not the place to visit just for a drink, we witnessed customers being asked to leave the restaurant so they could make way for customers who wanted to eat.
reviews.title: Passable

reviews.text:
Nous venons de passer notre derni√®re soir√©e √† Venise sur cette fondamenta entre les magasins de costumes et accessoires de carnaval et restaurants... l‚ÄôOsmarin, situ√© au bord d‚Äôun canal, nous a bien accueilli et les plats √©taient savoureux. 
Pr√©voir 12% pour le service
reviews.title: Sur la plus belle fondamenta de Venise !

reviews.text:
I stopped in this restaurant with my family for diner.  We were sitting outside close to the water watching the ‚Äúgondole‚Äù. The staff was very friendly and the food very good.
I had the ‚Äúlinguine al astice‚Äù and enjoyed it very much.
reviews.title: Good food close to the water

reviews.text:
Worst pizza in the world (dough bought from Superstore nearby!!!!), please run away!!!!
Waiters & Other dishes ok, location fantastic!
reviews.title: Worst pizza in the world

reviews.text: It was our last dinner in Italy and this was a great option. It was the first time my husband ate carbonara and fell in love. I ordered tanglatele with shrimp and zucchini which I recommend. Delicious! Service was fast and servers were friendly. The restaurant is next to a small canal which lovely and not as hectic and noisy as the restaurants in Grand Canal. Prices were reasonable. Great experience!
reviews.title: Great food and good service!!!

reviews.text: During our visit to Venice we asked our Hotel for a good fish restaurant, they pointed us to dell'Osmarin. The fish was perfectly prepared. We enjoyed this restaurant for 2 days and would recommend this for everyone. Inside there is an airco and outside you are next to the canal with the gondola's. The manager arranged after the dinner a Gondola ride in the evening. Perfect! Service is very good.
reviews.title: Nice location next to the canal and a very good dinner (fish).

reviews.text: This is one of those ubiquitous Venetian restaurants that line the Fondamentas around the city.  You wouldn‚Äôt seek it out but if you‚Äôre passing by and looking for a place to eat, it works just fine.  Pizza and spaghetti bolonese hit the spot.  Service was fast because they were flipping tables between reservations but we didn‚Äôt mind.  Prices reasonable.
reviews.title: Good enough

name: Ristorante Agli Alboretti
address: Dorsoduro 882 Rio Tera' Antonio Foscarini, 30123 Venice Italy

reviews.text: Op het terras aten wij een uitstekende vitello tonato. De plek is heerlijk rustig en de service is goed.
reviews.title: Uitstekende vitello tonato

reviews.text:
As other reviewers have said there is not an extensive menu here but to me that says you should get first rate quality dishes and well prepared. We certainly got that. The ragu of guinea fowl with pasta was outstanding, had to scrape up every bit of the sauce with bread. Vitello tonnato with some twists was just fantatstic. Two courses each, half litre of rose and a bottle of red came to ¬£100. And that for Venice is a bargain!
Only reason did not give 5 stars is that the ambience is a bit soulless, maybe because there was only one other couple dining. Waiter was very pleasant. Don't know why this place was not busier but it is a bit on its own in a fairly quiet street.
Find it and go there , the food is great and they deserve your custom.
PS. Now is definitely the time to visit Venice - so peaceful.
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.text:
Depuis de nombreuses ann√©es suis fid√®le √† ce lieu d'exception. Le patron,  le serveur,  le cuisinier vous regalent et savent vous accueillir. La terrasse en face de l'√©glise des gesuati, le jardin.  Excellente cuisine et bons vins.  Allez y vous serez heureux
H√©l√®ne de Paris
reviews.title: Du pur bonheur

reviews.text: Das Restaurant ist etwas weg von den grossen Touristenstr√∂men und ist auch bei Einheimischen beliebt. Als Antipasti habe die ich eine sehr feine Burrata genossen, danach Linguine mit Tr√ºffel und Pfeffer. Alles sehr sch√∂n zubereitet. Nur der offene Wein, ein Merlot, hat etwas entt√§uscht, deshalb 4 Punkte.

reviews.text: Als G√§ste des Hotels haben wir auch einmal hier gegessen. Die Speisekarte ist erfreulich kurz und l√§sst auf eine sorgf√§ltige und frische Zubereitung hoffen. Das hat sich leider nicht erf√ºllt. Die Gerichte sind sicherlich nicht schlecht, es fehlt aber √ºberall an W√ºrze und der Liebe zum Detail. So fehlt Salz, Salatgarnituren sind nicht angemacht, hier und da ein Tropfen gutes Oliven√∂l w√ºrde sicherlich nicht schaden. Warum der Vitello Tonnato eine zus√§tzliche Tomatenso√üe verpasst bekam, bleibt das Geheimnis des K√ºchenchefs. √úberhaupt kam mir das Kalbfleisch sehr klein, sehr rund und sehr gleichm√§√üig geschnitten vor. Ich tippe auf Convenience. Daf√ºr sitzt man in einem sch√∂nen begr√ºnten Innenhof (oder drau√üen auf der Stra√üe). Allerdings gibt es hier Stechm√ºcken, sollte es gerade ausgiebig geregnet haben.
reviews.title: Lieblose Zubereitung

reviews.text:
Wir sind zuf√§llig an dem Restaurant vorbei gekommen und fanden es sehr sympathisch.
Die Linguine waren ein Genuss!

Sehr zu empfehlen.
reviews.title: Sehr sch√∂ne Location und super Essen!

reviews.text:
Small menu but exquisite. 
this little restaurant, part of the hotel with the same name, does not feature a large choice but the food was excellent. 
typical ‚Äúpiovra‚Äù octopus grilled was excellent. tuna tartare also well seasoned. 
main courses included vitello tonnato and romba (turbot) with a sicilian caponata fantastic combination.
reviews.title: Small menu but exquisite.

reviews.text: Abbiamo preso delle insalate e del baccal√† mantecato. Il pesce era buono, ma le insalate erano abbastanza povere. Il prezzo poi era alto anche per Venezia, quasi il doppio che in altre citt√†.
reviews.title: Cibo non male, ma prezzi alti

reviews.text:
Le repas √©tait d√©licieux nos 2 plats un r√©gal. Beaucoup de go√ªt tr√®s fin plat et dessert.
Le service parfait, agr√©able, serviable. Le petit plus ils parlaient fran√ßais et vraiment sympa.
Je recommande vraiment c'est une excellente adresse.
reviews.title: Simplement excellent

reviews.text:
Toller Italiener, fast schon ein Geheimtipp.

Vorspeise, Hauptgang bis hin zum Dessert alles top!

reviews.text: Trouv√© par hasard au d√©tour d‚Äôune ruelle un havre de paix par temps de grosse chaleur : un jardin au calme √† l‚Äôarri√®re du restaurant ! Plats de qualit√© m√™me si nous n‚Äôavons pas go√ªt√© les p√¢tes et tr√®s bons desserts : allez y
reviews.title: Trouv√© par hasard au d√©tour

reviews.text:
What a lovely restaurant near Accademia!
It is so difficult to find very good and yet very affordable restaurants in Venice. It was our 5th time in this city and we were so happy to have found this place. The restaurant is NOT a tourist trap and therefore does NOT have a ridiculous menu with 45 dishes and 7 languages. Instead, the cuisine is traditional without being unnecessarily rustic or heavy. A handful of dishes are very well executed.
You can sit in front, inside or at the back of the restaurant.
The staff is also genuinely friendly. 
My fianc√©e and I loved it so much that we returned twice for lunch that week.
We wish there were more restaurants like that in Venice!
reviews.title: Finally a good and authentic little restaurant!

reviews.text:
Restaurant o√π tout √©tait parfait. Le serveur tr√®s sympathique qui parle fran√ßais et vous presente les plats.
Une cuisine d'une excellente qualit√© comme le foie √† la v√©nitienne accompagn√© de sa polenta ou le turbo parfaitement cuit.
Le cadre est tr√®s agr√©able.
Le prix raisonnable pour la prestation 30‚Ç¨.
Le meilleur restaurant dans lequel j'ai mang√© √† Venise durant la semaine pass√©e. Une tr√®s belle d√©couverte.
reviews.title: Excellentissime

reviews.text:
On vient de passer 4 jours √† Venise. 
Agli Alboretti a √©t√© notre coup de coeur.

Quartier Dorsoduro, tr√®s calme et tr√®s beau. √† deux pas du quartier san marco en passant par le pont de l'acad√©mie.

Des sp√©cialit√©s venitiennes mais pas "clich√©s". 
Du go√ªt dans l'assiette, des saveurs, un vrai bonheur.
Le vin: g√©niale d√©couverte d'un "suave" qui se marie parfaitement avec poissons et fruits de mer.

Nous √©tions √† la terasse int√©rieure. Tr√®s calme.  beaucoup de charme. 

Et le service ..... franchement exceptionnel pour Venise. Venise √©tant calme en ce moment, il a pu echanger avec nous. Il parlait fran√ßais ce qui aide aussi. Un vrai connaisseur en vins ce qui a donn√© lieu √† un partage tout √† fait savoureux. Je pr√©cise qu'il a toutjours fait preuve de discr√©tion. J'ai su plus tard que c'√©tait le fils du patron, lui aussi passionn√© en oenologie.

Bref, un vrai coup de coeur. Et apr√®s tout ce qu'ils ont subi, entre les aqua alta et le covid, ca fait 8 mois que beaucoup d'√©tablissements gal√®rent. Donc si vous voulez vous faire plaisir, n'hesitez pas.
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.text: 23 febbraio domenica sera di carnevale ma il coronavirus rovina tutto....MA NON LA CENA!! il ristorante come quasi tutti a Venezia e'vuoto... Ma la cena √® stata a dir poco superlativa! Dall' antipasto al dolce tutto perfetto buono curato come qualit√† e presentazione! Abbiamo preso il men√π completo con una variazione... Complimenti al giovane proprietario che fa sentire gli ospiti come a casa! Location curata e servizio attento! Prezzo super per essere a Venezia! Ristorante top per rapporto qualit√† prezzo!
reviews.title: Meraviglioso tutto!

reviews.text: Nice place, but tiny menu selection. Polite attentive staff, but tiny portions at expensive prices. Small serving of plain pasta and 3 anchovies ‚Ç¨16.
reviews.title: Nice place, but tiny menu

reviews.text: Cosy atmosphere, lovely meal, friendly staff and great range of gluten free options.  Would recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff and selection of gluten free meals

reviews.text:
Girando per Venzia ci siamo imbattuti in questo ristorante e per la sera di Natale abbiamo cenato in un ambiente accoglente, con camerieri gentili e professionalmente impeccabili, piatti molto gustosi e ben curati. rapporto qualit√† prezzo ottimo.
Da consigliare assolutamente.
reviews.title: cena per caso

reviews.text: Location carina, dallo stile un po‚Äô datato. Piatti buoni, porzioni piuttosto ridotte, considerando anche il costo dei piatti piuttosto elevato. Personale non molto preparato sugli ingredienti dei piatti ( abbiamo chiesto piatti da evitare per intolleranza al lattosio senza avere una risposta chiara)
reviews.title: Cena normale

reviews.text: Siamo stati in questo esercizio a pranzo del 25 novembre u.s. dopo aver prenotato e abbiamo potuto prendere anche un tavolo all'aperto,visto che c'era uno splendido sole prima che nel pomeriggio tornasse di nuovo l'acqua alta,il che ci ha pure impedito di visitare le Gallerie dell'Accademia,come invece ci eravamo proposti.Beh,devo dire che siamo stati accolti molto affabilmente dal proprietario,con il quale abbiamo parlato delle afflizioni della suggestiva e struggente Venezia,dopo l'ultima terribile acqua alta del martedi precedente e delle difficolt√† che hanno i gestori delle varie attivit√† proprio per queste emergenze alle quali pure sono purtroppo assoggettati.Poi abbiamo ordinato ed √® stato solo un piacere per il palato,con antipasto di moscardini alle verdure grigliate,una delizia;e poi un piatto di tagliolini al nero di seppia alle seppie e alle cime di rapa: perfettamente presentati,preparati e serviti benissimo,gustosissimi;il tutto innaffiato con un calice di ottimo prosecco,e per finire un ottimo caff√®:il tutto con un conto finale pi√π che onesto e anche un piccolo sconto praticato dall'affabile gestore.Spero di tornarci,perche √® meritevole.
reviews.title: Ottimo ristorante

reviews.text: Efter flera besvikelser p√• olika restauranger i Venedig var detta n√•got som gav oss hopp igen. Ligger lite avsides vilket vi gillade, kanske inte den mest romantiska atmosf√§ren men maten och personalen v√§gde upp allt. Rekommenderas starkt. Inte billigt, men inte heller dyrare √§n alla turistf√§llor.
reviews.title: V√•r b√§sta middag i Venedig

reviews.text: Au regards des commentaires trouves sur ce site, je me suis rendu dans ce restaurant sans mefiance. Or, a Venise, il faut se mefier des adresses trop recommandees dans les lieux touristiques tels que l'Accademia. En effet, si le service est charmant et efficace, ce que l'on a dans l'assiette ne casse pas trois pattes a un canard. Je m'explique : j'ai pris un "ragu" car jaime cette sauce a base de viande longuement mijotee avec amour par les "mama" italiennes en famille, mais ici l'interpretation du ragu lui ote non seulement son gout mais aussi le plaisir de lcuisson lente, c'est une assiette avec 4 grosse pates entourees d'une vague ausace au porc et un "emballage" de creme et de pesto sans interet. Interpretation certes, sans aucun interet. De plus les vins au verre sont vendus au prix d'une bouteille. Non, vraiment pas une adresse a recommander aux gourmets. Aux touristes pourquoi pas... Je prefere le voisin dans la rue adjacente Trattoria Cugnai, beaucoup plus bordlique mais offrant une cuisine de famille delicieuse et sans chichi.
reviews.title: Tres decevant, ce que l'assiette propose au palais.

reviews.text: This restaurant was recommended by the staff at the Hotel Kette.  We were not disappointed!!  The outside garden was beautiful.  The staff very friendly.  The food was superb and beautifully presented.  The wine recommendation of our waiter was excellent.  One of our favorite restaurants we went to on this 17 day Med trip and when we return to Venice again we will definitely go to Ristorante Agli Alboretti.
reviews.title: Great recommendation from Hotel Kette!

reviews.text: The menu contains perfectly executed traditional dishes and others with tasty twists - for example the smoked salmon with leeks, grilled sardines (more achovy size), spagetti and clams, 'ceviche' of scallops. Excellent and reasonably priced wine list. Well informed and charming service. We went twice and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: so thoughtful and precise

reviews.text: This restaurant was relatively tucked away and really appealed to me purely because of that. Me and my girlfriend came here for dinner and what a beautiful meal we had. I can't remember the exact pasta dishes we ordered but i've never had an explosion of flavour in a meal like it. Both our dishes that we shared were lovely, the customer servce was fantastic also, very attentive and the overall atmosphere at this restaurant was exquisite. I would recommend without a doubt.

reviews.text: Nicol√≤, our host, and Luka made us feel like family through their welcome and care. The food is so well thought out, prepared and presented. We lunched outside (but see the wonderful secluded garden area!) with a bottle of Prosecco. Recommended by fine friends, all expectations were exceeded. We had to leave Venice right after lunch and regret not being able to stay and enjoy more complete dinners too. Served by 2 different vaporetto stations, its easy to find and a wonderful area to explore before and after your meal.  Thank you Nicol√≤ for your gracious place and all it offered us.
reviews.title: Superb dining, away from the crowds.

reviews.text: We came here for our last supper in Italy and I have to say that the food was simply delicious. The portions are small. Unlike other restaurants where we were able to share an appetizer, main course and dessert and be stuffed, here we really needed to order all three courses. It is definitely worth coming back for.
reviews.title: delicious food

reviews.text:
Ein sch√∂nes kleines Restaurant. Die Gerichte waren alle sehr gut.
Die Pasta mit Muscheln war sehr frisch und daher echt lecker.
Wir hatten Fisch und Steak ‚Äì beides perfekt.
Besonders aufgefallen war die gute Auswahl an Rum.

Personale

reviews.text: Buon Ristorante , o meglio eccezionale per Venezia, posizione comoda, serve il proprietario, un ragazzo appassionato del suo mestiere, competente e simpatici, abbiamo mangiato bene, la mia scelta non ottima per colpa mia, baccal√† buono e ben presentato, fritto di pesce variati e ben fatto, sorbetti di limone eccezionali, l‚Äôambiente e‚Äô un po‚Äô triste all‚Äôinterno dovrebbe renderlo pi√π vitale ma i giardinetti e‚Äô Gradevole

Delicious food, but I‚Äôve never eaten so fast.
We rushed because the moscitoes were all over us. Approximately 1 bite per minute in the lovely little garden behind the indoor restaurant.

reviews.text: We first visited this lovely restaurant two years ago. On that visit it was one of our favourite restaurants. So when we arrived in Dorsoduro to our nearby hotel yesterday we came here for dinner. My daughter and I had two lovely pasta primis. Mine was bigoli in salsa (delicious) and my daughter chose a pasta with mussels and courgette. We shared a mixed grilled fish and a side dish of grilled vegetables. For pudding my daughter had a chocolate semifredo and I had a scoop each of vanilla and hazelnut ice cream. If you are in the Accedemia area, this is the place to go.
reviews.title: It‚Äôs still just as good as last time

reviews.text: Nous y avions d√Æn√© et les p√¢tes ainsi que le vin √©taient d√©licieux. La tarte au citron revisit√©e en dessert √©tait √©galement excellente. Quant au service, il a √©t√© tr√®s efficace et agr√©able, on recommande !
reviews.title: P√¢tes fameuses !

reviews.text:
ristorante "Agli Alboretti" si trova in una bella zona, ha un personale gentile e molto disponibile (ero arrivata a 5 minuti dalla chiusura e loro sono stati pronti a ricevermi con un sorriso, mi hanno servito con puntualit√† e gentilezza). Lo definirei ‚Äúraffinato‚Äù, ma senza essere snob. I piatti sono davvero molto buoni, porzioni giuste e prezzo in linea con quelli della turistica Venezia. Non ci sono solo i piatti tipici della cucina veneziana, la scelta √® vasta e originale.
Ho mangiato un OTTIMO primo (ravioli con brasato di vitello e fonduta alla gorgonzola) ed ero gi√† molto sazia. Ritornando a Venezia sicuro pranzer√≤ di nuovo in questo ristorante, lo consiglio a tutti!
reviews.title: Ottima scelta

reviews.text:
After finishing a visit to the Accademia, we decided spontaneously to go out for an early dinner. Looking at the menu, we were intrigued by the agli Alboretti. We inquired at the attached hotel, which made a reservation for us but noted that they are under separate management.

Tired of the extreme heat, we ate inside in the air conditioning. The decor was lovely, and the air conditioning was a relief. Our dinner was excellent. My wife says that her pasta with truffles was the best single dish she ate on our whole trip to Italy. It had large slices of black truffle on top. Such nice touches were typical of the meal.

I also had a wonderful and unusual dish, the bigoli (large Venetian spaghetti-like pasta) with anchovies. To be clear, the anchovies were not the salted ones we are used too, but fresh ones in a lovely,  yellow sauce. I was not sure whether the sauce used raw egg or perhaps saffron, but either way, it was a wonderful dish. I greatly enjoyed trying local Venetian specialties, not just the Italian classics.

Service was attentive, the ambiance romantic...a great experience!
reviews.title: Elegant restaurant near the Accademia

reviews.text: Sch√∂ne Atmosph√§re, Essen absolut top, preislich nicht billig, aber in jeder Hinsicht angemessen. Wir kommen gerne wieder
reviews.title: Nettes kleines Ristorante abseits des Trubels

reviews.text:
We were so looking forward to visiting this restaurant which we had enjoyed very much in previous years and it was a salutory lesson that going back somewhere ruins those fond memories. I suppose the sheer volume of tourists that Venice gets blunts the enthusiasm for restaurants to excel, especially when they can charge what they like while serving indifferent food to non-returning customers and this, I am sorry to say, is very much what we found on our latest visit, not just here but in other restaurants too.
Now this is a pleasant restaurant with amazing staff who go out of their way to help and whom I cannot criticise in any way. The food and prices, however, are another matter, and are what has put us off any future visit.
As a previous reviewer has said the veal was not as expected, he thought it was chicken whereas we thought perhaps pork. In addition food came lukewarm and on one occasion cold and we did begin to wonder what was happening in the kitchen.
I know such mishaps happen from time to time but after two visits this year and a similar experience in the past regretfully it really is time to look elsewhere, especially given one‚Äôs expectations for the price charged.
reviews.title: Hugely disappointed after previous visits

reviews.text: While a bit pricey this lovely restaurant offered outstanding food and wine options with seating in an expanded closed-in patio that gave us the feeling of being outside on a rainy evening. They were able to seat us as a large party and never failed to satisfy. We loved it. Try the flounder!
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: Ci siamo accomodati nella piacevole distesa esterna del locale, in una piazza fortunatamente silenziosa e tranquilla. Il baccal√† mantecato abbinato a polenta, come i tagliolini con capesante e pomodori, e il filetto di salmone alla griglia, ci hanno soddisfatto perch√© ben eseguiti e ottimi al palato. Mi aspettavo qualcosa di pi√π per il vino della casa che ci ha accompagnato durante l‚Äôesperienza.
reviews.title: Piacevole distesa!!

reviews.text: Great restaurant!  Polite staff and delicious food. Had lunch with a big group and the staff was lovely
reviews.title: Lunch

reviews.text:
The good reviews/rating for this restaurant on trip advisor are horribly misleading, as this was possibly the WORST meal we ate during our 10 days in Italy. Meals we had on THE PLANE ride to and from Italy were better than what we were served here.
 We chose this place on our first night in Venice because it was getting late, we were super hungry, the rating looked good, and it was a very quick walk from our rented apartment. In the end, the only thing we ordered that was in fact, good was the overpriced bottle of Valpolicella. Service, however was very friendly, contrary to what some other reviewers have said about this location. But I guess most con artists know how to put on a smiling face in order to scam you. 
  The waiter talked us into an appetizer of fresh crab in the shell...it turned out to be a crab shell filled with lettuce with some flakes of crab meat strategically placed over the lettuce to make it look full. What little meat there was was dry and nearly flavorless. That was 20 Euro. 
  Main dish was ravioli with shrimp. What we actually got was a few bites per person of extremely salty ravioli (which probably means it was from frozen) with some PIECES of shrimp. No where in the dish was a single full shrimp.
 Then the "veal" for the main dish. Pretty sure they served us three thin slices of overly cooked chicken breasts. We both left the restaurant hungry and angry, but not before the waiter made sure to point out to us that service was not included on the bill.
reviews.title: OVERPRICED. AWFUL FOOD. IT'S A TRAP! STAY AWAY!!!

reviews.text: I've had many different gluten-free pasta since we've been in Italy (none spaghetti bolognese) their spaghetti bolognese is excellent!
reviews.title: A mazza k buono for their gluten-free pasta!

reviews.text: La comida y la atensi√≥n es excelente. Algo caro, pero muy recomendable si el dinero no es problema, al menos por una noche.
reviews.title: Muy buen lugar.

reviews.text: Ate here twice whilst in Venice, both times were very enjoyable. Friendly service, excellent food, the lasagna was amazing! Good value. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Good food, good location

reviews.text:
We found this lovely little restaurant by chance while out wandering! The waiter was very knowledgeable with the daily specials. All our food was excellent. Owe did arrive pretty late but the restaurant began to close while we were still finishing up. Felt a bit rushed and wine was left due to this. 

all about the daily specials
reviews.title: Hidden little gem

reviews.text: After walking around for a while, we wanted to try some Italian food.  We stopped at this restaurant which is hidden at the end of the block in a small square. We sat outside and ordered our food and drinks. We did their 3 course meal. It was very inexpensive. The food was amazing. Everything tasted so good. My only complaint is that they take a really long time to bring your food. Our first course came around 20 minutes after ordering it so we had finished our drinks. They never came back to ask if we wanted more drinks. We had to wait another 20 minutes for the second course and another 20 minutes for our desert.  I think we spent around 2.5 hrs sitting there when we could have been done in 1.  Also, no bathrooms. There was a public paid toilet near by.  But overall everything was great. Just don‚Äôt expect to eat and run like we do in the USA.
reviews.title: Our first Meal in Venice

reviews.text: Ristorantino curato esteticamente. Il resto lascia un po' a desiderare. Eravamo in due e abbiamo ordinato il men√π di pesce. Nonostante il prezzo pi√π elevato degli altri ristoranti, in media, la frittura √® stata una delusione: era poca, secca e la maggior parte del piatto era composta da verdure in pastella, il pesce era poco e accompagnato da uno spicchio di limone secco. Quando col primo di pasta ho chiesto il grattugiato, il cameriere ha commentato giudicando l'accostamento, cosa che non mi risulta sia di sua competenza. Da ultimo, ho ordinato un ginseng macchiato e mi √® arrivato un espresso macchiato. Mi dispiace per un altro cameriere, veramente gentile, ma non mi sono trovata bene.

reviews.text: Great experience, friendly staff and fantastic food. Do not skip this gem when in Venice. We had the Spaghetti bolognese and Lasagne, best ever!
reviews.title: Lunch in Venice

reviews.text:
Trattoria Rialto Novo is the only restaurant on a secluded piazza not far from the Rialto Mercato vaporetto stop in San Polo. We found it such an oasis of warm service and delicious food that we ate there twice on a six-night visit to Venice.

The nightly specials always feature whatever is fresh that day from the fish market down the quay. We enjoyed the spider crab appetizer and fresh scallops, but the meal we will never forget was the melt-in-our-mouths flounder for two served with delicious little mounds of fresh vegetables. We could taste both the sea and the farm in the meal. The wines they helped us choose with our dishes were just right. Just eware that anything served in a "spicy" sauce might not be a four-alarm fire but is in the three-alarm neighborhood.

The friendly multi-lingual servers all seem to have been there for years and obviously take great pride and pleasure in both what they serve and serving it. 

Our dinner of shared spider crab followed by individual seafood pasta dishes, shared dessert and a half-bottom of wine cost just under $100, exclusive of tip. The flounder dinner with a shared pasta first plate, dessert and a full bottle of wine came to $135. Worth every penny! 

We had no problems (in October) reserving a table the same day for 8 pm or sitting down as walk-ins at 7:30 pm, but the restaurant does fill up; reserving ahead is probably best, especially more in season.
reviews.title: Delicious and Romantic

reviews.text:
We were looking for a great restaurant and many on Rialto did not have Gluten Free pasta.  So we were pointed down an alley way to Rialto Novo.

Concern at first turned into a great meal with great service from Angelo our waiter.

First, they didn‚Äôt have wine we wanted, but their substitute was terrific!

Appetizers were terrific, Shellfish stew (Razor clams, mussels, clams in garlic butter lemon sauce) off the charts, Octopus Salad and Bruschetta also good.

Seafood stuffed ravioli, gluten free pasta and veal were really good.

Angelo was incredible on the service side with a great personality.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem!!

reviews.text: I booked in advance and was greeted by friendly and helpful staff. They suggested the special of the day, a fish ravioli, which was delicious. I also had the house red wine, which was very good. The staff were relaxed and contributed to a good atmosphere. Very nice experience.

reviews.text:
Trattoria junto al Puente de Rialto, se fue un poco la hora de comer y encontramos esta Tattoria, en el "Campo Rialto Novo", una plazoleta muy tranquila justo al lado de todo el bullicio....

Buena atenci√≥n por parte tanto del due√±o como de los camareros hasta que se llen√≥ la terraza con un grupo de casi veinte personas (espa√±olas) y se descontrol√≥ algo el servicio...as√≠,sirvieron todos los platos a excepci√≥n de uno de ellos (lasa√±a) que, tras reclamarlo, lleg√≥ fr√≠o, se pidi√≥ que la volviesen a calentar y, en el ir y venir, el resto de platos de los comensales, se enfriaron.

A pesar de todo, buena sensaci√≥n y buena comida, recomendable.

reviews.text:
The Lasagne is very good at ‚Ç¨10. Delicious if you like Lasagne, doesn‚Äôt look like much but does the job nicely. Lots of fish choices which all looked good too. Most pasta dishes are around ‚Ç¨10-14 with some seafood a little more expensive. Wine starts at ‚Ç¨25 a bottle for those interested which seems to be the normal rate in this area.

Anyway, the Lasagne is one of, if not the best I‚Äôve had. The staff are all very friendly and are happy to speak English or a little Spanish. The location is very good near Rialto bridge but just off the main path so very quiet when everywhere else seems a bit manic. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Get the Lasagne!

reviews.text: Holy mother of deliciousness. Had the special, seabass ravioli with shrimp, cherry tomatoes and zucchini, YUM!!!  Cozy, lovely location around the corner from the Rialto Bridge, had a great bottle of Montepulciano for $30 that was fantastic. Great service, great food and great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Delicious!

reviews.text: We visited for a late lunch. Had a 2 course meal 15 euros per head. Good quality food in a quiet setting in a campo 1 minute from Rialto bridge.
reviews.title: Very reasonable menu of the day

reviews.text: We were walking through the beautiful streets of Venice and we stopped for lunch while it was raining. It was delicious. We had 2 pasta dishes and the bruschetta. The pasta was perfectly cooked. The red sauce and pesto sauce were so good. The atmosphere was good on the covered outdoor patio. This would be a great place for families, couples or friends.
reviews.title: Rainy day lunch!

reviews.text:
We were taken here by my son and his girlfriend. They had been before and suggested here for our last night in Venice.
We hadn't booked but they were immediately recognised by one of the waiters. Whether that had an affect or not I don't know but the service we received, and a couple of complementary extras, coupled with the excellent food (my son and I had the fish special for two), made for the perfect end to our trip.
The restaurant isn't big and is tucked away but close to Rialto bridge. However it is in a very peacful location and has great ambiance.
reviews.title: A bit special

reviews.text:
Sfatiamo sti luoghi comuni dei posti turistici dove tutto costa carissimo e mangi male. Basta saper scegliere ed avere un minimo di attenzione. Qui siamo dietro al ponte di Rialto in uno dei posti pi√π visitati al mondo e ti sembra di stare nel ristorante di fiducia sotto casa della tua citt√†. Si mangia anche fuori in una piazzetta tranquilla. Men√π molto interessante che propone piatti della vera tradizione veneta. Poi c'√® anche il men√π turistico ma non √® la solita banalit√† per stranieri tipo la pasta bolognese, anzi tanta roba di livello.
Ho optato per la tradizione veneta ed ho goduto di uno strepitoso baccal√† alla vicentina e di superbe sarde in sahor. Servizio ottimo e personale gentilissimo e professionale.
I prezzi sono standard per la location e per la qualit√†, anzi pensavo di spendere di pi√π (media 30 euro a persona bevande incluse). Consiglio a tutti di andarci.
reviews.title: Pranzo strepitoso

Das schlimmste war dann aber das Verhalten des Kellners und des Oberkellners. Diese haben die anfangs wohlwollende Kritik nicht wirklich zur Kenntnis genommen, sondern wurden √§u√üerst unfreundlich und haben darauf verwiesen wieviel Lasagne sie bisher verkauft haben. reviews.text:
Ideal lunch spot hidden away but only 100m from rialto bridge.

Friendly staff and no nasty hidden surprises on the bill.

We sat out side but noticed the locals sit inside. The frontage hides the lovely old square which opens to the back of the restaurant. 

Food wise simply handled good ingredients. We had pasta gnocchi and salad. Draught beer costs more than bottled which was unusual but ok price wise for a restaurant.

Could cater for a vegan as well which was a positive. 

Overall a good location just hidden away from the Rialto Bridge.
reviews.title: Ideal lunch spot hidden away  100m from rialto bridge.

reviews.text:
The waiters were friendly, but the food was very expensive and nothing to brag about.
I had the scampi, it came with 4 big scampi and a sauce. No vegetables or rise etc at 25 euro. I also had a glass of Prosecco at 8,5 euro. You could never get full by any of this. 
My husband had a dish with some meat and onion, tasteless and boring. And we had a bootle of still water. We paid 73 euro all together and left still hungry. 
The most wasted money spent so far.
reviews.title: Cosy, but no good food and expensive

reviews.text:
I had the great pleasure to visit this lovely place in early June. The atmosphere is amazing, with the service is extremely kind and efficient. The coffee is awesome, and the food as well. 
I strongly recommend a quick stop when heading to Rialto and St Marco.

Reasonably priced and tasty. We had two pasta dishes with a mixed salad followed by a tiramisu. All were very enjoyable. Would have given 4.5, the 0.5 due to the OH finding his just a touch salty, but not enough to ruin.

Worth a visit.

reviews.text: My wife and son came to Europe as a graduation gift for him following his graduation from college. Visiting Venice, which is amazing by the way, I happened upon Rialto Nova while looking for a rest room. It was a very warm day so we decided we would stop and have appetizers and wine. Very nice place hidden in a courtyard just off the Rialto Bridge, and don‚Äôt listen to the trolls who gave this place a one or three star rating. It‚Äôs a wonderful place. We didn‚Äôt eat dinner, but the price is reasonable and the food smells amazing, and next time we‚Äôre in Venice, this is where we‚Äôre eating.
reviews.title: Great hidden gem

reviews.text:
On approaching this restaurant a kind gentleman introduced himself, I explain I wanted vegetarian he went through the whole menu with me. On this recommendation we went ahead with outmr lunch. We ordered a Full salad, two pasta dishes and side order of fries. 
All the food arrived. All tastes hot and fresh. Portion size could of been a bit more generous however the quality was exceptional. I would recommend this place to anyone, it is in the back area but still worth a visit.
reviews.title: As it said on the label

reviews.text:
Ci siamo imbattute in questo ristorante una sera.
Veniamo accolte da un cameriere educato e molto disponibile.
Decidiamo di ordinare il menu turistico,( uno dicarne e uno di pesce ) che comprende primo, secondo e contorno.
Non appena ordiniamo, (ad un altro cameriere) noto con dispiacere che il cameriere inizia a prendere in giro i clienti, noi compresi, che fanno il menu turistico affermando ‚Äòquesti sono amici miei, menu turistico!‚Äô
Questo comportamento l‚Äôho trovato davvero di cattivo gusto e poco professionale.
Cibo buono.

ATTENZIONE: il menu turistico viene descritto come tutto compreso, ma il coperto, acqua e caff√® sono a parte.
Capisco bene che lavorate con turisti che probabilmente non rivedrete mai pi√π ma:
1. Dovete essere professionali, perch√© prendere in giro cos√¨ i clienti √®( che vi pagano lo stipendio ) √® veramente poco piacevole.
2. Sul menu turistico esposto fuori , togliete il ‚Äòtutto compreso ‚Äò o mettete una nota su quello che non √® compreso.
reviews.title: Poca professionalit√†.

reviews.text: En una plaza tranquila al lado del puente Rialto, con camareros muy atentos y agradables y buena cocina italiana. El precio muy ajustado.
reviews.title: Buena comida y mejor servicio

reviews.text: We had walked and walked around Venice looking for a place to eat. We stumbled on this place and decided to stop. The food and service is very good. We had fantastic seafood. But at the end we were asked to pay a service fee/tip. Didn‚Äôt know we had to pay that- as we had not tipped before in Italy. But good food and ambiance.

reviews.text: My husband and I happened across this restaurant, it turned out to be a great find. Ate outside and although a chilly evening they have outside heaters. Food was good, best prosecco I have ever had! Service was great - would definitely come back if visiting Venice again. Prices were reasonable for central Venice.

reviews.text: Classico posto per truffare i turisti. Una bottiglia di vino sul men√π 10 euro mentre al momento di pagare il conto mi sono stati chiesti 30 euro. Vergognatevi

reviews.text:
A pochi passi dal ponte di Rialto con la possibilit√† di sedersi anche fuori. Scelta fra menu del giorno di carne (15‚Ç¨) e di pesce(20‚Ç¨) comprensivi di primo,secondo,contorno e caff√®.
Porzioni e qualit√† buone e il servizio veloce e cordiale.
Lo consiglio come tappa intermedia fra San Marco e la stazione di Venezia.

reviews.text:
Premetto che non era il locale che avevo scelto..ma per un errore di nome ho scoperto questo ristorante. Accoglienza eccezionale,camerieri davvero cordiali specialmente con le mie bimbe 5 e 10 anni. Antipasto di pesce buono e fresco,pasta allo scoglio e fritto buoni.

Un des rares restaurants du quartier o√π la cuisine est bonne et a vraiment l'air d'√™tre faite maison.
Service accueillant dans une rue tranquille situ√©e √† 2 pas du Grand Canal.

reviews.text:
Amazing people that make the difference!!!
Everything is home made, Feels very fresh.

reviews.text:
A primera vista parece una tratoria aut√©ntica, pero no es as√≠. El men√∫ de pescado es un enga√±o donde pese a poner claramente "tutto compreso" significa que te van a cobrar las tasas y el cubierto a parte a 5‚Ç¨ por persona. 
Los platos algunos pasables y otros lamentables. Yo no puedo comer pasta y me cambiaron los primeros por unas verduras al grill, en realidad fueron 5 lonchas de calabac√≠n y 3 trozos de pimiento rojo. Los platos muy pobres  para ser un men√∫ de 20‚Ç¨. 
Pedimos tiramis√∫ de postre, una pena porque hab√≠an mezclado el mascarpone con un mont√≥n de nata para "alargar" la crema.

reviews.text: Premetto che ci sono stato con la famiglia il luned√¨ di Carnevale e abbiamo scelto il menu turistico di pesce (20 euro a testa, bevande escluse) quindi sarebbe da riprovare in una giornata pi√π calma. I primi con una base al pomodoro abbastanza buona, ma con poco pesce, la frittura invece era buona. Male il secondo di mia moglie, soprattutto la polenta che in Veneto ti aspetti sia il top (p.s. sono veneto). Il personale √® gentile: non abbiamo preso il caff√® e ci hanno offerto i biscotti della casa. Di certo, a Carnevale, in qualsiasi posto da l√¨ a San Marco avremmo speso molto di pi√π.

We found this gem of a restaurant whilst visiting rialto bridge.if you travel from st marks and cross over the bridge the restaurant is that side.

reviews.text:
Venerd√¨ sera appena arrivati a casa con amici e figli con venticello umido e freddo il tepore dei faresti ci ha scaldati subito. reviews.text:
The waiter offered us to get some freah crab and fish not on the menu... we didn‚Äôt ask the price as on the menu everything was around 15-20 euros.

Waiter is quite charming you but you then understand why... Food is not bad but the price doesn‚Äôt correspond AT ALL..

reviews.text: My family and I went here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon with no reservation. The staff accommodated us right away with a great table. The seafood specials they have to offer are incredible. Specifically, the crab, scallops and sea bass stuffed ravioli was perfection. I would recommend this to all!

reviews.text: I‚Äôd recommend going to this trattoria. The seafood was delicious, the wine was great and the service was second to none. The risotto was my personal favourite along with the Franciacorta (Italian sparkling wine) and Amarone.

inaccettabile visto il prezzo elevato ed eccessivo dei piatti.

Ci siamo fermati perche' stavamo lavorando a venezia e siamo comunque della zona..
ad un menu' turistico proposto da 20‚Ç¨ scegliamo di prendere 3 fritture e 3 contorni, che comunque erano nel menu' evitando i primi.

Et nous avons eu raison !
