reviews.text: In vacanza a Venezia con bambini o ragazzini si √® sempre alla ricerca di un posto che possa soddisfarli senza pagare il mese a generazione ed √® molto difficile soprattutto alla sera dove i men√π fissi e menu turistici vengono abbandonati per essere proposti solo a pranzo dopo diversi tentativi abbiamo trovato questa trattoria appena dopo il ponte di Rialto il personale gentilissimo ci siamo sentiti subito come a casa proponevano anche il men√π turistico che abbiamo preso tutto buono anche il fegato alla veneziana se si mangia la carta le porzioni ovviamente sono un po' pi√π abbondanti consiglio le farfalle al salmone comunque ci siamo trovati molto bene... non avevamo piu spazio per i dolci ma con il caff√® ci hanno portato i biscottini tipici di Venezia e ci torneremo sicuramente!

reviews.text: Godt vinkort, men ikke s√¶rligt god mad og gr√∏ntsager var ikke friske. B√∏f var ikke m√∏r. Alle vare mere interesseret i at komme hjem, da vi var eneste i restauranten - klokken var kun 21.00

reviews.text: Delicious cicetti, sitting out next to the Giudecca canal. Lovely staff and interesting menu options. Not a bit touristy

reviews.text:
Una brioche e un caff√® al banco ‚Ç¨ 2,60  mi √® sembrato eccessivo, ho avuto l'impressione che fosse un prezzo per il turista di turno, perch√® alla richiesta del conto il signore cameriere ci ha pensato un p√≤ prima di rispondere.
Ho messo i soldi sul banco e lui per un bel pezzo ha fatto finta di non vederli, continuando a servire altri clienti. Ho fatto presente la cosa, lui li ha presi e li ha messi in cassa senza farmi lo scontrino. Ho chiesto lo scontrino e mi ha battuto "pane produzione forno", del reparto vendita pane che hanno a parte, e non caff√®/brioche.
Forse il prezzo chiestomi per la colazione al banco era il prezzo destinato ai tavolini sul canale? Credo di s√¨. In ogni caso il signore cameriere non √® miss simpatia e poco adatto al contatto con il pubblico.

reviews.text:
Pranzo per anniversario di matrimonio. Ci riservano un tavolo in riva (1 m di distanza) dal Canale della Giudecca, con una splendida vista sulla citt√† (fra l'altro i tavoli restano all'ombra mentre la citt√† √® illuminata dal sole, essendo a nord => perfetto).
Veramente ottimi i grissini e il pane, fatto presumo da loro. Spaghetti (fatti probabilmente in casa) alle vongole e tagliatelle ai pomodori piennoli, entrambi ottimi e pieni pieni di sapore. Poi una bellissima insalata nizzarda con tonno scottato, avocado fresco e uova di quaglia (e aceto Balsamico di Modena Giusti, marca poco nota al grande pubblico ma nettamente migliore di quella nota e pubblicizzata in televisione). Io prendo una anguilla in crosta (vedi foto), un p√≤ troppo grassa (ma l'anguilla non √® certamente un pesce magro). Ottimi i dolci e il servizio, veloce e attento. Prezzi non da pizzeria ma perfettamente allineati alla qualit√† del cibo e alla location.

reviews.text: Part of a chain of bakeries, but this one with a full sit-down dining menu available too.  The owner told me that this is a pilot concept site, and its success means that he will soon be opening more like it.  I can see why.  I approve of any restaurant with a simple 1-page food menu and a 10-page wine list!  Food was freshly prepared, with evident passion, and absolutely delicious.  A great alternative to some of the better-known but much busier trattorias in this area.

reviews.text: Tr√®s bonne adresse, tr√®s bons repas, vins de qualit√©s. Serveurs agr√©ables. Je recommande sans h√©siter.

reviews.text: Da venezia,seguendo il consiglio di amici ,ci siamo recati in questa pasticceria zona Giudecca per colazione,ed √® stata una piacevole colazione,seduti all'esterno in una bella mattina assolata con vista canale,stupendo.Di queste pasticcerie ce ne sono altre a Venezia ,ma noi abbiamo scelto Giudecca per via del panorama e si √® rilevata un ottima scelta.Abbiamo preso 2 cappuccini, 1 croissant,1 crostatina alla frutta e tortina alla ricotta e uvetta per un costo totale di 7,50 euro.
reviews.title: colazione vista canale

reviews.text: Locale molto curato, qualit√† del pane e salumi ottima, pasticceria altrettanto ottima. Personale cordiale e alla mano. Consigliatissimo

reviews.text:
In der Auslage lag ein Pizzast√ºck. Darin eine Fahne mit Schild: 4 EUR.

Wir haben zwei St√ºck f√ºr 8 EUR bestellt. Bekommen haben wir das Pizzast√ºck in der Auslage, in zwei H√§lften geschnitten.

Abzocke.
reviews.title: Betrug bei Preisauszeichnung

reviews.text:
Wir haben das Majer leider erst an unserem letzten Abend gefunden. Es war ein unheimlich sch√∂ner Ausklang des Urlaubs: Direkt in der 1. Reihe auf der ruhig gelegenen Promenande der giudeca mit Blick nach San Marco.

Ganz tolles und kreatives Essen, gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis, sehr freundlicher Service.
reviews.title: Tolles kreatives Essen, tolle Lage, sehr freundlicher Service. Gerne wieder!

reviews.text:
Sono stata al Mayer con la mia famiglia domenica 21 giugno. Abbiamo ordinato diversi piatti: dalla pizza, ai crostini al baccal√† mantecato, dai paccheri al pesce alle tagliatelle al rag√π. Tutto squisito e i dolci sono veramente eccezionali! Senza dubbio √® il migliore ristorante tra tutti quelli che abbiamo provato a Venezia, vale la pena recarsi alla Giudecca, anche solo per pranzare al Mayer. 
Personale molto gentile.
reviews.title: Ristorante eccellente

reviews.text: The Best Bakery in Town, Not only the "Canollos", the Tiramissu! What an amazing place to be. You can't be too far from one of the shops! In my opnion the only cannolli worth eating!
reviews.title: Leave the guns Take the Canolli

reviews.text: This is a bakery. Not only does it serve wonderful fritelle, but also wines from some of the greatest winemakers in Italy, like Gravner, COS and Frank Cornelissen. In England it would be like Greggs selling Nyetimber. So unexpected. Lovely loos too. Go.
reviews.title: This bakery sells astonishing wine

reviews.text: El ambiente es muy acogedor y el servicio es altamente profesional. Se ve que el menu cambia segun las estaciones, lo que significa que la comida es super fresca. Precios de acuerdo con la alta calidad de la materia prima. Volveremos!!!
reviews.title: Excelente cena!

reviews.text:
Two men in their 30s behind the ¬´¬†bar¬†¬ª, serving the people. Both not smiling, not replying hellos to those saying so entering the place. Hardly being nice with the italian speaking people, being absolutely rude to the tourists  (who, though, tried to be polite and saying a few words in Italian). They looked annoyed when taking each order, snapping back in their lame English when being asked quick details. 
Getting the money and not even saying goodbye when giving the change back, eventhough we did with a smile. 
And the food is not even astonishing. 
The shop looks trendy but go elsewhere, you will have a better welcome. After 5 days i Venice, was the first time we met such rude people !
reviews.title: Rude owners

reviews.text: Un fine settimana a Venezia, base in Giudecca e - dato il tempo - ho avuto modo di approfittare dell'accoglienza di questo locale per due simpatiche merende, chiacchierando con un'amica. Il personale √® gentile, ci si pu√≤ attardare a chiacchierare, vicino a noi c'era chi leggeva. Ambiente moderno, belle luci e bei materiali. Ottima la cioccolata calda in tazza e la piccola pasticceria. Prezzi nella media.
reviews.title: Ottima pasticceria

reviews.text: There is a restaurant and a bakery next to it with the same name.  We frequented the bakery several times, each time the food was excellent.  Desserts are heavenly, especially the cannoli.  Their bread is amazing.  Waiters are friendly and some speak English.
reviews.title: The best bakery in Giudecca

reviews.text: Majer is still there, serving some of the best food and drinks in Venice, from this delightful spot on the Giudecca. We always visit, and never regret it. Thank you to their wonderful staff
reviews.title: As lovely as ever

reviews.text: Bel endroit, personnel jeune et sympa. Excellent caf√©, viennoiseries, tartes sal√©es, focaccia. Bref l‚Äôendroit id√©al pour d√©marrer la journ√©e
reviews.title: Super petit d√©jeuner

reviews.text:
Eravamo per caso a Giudecca, abbiamo visto questo locale subito piccolo ma molto carino con la cucina a vista, ci sediamo arriva il cameriere subito educato e gentile , ci porta i menu e ci aiuta con la scelta del vino , invece di fregarci come succede sempre a venezia , ci consiglia di provera i crostini di stagione che erano eccezionale come antipasto , poi ci porta due primi fatti da loro con due tagliate di carne , tutto bello anche il caffe fatto da loro .
Prezzi alla sua altezza
reviews.title: Piccolo tranquillo ma molto buono!!

reviews.text: Sehr sch√∂n am Kanal gelegen, nur leider ein dermassen unversch√§mter Kellner, dass es einem die Sprache verschl√§gt. Never again!
reviews.title: Haarstr√§ubend

reviews.text: Bien pr√©sent √† Venise, Majer est un groupe de restauration rapide, les boutiques sont neuves, le service est au top et les pizzas sont savoureuses. C'est le deuxi√®me site que l'on visite et franchement c'est vraiment tr√®s bien.
reviews.title: Conforme √† l'esprit de cette chaine

reviews.text: Stumbled across this place when having a walk before we could check into our hotel. Cute little bakery with focaccia and beautiful looking cakes. We grabbed some pizza which was tasty, and some fresh pomegranate juice. Busy little bakery for a quick coffee. Also open for dinner too but we didn‚Äôt check it out.
reviews.title: Cute little bakery

reviews.text:
We ate here twice on our last visit to Venice in March this year and so a return was a must when staying at the nearby Hilton on my birthday.

As always, the food and wine was fantastic.  Service is great and the ambience is lovely.  The restaurant is small and very popular so booking is essential.

I mentioned an earlier visit and when I got my credit card bill after returning home in March, noticed a mistake that my Bank were unable (maybe unwilling) to help me rectify.  I pointed this out when visiting this time and so I was delighted and surprised at the end of the meal with a significantly adjusted bill.  I hadn‚Äôt asked for, nor expected that so massive credit to the staff for brilliant customer service.

The menu is amazing and I am already thinking about our next visit to Majer.  That just happens to be tonight!
reviews.title: Fabulous Birthday Dinner

reviews.text: Frische sehr leckere Speisen zu jeder Malzeit. Auch zum Fr√ºhst√ºck sehr gut geeignet. Frisch gepresste S√§fte, belegte Brote, Snacks und S√ºssspeisen‚Äîalles von h√∂chster Qualit√§t zu angemessenen Preisen. Preisniveau auf Guidecca liegt unter dem in Venedig.
reviews.title: Tolle Seisen und Snacks

reviews.text: Lagoon views on Guidecca lookingbout to St. Marks Square. Fabulous wine or coffee. Gorgeous desserts
reviews.title: Cafe with a view

reviews.text: Sono stato a cena un sabato sera con mia moglie. Il locale all'interno √® piccolo ma arredato bene e accogliente, i tavoli nella sala in fondo sono per√≤ decisamente troppo vicini, sembra di mangiare insieme a chi ti sta a fianco, forse √® meglio rinunciare a qualche coperto ma lasciare un po' pi√π di spazio e privacy. Abbiamo mangiato i crostini con baccal√† mantecato, filetto di tonno in crosta con salsa di rapa rossa e una tagliata di fassona (cottura media). Il baccal√† sicuramente il piatto migliore. La tagliata abbastanza buona la carne, anche se non aveva nemmeno un decimo del gusto della carne di fassona che si mangia nelle Langhe, ma troppo cotta nella parte esterna, che risultava un po' dura. Buone le verdure di accompagnamento, sembravano cotte al vapore poi saltate un po' sulla griglia. Il tonno invece non mi √® piaciuto. Crosta di semi troppo spessa, il tonno non aveva un gran sapore quindi anche quel poco veniva coperto. Assolutamente sbagliata a mio parere la salsa, che non c'entrava nulla col tonno e ne copriva quel po' di sapore che arrivava dopo la crosta. Buona la selezione dei vini, ma nel calice che ho preso io ce ne saranno stati 3 sorsi, massimo 2 dita e mezzo, un po' pochino... Rapporto qualit√† prezzo assolutamente sproporzionato. Sembra come se si dessero un po' troppe "arie" senza alcun motivo. Ho visto passare la carne giapponese, e dopo pi√π di un mese passato in giappone posso dire che nemmeno ci somiglia a quella che si serve a Tokyo, Kyoto e Osaka. Non ci tornerei.
reviews.title: Niente di entusiasmante

reviews.text: We were looking for a popular priced restaurant within walking distance of the Hilton Stucky, and this place was about a 10 minute walk. Tables were set along the canal. Food was very nice, casual, good service, friendly staff. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Very nice place on the canal

reviews.text: Dinner on a table aside waterfront is a romantic option, but if you choose Majer to make it happen, you should be really patient. Food is tasty, but service is poor. Waited 40 mins for a  simple desert to be served... Homemade pasta is delicious, so  don‚Äôt miss it. So was the desert, when finally came. If you‚Äôre not hurry, you can enjoy sunset with a pasta plate in front of you...
reviews.title: Waiting is a virtue...

reviews.text: Local moderno, bonito dise√±o, con terraza al lado del mar. Adem√°s de pasta, hamburguesas y otros platos a la brasa, con muy buena materia prima y atenci√≥n esmerada. Muy buena relaci√≥n calidad precio
reviews.title: Peque√±o local con encanto

reviews.text: The place? The staff? Tye food? The wine? The view? Everything was fantastic! I went with my wife and we loved it!
reviews.title: Top!!!

reviews.text: We found Majer one evening while walking along the Giudecca canal. The view of Venice was beautiful, the wait staff was very welcoming, the food was delicious, and the prices were fair.
reviews.title: Lovely Visit

reviews.text: Cordialit√†, simpatia, bel design, ottimi prodotti, sapore dei piatti buono! Niente da dire tranne il fatto che le porzioni sono molto piccole per piatti enormi e in rapporto al servizio qualit√†/prezzo. Ma ci si pu√≤ passare sopra! Direttrice di sala squisita
reviews.title: Buono su tutta la linea ma non eccellente

reviews.text: Piccolo locale con al centro la qualit√†: delle materie prime, della cucina, del servizio. Piatti di gusto e mai banali con ricerca di gusti autentici. Personale sempre gentile e attento alla piena soddisfazione del cliente. Molto pulito, prezzi adeguati anche in relazione allo scenario incomparabile offerto, in particolare la sera.
reviews.title: Qualit√† e gentilezza

reviews.text: We stayed on Giudecca last time we were in Venice and discovered this place and having discovered it then we wanted to come back this trip even through we were staying in Murano this trip. It‚Äôs a fabulous place and we stopped in for coffee, lunch and cakes. Everything was fabulous, looks as good as it tastes. We thought it was reasonably priced for Venice we the exception of the green side salad we offered which we got 10 euros for! We will go back probably tomorrow but won‚Äôt be having a salad! Lovely helpful staff happy to converse in English. Cakes are delicious and beautifully presented.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!! Great staff, great location, reasonable prices and great food!

reviews.text: Enfin un vrai restaurant √† Venise. Un service efficace plein de gentillesse et de sinc√©rit√©. Des plats d√©licieux, go√ªteux et pr√©par√©s avec des ingr√©dients de grandes qualit√©s. Et  last but not least, une addition sans sel ! Un endroit √† visiter √† Venise.
reviews.title: D√©licieux

reviews.text:
Wir sind heute auf dem Weg ins Hotel gewesen und haben hier f√ºr einen kleinen s√º√üen Snack angehalten. Wir haben ein Tiramisu und zwei kleine K√ºchlein gegessen. Alles schmeckte sehr lecker und auch der Cappuccino war echt gut. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und sprach super englisch. 
Wir werden auf jeden Fall wiederkommen.
reviews.title: Super

reviews.text: C‚Äôest le restaurant qu‚Äôon a pr√©f√©r√© √† Venise, on n‚Äôy a m√™me √©t√© 2 fois de suite. Que ce soit la viande, le poisson, l‚Äôentr√©e, le dessert, le service tout est parfait. Les serveurs sont tous tr√®s chaleureux, le patron l‚Äôest d‚Äôautant plus. Pour couronner le tout on a une superbe vue sur Dorsoduro lorsqu‚Äôon d√©jeune en terrasse. reviews.text:
Consiglio questo posto per la gentilezza e la qualit√† del cibo. Posto veloce e simpatico, ottima vista su Venezia.

Prezzo nella norma.
reviews.title: Ottimo posto

reviews.text:
Ore 18.10 del 13/08.
Vivo in Giudecca da anni per lavoro e per festeggiare una promozione con i colleghi a lavoro volevo fare un ordine di brioches e dolci per la prossima settimana.
Entro da Majer ed una signorina dietro il banco mi guarda rigorosamente senza un saluto di benvenuta o un sorriso e dice "il servizio bar √® chiuso adesso apro il ristorante".
Al che le spiego che non sono interessata al bar e le dico che vorrei ordinare delle brioches. Non faccio in tempo a finire la frase che la signorina di colpo sbotta "brioches finite non ne ho pi√π". Le spiego che mi sarebbero servite per la settimana prossima e solo in quel momento si riprende e dicendomi che allora andava bene si accinge a prendere penna e taccuino per annotare.
Molto alterata a quel punto mi sono sentita non solo trattata in modo indecente ma anche presa in giro e ho deciso di non concludere l'ordine e di andarmene.
Accoglienza zero, cortesia ed ascolto zero. Tanta maleducazione.
reviews.title: Maleducazione

reviews.text: Prima eten en heel aardige bediening. De gebarbecued mosselen zijn fantastisch. Eigenlijk een plek om terug te komen.
reviews.title: Prima eten en mooie locatie aan het water.

reviews.text: Several of them in Venice. Lovely little bakery. Quiches, light sandwiches and dessert. Wonderful cream filled pastries
reviews.title: fabulos desserts

reviews.text: This newcomer to Giudecca has crossed the water to occupy a prime position on the waterfront and compete with the long-established local bakers and restaurants and bars. Very expensive and disliked by locals but there is no doubt that their food is high quality and their bread is good.
reviews.title: Posh expensive bakery newcomer

reviews.text: A parte il fatto che sembrava ci avessero fatto un favore a darci un panino perch√© la cucina stava per chiudere...ma quando abbiamo fatto notare che lasciando i resti sui tavoli si avvicinavano gabbiani e piccioni, la cameriera Veronica ci ha risposto in modo molto maleducato. Sconsiglio vivamente.
reviews.title: Simpatia e cortesia...non qui

reviews.text:
Siamo stati a cena da Majer alla Giudecca, posto che avevamo gi√† conosciuto come pasticceria e gelateria di livello veramente fuori dal comune. 
Devo dire che a cena alla location davvero suggestiva, che con il tramonto d‚Äôestate diventa semplicemente unica, si aggiunge una qualit√† eccellente dei piatti serviti, oltre al servizio estremamente professionale che avevamo gi√† conosciuto nella pasticceria.
Vivamente consigliato per chiunque cerchi a Venezia un luogo suggestivo e non ordinario per mangiare e al tempo stesso con un corretto rapporto qualit√†-prezzo
reviews.title: Cucina raffinata e una location unica

reviews.text:
What. A hidden gem of a place .
Please don‚Äôt judge the majer by looking at the in assuming front or small tables
Out side .

reviews.text:
You cant go to Majer to have only Coffee, if you are a dessert lover, then you must try their different sweets.

reviews.text:
Wir waren auf der Suche nach einem Cafe das am Wasser war, aber nicht direkt am Hauptgeschehen. Die Wahl fiel auf dieses. Wir haben dort gefr√ºhst√ºckt. Es gab eine gute Auswahlvon s√ºssen St√ºckchen. Kinder waren von den Muffins nicht √ºberzeugt - wobei, muss man in Venedig Muffins essen? Die Arancinis waren gut und w√ºrden auch aufgew√§rmt. Etwas undurchsichtig war die Preispolitik. Wir haben nicht das, was ausgeschrieben war (mindestens in 2 F√§llen). Andererseits waren auch so die Preise manierlich. 
Die Anzahl der Tische drau√üen ist begrenzt. Innen sieht es recht sch√∂n aus (die Toiletten waren ordentlich und sehr sauber - muss ich noch erw√§hnen)! Ich kann es getrost weiterempfehlen!
reviews.title: Sehr nettes Eckchen

reviews.text:
Staying at the nearby Hilton, we had dinner in Majer. We ordered several dishes from the a la carte menu - mussels to share, squid ink pasta and desserts for 2.
What an amazing dinner - Not only was the flavour for each dish robust and memorable, the servings were also of sufficient size. 

For the quality and quantity, the dinner was of excellent value.
reviews.title: Hearty delicious dinner of great value

reviews.text: In una Venezia piovosa dopo la Biennale siamo andati alla Giudecca (da non perdere!) appositamente per trovare un po' di pace e fare uno spuntino al Majer. Personale gentilissimo e flessibile nonostante la cucina chiusa ci hanno preparato dei piatti di affettati ottimi. I dolci buonissimi! E anche un the' verde speciale. Da andarci apposta!
reviews.title: Ottima pausa

reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant, food and very pleasant and helpful staff. Worth the water taxi across from the main Island!
reviews.title: Dinner for 2

reviews.text:
Nous avons pass√© un excellent d√Æner avec un service et un cadre parfait !

Nous sommes install√©s avec suffisamment d'espace entre les diff√©rentes tables et l'ambiance est tr√®s reposante et conviviale !

Le choix du plat est tr√®s difficile car tout est tentant !

Nous avons opt√© pour un hamburger boeuf du pi√©mont et un thon snack√© s√©same.

C'√©tait un r√©gal, vraiment d√©licieux et tr√®s go√ªteux !

Un verre de vin pour accompagner en suivant les conseils de la maison, juste parfait.

Et que dire des desserts, m√™me dilemne pour choisir mais une fois notre d√©volu jet√© sur le tiramisu et le crumble/ananas po√™l√©, nous avons √©t√© combl√©s !

Donc une adresse √† retenir sur tous les plans ! C'√©tait parfait !
reviews.title: Excellents plats et desserts !

reviews.text: Siamo stati accolti dalla simpatia e dalla disponibilit√† del personale. Piccolo ambiente moderno alla Giudecca. Men√π sfizioso con porzioni abbondanti. Ottimo il tagliere dei salumi.Buoni i dolci.

reviews.text: Sch√∂ne B√§ckerei, in der es auch die eine oder andere Kleinigkeit zu essen gibt. Sehr leckere s√º√üe Kuchen, Bedienung ebenfalls sehr nett - zumindest dieses Mal. Aus dem Vorjahr hatten wir es etwas anders in Erinnerung ...
reviews.title: Ideal f√ºr ein kleines Mittagessen oder Nachmittagskaffee

reviews.text: In assoluto il posto dove abbiamo mangiato meglio a Venezia. Chicheti originali e di qualit√† a prezzi onesti. Personale molto gentile.
reviews.title: Miglior pranzo a Venezia

reviews.text: We stopped in for breakfast and were not dissapointed. The staff were a little stand offish but warmed once we kept ordering the delicious pastries. We are annoyed with ourselves that we did not come here for dinner before we were to leave. Very good coffee and pastry selection.
reviews.title: Breakfast

reviews.text:
We ate here as a family (with 2 small kids) last night on our first night in Venice. It's a nicely decorated, quiet restaurant on the waterfront and we enjoyed a couple of the pasta dishes, the salmon and BLT burger. There's no children's menu or smaller portions so if you're dining as a family, be prepared to help the children out with their epic portions - the burger and chips was probably enough to feed 4, but my pasta dish was quite small so I appreciated the half a burger and mound of chips! This meant our bill was quite a bit higher than we are used to, but the quality justified it, and we managed to find a reasonably priced bottle of wine on the very extensive wine list. 

The lovely waiter (chef also? He claims his English isn't great, but it was pretty perfect! He's great with kids too!) was really charming and gifted us the beautiful house-made bread basket complimentary, he also noticed my eyes light up when we ran through the desert options and mentioned their homemade Pistacio ice cream, so he gave me a scoop of that complimentary too. It was simply THE BEST Pistacio ice cream I've bee had... No exaggeration! My partner had the cheesecake too which was also insanely good. We finished up with a lovely sambuca and coffee and rounded off a lovely evening. Grazie!
reviews.title: Go! If only for the Pistacio ice cream!

reviews.text:
I've spent a little less than a week in Europe now. My girlfriend lives in Ljubljana, Slovenia, and this is the second time I've come to visit. This time we decided to take a day and visit Venice, as I have Italian heritage and have always wanted to visit. Although this was a brief visit, my "experience" was one I'll never forget. After walking around viewing all of the sites and historical places we decided it was a great time for a coffee and found the first place we could for a cappuccino. The shop served delicious looking pizza, and from what other guests were saying it was. We were sitting outside drinking our coffee and considering getting a slice when I saw the man across the narrow path making his rounds from shop to shop delivering lunch orders for the day. I watched as his energy lifted everyone around him. He was outgoing and boisterous and I knew we needed to visit his shop. Inside we were very fortunate to speak with Alesandro, "The Shy Chef".

I've had wonderful food in my life more than I can remember, but to have an experience that will stay with me forever is a once in a lifetime opportunity. Something I heard him say to another customer (who didn't seem like they wanted to talk, just eat) was that the love that we choose to give off seeps into everything that we do, including the food that we cook and the wine that we drink.

I was sold. We sat in this little hole in the wall meat shop and had wonderful food and wonderful conversation with our host. Alesandro was born in Venice, but recently returned from Australia where he's been the past 5 years. I felt that in the short time we spent with him we became friends. He introduced my girlfriend and I to beautiful food, drink, and atmosphere.

If you're in Venice please do yourself the favor of visiting The Shy Chef. Go for his delicious meats and cheeses, and the amazing prosciutto. Go for the delicious wines, of which he is very knowledgeable. Most importantly, go with the intention of sitting for a while, and interacting with the man that puts so much love into what he does.
reviews.title: My experience

reviews.text:
We stopped looking for a quick lunch snack and decided it would be better to return for an evening meal. This (not taking away missing out on a lunch cake!) Was definitely a wise choice.

The service was perfect, setting strangely warm and cosy and food excellent. Highly recommend.

Pasta dish not massive for a hungry teenager if there was a negative so perhaps stick with a burger that looked amazing and our son would chose on a return visit.

119 Euros for 4 mains, 2 deserts and drinks was very reasonable for this part of the world.

reviews.text: Majer is a local chain of bakeries, offering all the usual items plus a variety of sandwiches.  This branch (located close to the vaporetto stop at Palanca) also offers coffee and the opportunity to eat in or to take away.  Food is very good.  Pricing is not cheap but reasonable value given quality of the food provided.
reviews.title: Very good food - not cheap

reviews.text:
Rather than compete with the crowds in Venice, we decided to stay on the island of Giudetta for one of the days of our weekend break.

After exploring the island, we perused the local restaurants and selected Majer for our evening meal.  The food and wine was excellent and we would highly recommend it. 

We started with a tasty mixed meat platter which came with a selection of excellent artisan breads baked in house and some accompaniments.

We then had a pasta main.  Mine was the squid ink tagliolini with scallops while my  wife had the wagyu beef tortellini with a nettle sauce - both dishes were excellent.  We finished with desert - again both excellent.

The restaurant had a large selection of wine and a reasonable selection of beers too.  We opted for a bottle of prosecco and a local blonde ale - both very good.

We'd highly recommend this restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent food - great service

This was on my must-try list of foods in Venice. This is the perfect on the go street foods for when you need a little snack while roaming through Venice. I love calamari but this blew my mind. 
You walk up to the window and order what you want. It‚Äôs quickly ready for you and you‚Äôre on your way. The cone cup is completely filled with calamari and it‚Äôs a lot more than you think. 
The calamari was cooked perfectly and the batter on the outside was so good ! It was like $7 for the cone of calamari. My boyfriend and I were trying all sorts of foods throughout the day so we only ordered one and it was enough for us to share for a small snack. 
Besides the fact that it was really good, it was also presented so nicely for the perfect picture of the canals.

reviews.text:
Passeggiando per Venezia ci 
siamo imbattuti in questo chiosco per puro caso. 
Un bancone con una sfilza di fritti e coni per gustare delle pietanze tipiche veneziane mentre si passeggia, il cosiddetto "scartosso".
Ci hanno fatto venire l'acquolina in bocca gi√† alle 11 di mattina! 
Proseguendo la passeggiata, arrivata l'ora di pranzo, non abbiamo trovato nulla che potesse competere con quella prima impressione. Fatto sta che siamo tornati indietro, cambiato itinerario perch√© troppo incuriositi e con ancora la voglia di cartoccio di pesce. Che dire: abbiamo fatto bene!
Difficile, se non impossibile, trovare un lato negativo. La frittura, fatta nella friggitrice a vista, era perfetta sia nella salatura che nel sapore stesso del pesce.
Il ragazzo, gentilissimo, ci ha spiegato come √® preparato il loro baccal√† alla vicentina e in pi√π ci ha fatto assaggiare il loro speciale baccal√† mantecato.
La semplicit√† arricchita da genuinit√† e cortesia rendono il tutto da 5 stelle!

reviews.text: Il locale che mancava, nel centro di Venezia. Somiglia a un fast food, quindi prezzi bassi, ma con cibo veneziano/italiano di ottima qualit√†. Non la solita pizza o il classico panino, ma una grande variet√† di fritti, insalata e altro street food. Insomma, eccellente!
reviews.title: Locale inatteso nel centro di Venezia

reviews.text:
Friggitoria e ristorante da asporto (tipo street food) a San Polo, una vasta scelta di piatti: polpette di tutti i tipi, verdure fritte, frittura di pesce, sarde in saor, mozzarelle in carrozza, baccal√† mantecato, in umido, alla vicentina, e ancora insalta di polpo, orzotto al pesto e verdure, e ancora. 
Tutti serviti in porizioni da mangiare nel piccolo spazio laterale oppure nella porzione d'asporto, sempre accompagnate da polenta (gialla o bianca a seconda dell'abbinamento).

Che dire, viene voglia di provare tutto, anche perche' tutto e' veramente ben fatto, fritture leggere e asciutte (la mozzarella in carrozza, filante croccante, pareva quasi cotta al forno tant'era asciutta),  e ricette eseguite alla perfezione (ottime polpette, baccala' in umido con polenta delizioso).
Le sarde in saor erano squisite, anni che non ne mangiavo di cosi' buone!

Da riprovare per completare tutti i piatti che non sono riuscito ad assaggiare tra pranzo e cena!

Consigliatissimo!
reviews.title: Tanto tempo che non mangiavo Sarde in Saor cosi' buone!

reviews.text:
If you're strolling through the back streets of Venice and looking for some very good street food to go, look no further than Acqua e Mais!

The seafood I chose, in my case some calamari with sardines and other seafood laid on top of a bed of polenta, was all very fresh and delicious.  A great buy for under ten euros!

reviews.text: I last visited Venice in 2003 and nearly starved looking for non-pasta, delicious vegetarian food. Not a problem anymore, I'm happy to say. But this place in particular stole my heart, as they have numerous vegetarian options and they are clearly not an afterthought. This includes a vegetarian option in the style of their main draw - the portable cones of piping-hot polenta with topping of your choice. The vegetarian option in this case, soy meatballs carefully and deliciously prepared with some kind of pesto (maybe) / pea combination. I love not feeling like a second-class foodie when traveling, and this place really fit the bill. Of course, the fish and meat options are quite good too (carnivore husband had us come back here multiple times in 4 days! he recommends the bacalao.) It's also quite hard to find portable food in Venice, where they no longer allow you to sit on the ground and eat due to new "respect Venice" regulations. So this place is clearly a win on multiple terms. Also quite affordable. Check it out!
reviews.title: They have vegetarian options!!

reviews.text:
We went here as we saw it on 'Somebody Feed Phil', we got here after peak time at 2pm which I think was one of the problems, we thought it would mean there would be no queue (which was correct) and the food would be freshly cooked (it wasn't). 

There definitely must be a difference when the owner is working here and when his other staff is. As the person who served us was disinterested and unhelpful; the fried fish was cold, stale and wasn't freshly cooked - it must have been sitting there for a few hours. I don't understand why  you would do this as it does not take long to deep fry squid/prawns?

I tried the beef meatball which was stodgy and cold, the grilled baby octopus on polenta which again was cold, rubbery and tasteless - I couldn't finish it and also tried mozzarella in carrozza - again, cold.

There's just no excuse for this, it's just lazy! I think the owner needs to have a stern word with his staff.
reviews.title: Lukewarm seafood lacking flavour

Lots of different choice of foods: seafood, meat and vegetarian. They served food which was different to a lot of places we found in Venice, which was a nice change. I struggle to tolerate fatty fried food but there was plenty of choice and I found some that wasn‚Äôt. Overall I would definitely come back here again and would certainly recommend it

reviews.text: We tried Acqua e Mais on our first trip to Venice around five years ago.  And, it was outstanding.  They serve a large selection of cicchetti style snack food that are good for a light meal or to take away.  So, we returned on a recent visit to Venice and were a little disappointed.  On our first visit, all of their food tasted freshly prepared and of top quality.  On this visit, though, some of the polpette were lukewarm and tasted as if they had been sitting around for awhile.  And, some of the seafood did not appear to have been cleaned properly and tasted "fishy".   It was not the experience that we had hoped for based on our prior visit.
reviews.title: Our return trip was a little disappointing

reviews.text:
... e quasi all'epilogo del nostro soggiorno a Venezia.
√à marted√¨ grasso e ci lasciamo andare anche noi ai festeggiamenti pi√π sfrenati.
Nel mentre, ci √® gradita una sosta da "Acqua e mais".
√à raro non trovare persone in fila, turisti, ma non solo, che hanno la nostra stessa idea.
Perch√© qui puoi trovare l'essenza della citt√†.
Le classiche fritture di laguna, ma anche il baccal√† al pomodoro o mantecato, le sarde in saor, la polenta, fritta o morbida... e chiss√† quante altre bont√† dimentico.
Non proprio una rosticceria, √® pi√π uno street food, di sicuro anche un felice riferimento per chi non ha tempo e voglia di cucinare, ma allo stesso tempo vuole mangiare cose buone.

reviews.text:
Visited for lunch 11 Oct 2020. The place is very inviting and the service was great- however it was stupid expensive for what we got. 

I got a small mixed plate with some ham and cheese wedges and 2 tiny pieces of bruschetta. Husband got gnocchi. Children got spaghetti bolognese and fries to share. We ordered one water, 2 cokes, and husband got one medium draft beer. 75 euros. Absolutely ridiculous. There was nothing memorable about the food to really remember this place a month from now other than it was really overpriced.  The food we got wasn‚Äôt bad it just wasn‚Äôt worth the money at all but stopped here because it was right by our Air B&B and it was raining. Also be aware when it rains their credit card machine doesn‚Äôt like to work.
reviews.title: Very overpriced

indirizzo "tattico" in zona campo S. Polo. Se avete la fortuna di trovare una panchina libera in quello che √® uno dei pi√π bei ed ampi campi di Venezia, approfittate ad occhi chiusi di questa piccola gemma della ristorazione cinese per poter godere delle delizie d' asporto che i due sapienti cuochi preparano per voi. 
Importante: le materie prime vengono acquistate in Italia ed i relativi fornitori indicati per rimarcare la differenziazione di questo locale e la precisa scelta di garantire un servizio di eccellenza.
Ravioli: tutti i tipi sono da provare, squisiti e con sapori differenziati non anonimi. reviews.text: Walked passed plenty of times and it was always full with people eating dumplings and slurping their soups. We decided to stop for lunch- worth it. Delicious flavour and made to order while you can watch them making the dumplings and steaming them. We had also the egg crape with vegetables and it was the most delicious of all. Living in China for 6 years I can honestly say its good food!

Abbiamo mangiato ieri sera in questo localino tra le vie di Venezia! Devo dire ravioli davvero buoni: non pesanti, giusta sapidit√†, davvero squisiti sia i classici e sia le varianti che offrono (alle verdure, ai gamberi, allo zenzero)
Tutti i ravioli son fatti sul momento
Prezzi devo dire contenuti rispetto al resto dei locali a Venezia (‚Ç¨5 x 5 ravioli, li valgon tutti!)
Non ci sono posti a sedere (nasce come cucina da asporto)la cucina √© a vista; i ragazzi mettono i ravioli in delle comode confezioni di cartoncino, con bacchette (o forchetta) e si possono gustare tranquillamente fuori dal locale o sui gradini di qualche ponticello. Consiglio!

reviews.text:
Il posto, seppur piccolo (perch√© meriterebbe essere un vero e proprio ristorante!!) offre una svariata gamma di tipiche specialit√† cinesi, che rispecchiano alla perfezione i sapori provati in Cina!

reviews.text:
Ci siamo recate per pranzo io e delle amiche (una di loro ci era gia stata) e devo dire che questi ravioli mi hanno piacevolmente sorpresa! Partendo dal presupposto che viene fatto tutto sul momento (c'√® un vetro che separa la cucina dal bancone in cui si consumano i ravioli, quindi potete vedere da voi tutto il processo di preparazione), la qualit√† degli incredienti √® ottima, soprattutto se rapportata ai prezzi.
Alla fine del pranzo ci siamo concesse queste nuvole dolci, con il ripieno alla crema, davvero buonissime!
Il ragazzo che ci ha servite, ci ha offerto anche delle uova sode da assaggiare, perch√© insaporite con della salsa di soia; molto buone anche quelle.
Non c'√® nulla di simile a Venezia, quindi √® un'idea davvero originale, che permette di mangiare qualcosa di diverso dal "classico" cinese!

Oggi sono andata con gli amici a pranzo in questa ravioleria dall'apparenza gi√† molto bella, con vetrata in cucina panoramica.
Sentita consigliata da alcuni amici siamo rimasti contenti per il gusto e per la gentilezza che ci siamo trovati davanti al cibo e al personale; abbiamo assaggiato sia i raviali con carne che i shumai, baozi e tanti altri che non elenco,decisamente molto varia la scelta.
Consiglio vivamente sia di prederne al volo anche come pranzo speciale cosi per cambiare sia di provare un'esperienza nuova nonch√® cucina di pasta fresca fatta a momento da maestri di mestiere.
Voto positivo.

Il locale √© del tipo take away, con sgabelli e mensole per consumare all‚Äôinterno del locale, pulito e ordinato. Torner√≤ per provare i dolci!

reviews.text: Restaurant avec belle terrasse sur la place, emplacement agr√©able. Les sp√©cialit√©s de fruits de mer sont excellentes. Les prix sont un peu √©lev√©s mais la qualit√© est pr√©sente. Limoncello offert en fin de repas.

reviews.text: J‚Äôai du mal √† comprendre les clients qui se plaignent du prix de 20 euros pour un plat (critique vue chez un autre client pour ce restaurant)! D‚Äôautant qu‚Äôen ce qui me concerne, un plat de spaghettis vongole nous a co√ªt√© 16 euros. Peut √™tre que le patron a chang√© ses prix! Et ce fut excellent! Idem pour les raviolis Ricotta spinaci succulents. 14 euros. L‚Äôassiette de coquilles St Jacques, extraordinaire, 18 euros. Quant √† la zuppa Cozze. Une soupe dont l‚Äôassiette est enrob√©e d‚Äôune patte qui a gonfl√©... Fa√ßon pizza calzone. Tr√®s, tr√®s bon. Merci pour le lemoncello offert. Tout √ßa sur une terrasse sympa sur la grande place San Marco √† 2 pas d‚Äôune boutique qui habille en v√™tements de sc√®ne des stars tel Elton John. C‚Äôest d‚Äôailleurs la proprietaire de ce magasin qui nous a conseill√© ce restaurant visiblement fr√©quent√© par des habitu√©s. Oui, c‚Äôest un excellent restaurant et l‚Äôavantage de Venise est qu‚Äôils sont nombreux dans cette magnifique ville.

reviews.text: ....wie bereits in anderen Bewertungen beschrieben ist es bei der Ausgabe der Speisekarte nicht ersichtlich, dass es Abends keine Pizza gibt. Au√üerdem werden pauschal 12% Trinkgeld aufgeschlagen (als Tax auf der Rechnung deklariert) - wenn man beides wei√ü und akzeptiert, kann man hier nett und lecker Essen. Auch die Getr√§nkepreise sind auf der Karte nicht ersichtlich. 8Euro f√ºr ein Glas Hauswein, 10Euro f√ºr ein Tiramisu und 3Euro f√ºr einen Espresso sollten noch erw√§hnt werden. Wenn man dies alles erst jeweils im Nachhinein mitbekommt, gibt das in der Bewertung leider nur 1 Punkt.

reviews.text: L‚Äôendroit est agr√©able, la place est jolie. Cependant c‚Äôest tr√®s cher pour ce que c‚Äôest . P√¢tes du jour √† 20 euros ( ! ) champignons et crevettes . Beaucoup de champignons peu de crevettes et sauce pleine d‚Äôeau . Donc d√©ception .

Bon emplacement sur la place. Service tr√®s long.  Nourriture de qualit√© tr√®s moyenne. Prix elev√©s et surtout la TVA de 10% est ajout√©e a l'addition! Non incluse dans les prix de la carte nous dit le serveur. Scandaleux!

reviews.text:
Das Restaurant wurde uns von einer √∂rtlichen Reiseleiterin empfohlen und befindet sich auf dem Campo Santo Stefano und es gibt dort viel zu schauen. 
Ca. 40 Tische befinden sich im Au√üenbereich. Als wir um 19 Uhr dort angekommen sind, waren zwei Tische belegt und der Service war hervorragend und humorvoll. Leider ist der Service mit zunehmender G√§stezahl immer schleppender geworden. 3 Bedienungen f√ºr 40 Tische sind einfach zu wendig.
Die Essensauswahl war hervorragend und geschmacklich sehr gut. Die immer wieder berichtete Situation, dass es am Abend keine Pizza gibt konnten wir nicht nachvollziehen.
Am Ende des Essens gab es noch zwei Sorten vom Limocello, traditionell und Bananensahne.
Der von anderen Reisenden genannte Aufschlag ist uns nicht aufgefallen.
reviews.title: Nette √ñrtlichkeit und gutes Essen

reviews.text: Grunds√§tzlich hatten wir einen sch√∂nen Abend: Man sitzt an einem sch√∂nen gro√üen Platz, das Essen war sehr gut, der Wein ebenso und der Service war flink und einigerma√üen freundlich. Die in der Karte ausgewiesenen Preise waren nicht g√ºnstig, aber f√ºr Venedig immer noch in Ordnung. Zum Abschluss gab es noch eine erstaunliche Menge Limoncello aufs Haus - so weit, so gut: man war durchaus zufrieden und dachte sich: ‚ÄûDa gehen wir wieder hin!‚Äú Man verlangte die Rechnung - und dann begann der Betrug - ja, tats√§chlich: Betrug! Es kam nur eine Rechnung mit dem Gesamtbetrag (ohne Einzelposten); hier fiel mir der komische Betrag von 171,36‚Ç¨ auf. Ich zahlte per Kreditkarte, gab 20,-‚Ç¨ Trinkgeld in bar und verlangte die offizielle steuerrelevante Rechnung. Der Grund f√ºr den unrunden Betrag war schnell ermittelt (s. Foto): es wird eine ‚ÄûTax‚Äú erhoben f√ºr die zus√§tzlich noch die IVA (eigentliche Tax) anf√§llt. Man versucht hier gezielt vor allem √úbersee-Touristen abzuzocken, die es teilweise aus ihren Heimatl√§ndern gewohnt sind, dass zu den in der Speisekarte ausgewiesenen Preisen noch die Steuer hinzukommt. Bei der ‚ÄûTax‚Äú in diesem Fall handelt es sich aber nicht um eine Steuer, sondern um eine ‚ÄûServicegeb√ºhr‚Äú, die nur als Tax ausgewiesen ist. Kompletter Betrug! Auf meine Nachfrage, was diese ‚ÄûTax‚Äú sei, wurde kurz angebunden und ausweichend geantwortet - ich wollte mir den Abend nicht noch mehr verderben lassen und lie√ü es gut sein. So ein Drecksladen sollte sich vor Gericht verantworten m√ºssen! Geht da blo√ü nicht hin! Kompletter Rip-off!
reviews.title: Rip-off! Do not visit!

reviews.text:

Gustoso anche il gelato cassata.

reviews.text: Attratto dal men√π con tocco siciliano e dalla location ho pranzato in questa struttura. Il servizio √® stato cortese e la portata scelta dalla mia compagna (ortaggi in tempura con panelle) assolutamente OK, tuttavia la sabbia negli spaghetti alle vongole mi ha rovinato il pranzo. La ciliegina sulla torta √® stato l'errore (al rialzo) sul conto che se non controllato avrebbe comportato l'addebito di una portata non consumata. I tavoli all'aperto su Campo Santo Stefano permettono di mangiare in tranquillit√† anche se si hanno bambini, soprattutto se si viene accomodati sul perimetro. reviews.text:
My wife and I came here to have a nice dinner. 

Already while ordering, the waiter was trying to up sell our orders and recommended other things. Very unprofessional! 

After choosing two pasta dishes and one antipasti, the service got really horrible. The drinks took 15 minutes to arrive. 

It took them 45 minutes between the antipasti and the main dish! 

The waiter ignored us and was rude, like the other user already criticized below. 

The restaurant also doesn‚Äôt have a transparent menu, soft drinks are not shown in the menu, and they charge 6‚Ç¨ for one can of Coca Cola, which is just a rip-off! 

The food was average, the portions small, and the overall bill was just too high. 
 
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend that restaurant! Spend your money and time somewhere else!
reviews.title: Awful experience, bad service and expensive drinks!

reviews.text: C‚Äôest notre rendez vous chaque fois que nous revenons √† Venise. Terrasse tr√®s agr√©able sur la place San Stefano, calme et a√©r√©e. Les plats sont toujours aussi frais et bon. Mention sp√©ciale pour le filet de dorade aux agrumes ! Original et frais. Le plat du jour √©tait divin : loup avec tomates c√¢pres et olives accompagn√© de pommes de terre au four. Les serveurs sont tj aimables et souriants . Tr√®s bon tiramisu maison qui est leur leur dessert f√©tiche et mon sorbet au citron parfait  ! On reviendra c‚Äôest certain ...

reviews.text:
Wir sind in das Restaurant gegangen nachdem wir uns davor die aufgestellte Speisekarte angesehen haben und beide eine der dort genannten Pizzen essen wollten. 
Am Anfang des Abends hat der Kellner noch 1-2 dumme Witze gerissen und uns die beiden teuersten Gerichte der Karte empfohlen. Erst als wir schon Wasser am Tisch hatten und unsere Pizza bestellen wollten, er√∂ffnete man uns, dass es abends gar keine gibt. Ob immer oder nur an diesem Abend, kann ich nicht mit Sicherheit sagen. Es kann aber in keinem Fall sein, dass man uns erst beim Bestellen!! dar√ºber informiert, dass es keine Pizza gibt. 
Wir haben dann notgedrungen doch Pasta gegessen. Da diese nicht die teuerste auf der Karte war, behandelte man uns ab diesem Zeitpunkt wie Luft. Uns wurde der Wein und das Essen auf den Tisch geklatscht ohne nur eines Blickes gew√ºrdigt zu werden. Die Pasta waren ok, mehr aber bei aller Liebe nicht. 
Nach mehrfacher Nachfrage und 20 min Wartezeit haben wir dann auch endlich einmal die Rechnung bekommen - nat√ºrlich ohne uns anzusehen oder - Gott bewahre - anzusprechen. Das Preis Leistungsverh√§ltnis war entsprechend unserem Besuch - bescheiden. 
Also meine Empfehlung: Wer einen netten Abend m√∂chte, geht lieber woanders hin! 
Liebes Beccafico Team, ich habe selbst w√§hrend meiner Studienzeit in einem Italiener als Servicekraft gearbeitet... ein bisschen Freundlichkeit schadet nie und ein einfaches "prego" hat noch keinem weh getan.
reviews.title: Frech

reviews.text: Il locale √® situato in un ampio campo molto tranquillo √® abbastanza pittoresco, il personale √® davvero molto gentile, ma dal vivo mi attendevo di pi√π. Preso un primo di pesce che non era saporitissimo. Prezzi abbastanza elevati ma in linea, mi sembra, con quelli di altri ristoranti centrali a Venezia.

Nous √©tions √† Venise juste apr√®s la fin du confinement √† une √©poque o√π il y avait encore peu de touristes. Le service a √©t√© m√©diocre... nous avions l‚Äôimpression d‚Äôennuyer le serveur... 
il y a beaucoup de restaurants o√π vous passerez une meilleure soir√©e

Decidiamo per il dolce e la scelta √® proprio poca. Un errore poi anche per il conto. Ma quando arriva quello giusto il prezzo non √® eccessivo per Venezia

reviews.text: Wir waren in unserem einw√∂chigen Venedig-Urlaub zweimal hier beim Essen. Gro√üartige Fisch- und Meeresfr√ºchtek√ºche, super Pasta, super Pizza, guter Wein, schickes Ambiente, nette Kellner. Unbedingt hingehen und genie√üen!!!

reviews.text: We ate here because of a recommendation from an acquaintance, but unlike Riva Rialto, this was not a great dining experience.  There was a waiter in charge with a couple of other people helping him.  He was not very personable and ignored us through most of the meal.  The food was good, but everything took a long time.  Once the plate was on the table the waiter never looked our way again.  A large part of fine dining is great service and it was surely lacking at A Beccafico!
reviews.title: Good Food, Poor Service

reviews.text:
Nous avons tr√®s bien d√Æner, et, malgr√© l‚Äôheure tardive de notre arriv√©e, avons √©t√© tr√®s bien accueillis.
Nous avons suivi les conseils du serveur, pour des p√¢tes au homard.
C‚Äô√©tait d√©licieux.
Le service fut impeccable, sur nappes blanches, avec un charme un peu d√©suet.
Petite bouteille de limoncello bien frais √† la fin.
reviews.title: Classique

reviews.text:
Ok, let's start with the "bad"/neutral experience, which was the service.

Restaurant Al Beccafico is the typical place which can come across too sales-y. Throughout our lunch we were asked many times if we want to eat/drink more and sometimes it definitely became too much. The absolute worst of it was when we asked for our dessert and the bill. Three different waiters came and asked: "Would you like a wine? / Would you like one more beer? / Would you like anything more to drink?", by the end of which they could perceive the frustration on our face and thus hurried to bring the cheese plate and our bill.

What "saves" this restaurant is the location with the outside seating - that allows you to people/costume-watch - and the food. Both our seafood risotto and the cheese plate were quite tasty.
Good enough in fact, to overall bump the score up to a 4/5 for us.
As such, just ignore the style of the service if you come here. Just enjoy the food, the sun/warmth and the crowds passing by :)
reviews.title: Ignore the service and enjoy the location and the food

reviews.text: Excellent restaurant, personnel agr√©able, je recommande üëçcuisine digne d‚Äôun gastronomique.Rien √† dire parfaitement
reviews.title: D√Æner en couple

reviews.text:
Sono rimasta estasiata dalla bont√† dei piatti serviti in questo ristorante. Pepata di cozze molto saporita, i primi erano davvero buoni e la frittura di pesce era fantastica. Anche il tiramis√π (sul quale solitamente sono molto scettica) era prepato divinamente.
Il locale era molto elegante e raffinato. Il tavolo che affacciava sul canale, attraverso una vetrata ci ha permesso di cenare con un panorama molto rilassante.
Ci ha serviti un signore molto garbato, che ha fatto sentire me e mia sorella a casa e che, in occasione del mio compleanno, ha portato una candelina sul dolce.
Infine il prezzo estremamente in linea con la qualit√† e la quantit√† di quello che abbiamo gustato.
Sicuramente prima ma non ultima volta da Beccafico Arte.
reviews.title: Meraviglia delle meraviglie

reviews.text: Le restaurant a re√ßu beaucoup de bonnes critiques, alors nous sommes pass√©s pour le d√©jeuner. Le go√ªt est merveilleux.
reviews.title: Le go√ªt merveilleux et authentique

reviews.text:
Most underrated spot in Venice.  Great menu for this quiet corner treasure.  Everything was fresh and homemade.  The service was excellent and friendly

Caught them near closing, after a night at the Opera.  They couldn't be most accomodating.
 
Great food, drinks, deserts, service, and Price!  Four adults with full courses and wine was just over 200 euros.

Don't pass them by!
reviews.title: Best of Venice

reviews.text:
In Campo Santo Stefano there are lots of bars and places to eat. A Beccafico is a restaurant that offers a lovely menu that is different from many of the others in town. It has not only various seafood and meat options but vegetarian as well and and it stays open late. (After theatre dinner is an option).
The big decision is what kind of a meal do you want on this particular occasion? The risotto with seafood is excellent as is the warm seafood salad. Or stay away from seafood and have an appetiser of artichokes with melted cheese and a vegetarian pasta. So many choices, so little time.
Depending on the season reservations are strongly suggested. This is a place to come to more than once.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming

reviews.text:
Beccafico was on a list of recommendations from a friend; the list has otherwise proven to be excellent.

The night we went there wasn't a single Italian voice to be heard. Always a worry...

The food was no better than mediocre. The most disappointing dish was the fritto misto di pesce. Oily. poorly seasoned, and generally tasteless. Frozen ingredients that were dumped into the fryer. Two members of our group had the zuppa di cozze which had an amusing bread cover.

The wine list was uninspiring and overpriced.

The service was the one aspect of the meal that was satisfactory. Although the food was slow in coming, the staff were polite and helpful.

Interestingly, this is the only restaurant in Venice that added a service charge to the bill.

It is also the only disappointing meal we have had in an otherwise memorable week...
reviews.title: Mediocre Food - Very touristy

reviews.text: The restaurant is situated in a nice place, not so far San Marcos square. The service was very good, and the food excellent. We ate and original mussels and a very very good fish but the best plate was the tiramisu, I think it is the best tiramisu that I have ever eaten.
reviews.title: Very very good

reviews.text:
We descended on A Beccafino.
Had to sit inside as it was very cold.
They quickly put together a table for us, and delivered Tomato Croutons and Prosecco. We really sampled the entire menu. Great Seafood, Soups, Crudo and Salads, all very professionally prepared, Pizzas and a super rare Tuna dish, were absolutely delicious. We ate well with very attentive service. By the way continued with the original very well balanced and well priced Prosecco which suited their menu perfectly.
We were too full for desert, and received lovely complimentary digestives. As we are staying close by we will certainly go back. Pricing worked out around at 45‚Ç¨ each. 
Very good for a high quality Venice 
well located Restaurant.
reviews.title: Super Dinner, group of 7 friends.

reviews.text: We both had pasta dishes which were lovely - simply and precisely made and tasted really good. The atmosphere is subtle, both relaxed and modern, and the wait staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. A good wine list and a wide range of dishes. Excellent limoncello to finish the meal!
reviews.title: Tasty food, lovely staff and nice atmosphere

reviews.text: Un d√©jeuner et un d√Æner dans ce restaurant que nous suivons depuis quelques ann√©es. Si le personnel est efficace et sympathique, le poisson bon, la bouteille de lemoncello √† la fin du repas toujours l√†, j'ai trouv√© que les prix avaient augment√©s, sans justification particuli√®re. Les desserts sont quelconques, et le restaurant vieillissant (chaises, toilettes..).
reviews.title: D√©ception

reviews.text: This restaurant was recommended by our hotel. It was quite empty: elderly tourists were the only clients. We were shocked by the uninspirational menu with highly priced ordinary sum) which turned out to be one of the worst we ever ate: it was tasteless, full of water and made with frozen prawns. We decided to call it a day and promptly left after trying the risotto. Fortunately we were not asked to pay. I would strongly recommend anyone not to go to this tourist scam.
reviews.title: A rip off for tourists

reviews.text:
Posto molto carino..personale gentile.
Ho ordinato un primo.. Conchiglioni ripieni di ricotta... Buonissimi..peccato che ne erano 4!!   Spendere 42‚Ç¨ ed uscire che hai ancora appetito non va proprio bene! Piatti poveri e cari.
reviews.title: "Cenetta"

reviews.text: Visited this restaurant for dinner first night in Venice. Hotel recommended as well as TA. Did not disappoint. Outside dining on the piazza watching the world walk by. Service was friendly and prompt. Food was excellent as well as the wine. Several restaurants nearby but we felt this was the best.
reviews.title: Excellent On Piazza

reviews.text:
Giunti a Venezia mi appoggio a TripAdvisor e capisco subito che questo ristorante fa al caso nostro. 
Personale gentilissimo. 
Il risotto ai frutti di mare √® eccellente. Gli spaghetti al sugo, che sono sempre la prova del nove, ottimi. Sontuosi i due filetti con verdure alla griglia. Ci serviranno 3 sorbetti su scorza di limone prodigiosi. Molto bene.
reviews.title: Molto bene

reviews.text: De betere keuken. Goede bediening. Aanrader om wat uitgebreider te dineren. Ook qua prijs meevaller.
reviews.title: De betere keuken

reviews.text:
‚ÄòNo lunch..??!!‚Äù

hmmm..! May have even remarked, damn tourists.. !!
reviews.title: Poor and rude hospitality

reviews.title: Molto buono

reviews.text:
Diciamo che il livello gastronomico √© accettabile, senza essere nulla di speciale.

I prezzi tendono ad essere un po' alti, praticamente tutti i piatti di pesce sui 30‚Ç¨.

Il conto include un 12% di servizio. Orbene, sorprendentemente, il cameriere ci informa che questo 12% non va al personale ma al ristorante stesso...Mi sentii obbligato a lasciare 10‚Ç¨ di mancia.
reviews.title: Buona qualit√°, non ottima, con una sorpresa alla fine

reviews.text: A Beccafico was outstanding not only for its food, but also for the excellent service we received. Our reservation was quite late - 9:45 pm and we stayed until after 11:30 pm, but at no point did the staff stop smiling, being attentive, and bringing us all the delicious primi, secondi, contorni, and of course, dolci! Add to that the refreshing Aperol Stpritz glasses and the impressive cocktails, A Beccafico is a restaurant I recommend without hesitation. Its location is quite beautiful as well.
reviews.title: Recommended Dining!

reviews.text:
Great location, lovely restaurant (we sat outside) and great waiting staff. Good wine list and a lovely menu. We had starters of seafood soup and mixed meats and then pasta dishes for main and it was lovely. 

Pricey, but comparable to everywhere else in Venice - Would recommend for lunch and evening meal.
reviews.title: Lunch

reviews.text: Went here with a few friends and had a very good meal. Not cheap but you are in one of the best locations in Sant Marco and it is good. Excellent wine list.
reviews.title: A very good restaurant

reviews.text: Sat outside for lunch.  Near the Accadamia bridge. A little pricey but worth it.  Delicious wine.  I had pasta with clams and scallops and my hubby had a white pizza with four cheeses.  This restaurant was recommended by friends and I would recommend it as well.
reviews.title: Enjoyable lunch

reviews.text:
We had a brilliant meal here!  I can highly recommend the artichoke appetiser, tuna main and tiramisu was to die for (and I don‚Äôt normally eat desserts)

Beautiful food, great flavours lovely atmosphere.  Make sure you reserve a table if you want to eat inside.
reviews.title: Fantastic Meal and service

reviews.text: Some of the best food in Venice! Restaurant has an indoor space but definitely opt for an outdoor table on the lively (but not touristy) piazza. I had an amazing veal marsala and a friend had an equally amazing seafood dish. Highly recommended - make a reservation. Not cheap but well worth the price. I have introduced this place to friends and family who have returned to it every time they come to Venice. You will too!
reviews.title: Delicious, classic Venetian food, beautifully presented in a lovely outdoor space

reviews.text: Il servizio √® molto buono, leil personale cordiale, atmosfera raffinata senza eccessi. Il cibo √® buono , ci √® piaciuto l'antipasto di cozze  (non ricordo il nome) , servito dentro una pasta sottile. Il pesce ottimo e fresco.

We were sat at a lounge table. 
Have ordered starters, they tried clearing table half way through. Then waited 20 mins and gave up waiting for a main. No deserts offered either. 3 starters and 2 drinks was 40 quid. Ridiculously priced. On top of that they had the audacity to put a tip for the staff on my bill. Food looked very fancy and staff were very friendly.

reviews.text: A brief trip to Venice for my partner‚Äôs birthday, however this restaurant regardless of the brief visit stood out amongst the five or six places we ate at. So much so that we tried to return on the third day for lunch but found it closed until the evening service. I‚Äôve come to learn if a restaurant in Venice  closes throughout the afternoon to prep for the evening, it probably means it‚Äôs definitely one of the better restaurants. I had clam spaghetti and my partner had fish stew. We also had starters beforehand and prosecco to accompany our meal. Very close to the next table but our neighbours were delightful and we engaged in conversation, which added to the evening (although we are also happy in each other‚Äôs company, it‚Äôs nice to be travelling and get chatting with new people, so this turned out to be a good thing!) Some of the waiters more pleasant than others, we were lucky that the main person who served us was very charming. Reasonably priced for the quality - I‚Äôve seen someone said it was expensive, but I think well worth what we paid, which was just over ¬£100 for two courses each and bottle of prosecco (this includes service). Can‚Äôt wait to go back here next time we are in Venice.
reviews.title: Favourite restaurant in Venice

reviews.text: Dinner was fine but nothing more than that. Much much better restaurants nearby in Venice. The food was fine and can‚Äôt complain but not cheap and then (unlike everywhere else is Venice) they put a mandatory service charge on top. My recommendation is go elsewhere for better food at cheaper price
reviews.title: Better elsewherw

reviews.text: Located in a lovely square (Campo San Stefano) near Accademia bridge. Seating mainly outside under canopy. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation but no problem for 2 of us around 7pm (restaurant about 2 thirds full). Greeting was lukewarm but drinks etc brought in good time. I was given the wrong order for my starter but it looked ok & I didn‚Äôt feel like waiting so said no problem, I‚Äôll take it. Waiter realised his mistake but from then on was even more unfriendly and offhand. Food was good (great tiramisu) but we had better at similarly priced restaurants elsewhere in Venice (off the beaten track).
reviews.title: Good restaurant let down by service

reviews.text:
A un endroit tr√®s strat√©gique de Venise,

Grazie per tutto üëåüèº

reviews.text: The food was great. It leans towards fish but a tenderloin with green peppercorn sauce was available and outstanding. There were not many pasta selections so my wife had the eggplant parmesan which was good as well. This was the only place, to this point, in our trip to have Brunello Di Montalcino wine by the glass which we prefer.
reviews.title: Great Food and Brunello Wine

reviews.text: Ottima la location. Sorpresi di trovare specialit√† siciliane a Venezia, cibo di buona qualit√†. Piuttosto caro. Chiesto arrotondamento di 40 centesimi su totale di circa ‚Ç¨ 160, non concesso!!

reviews.text: Repas tr√®s cher!!...une assiette de poisson ( daurade aux agrumes sans grand int√©r√™t culinaire !!)., un tiramisu, une bouteille d‚Äôeau plate et 2 verres de vin par personne pour 77 ‚Ç¨ par personne ... attention pas de carte pour les desserts et 15‚Ç¨ le tiramisu !!.une vraie arnaque pour un repas loin de valoir ce prix l√† !!... un service correct, mais sans plus ... a √©viter !!!!

reviews.text:
A great rainy night treat.  Felt like eating with family, great food, cozy, and great service.

Best Tiramisu ever!
reviews.title: Great meal, fantastic tiramisu!

reviews.text:
Accueil neutre.
Service de rapidit√© normale.
3 pizzas de bonne qualit√© et copieuses mais avec l'eau plate et le service, on arrive √† une addition de presque 20 euros par personne.
Bon mais vraiment beaucoup trop cher.
reviews.title: Trop cher...

reviews.text: Pesce fresco e ben cucinato, risotto ai frutti di mare veramente buono, pieno di scampi vongole e cozze, poi rombo al forno con patate capperi pomodori e olive di qualit√†. Servizio cordiale e simpatico buon assortimento di vini e prezzi non altissimi.
reviews.title: Cena piacevole

reviews.text: Sch√∂ne Au√üenbestuhlung, Tische sch√∂n eingedeckt. Essen war das Menue touristico,  Spagetti Pomodoro und venezianische Leber, Spagetti gut al Dente mit viel Sauce. Leber war leider nicht zufrieden stellend. Service war freundlich und schnell
reviews.title: Liegt auf einem sch√∂nen Platz, gleich daneben eine Kirche in der h√§ufig Konzerte stattfinden

reviews.text: Food was great and staff was friendly. Price was as the same level as other venitian restaurants. We sat outside on a rainy day, but it worked out fine. The tiramisu was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great food

reviews.text: Wonderful outdoor lunch with great food choices, good wine and great waiter.  Loved the Limoncello finish!
reviews.title: Lunch in the rain

reviews.text:
It was lovely sitting out in the piazza watching the world go by. The service was fine if a little smooth and over-familiar  ‚Äî chatty ‚Äúservers‚Äù designed for the American market. Also a substantial service charge added to the bill in advance, which is not traditional, necessary or desirable. 

The food was good but not as spectacular as some reviewers have claimed. The prices were 5 to 15 euros more per dish than is the norm in a restaurant of this (good) standard in Venice. I  think I remember correctly that the desserts (eg tiramisu) were priced at about 16 euros each. We were not shown a menu / price but told verbally the list. I would not have ordered if I had known the ridiculous mark up ‚Äî perhaps this makes me sound miserly but no one likes being taken advantage of. 

Despite this we had a good time
‚Äî so if money is really not an issue for you then it‚Äôs a good suggestion for an atmospheric dinner. There were locals dining there as well so it‚Äôs obvious that the position of the restaurant allows it to command a kind of surcharge.
reviews.title: Nice experience but rather overpriced

reviews.text: We ate at this restaurant twice while in Venice.  Great food and the friendliest service I have ever had in Venice.  We actually had family in town while visiting and planned a lunch here one afternoon.  What a delightful experience!  Limoncello shots at end of meal enjoyed by all!
reviews.title: Great Outdoor Setting

reviews.text: Was raining so we couldn‚Äôt sit outside but outside is the place to be. Pasta was delicious. Wine was tasty. Tiramisu was fabulous. Crime br√ªl√©e was just average. Service was great
reviews.title: Delicious

reviews.text: Our family of 4, including a 9 and 12 year old, had an amazing dinner here!  The fish dishes were great and so were the kids‚Äô pasta. Our waiter, Ayman, recommended a seared tuna dish with sesame (with a description that didn‚Äôt translate, but is seared with hot olive oil) and it was unbelievable!  And as great as the food was, Ayman‚Äôs service really made the evening.  He was so warm & friendly, and absolutely charmed our kids. He also offered to make a simple pasta for the kids when they couldn‚Äôt decide what they wanted from the menu. We would highly recommend this restaurant with a large outside dining area in Campo S. Stefano.
reviews.title: Delicious dinner & great service

reviews.text: We literally stumbled into this place. After getting lost trying to google our way to another restaurant we where seated in here in the piazza. Beautiful night delightful staff and the seafood souffl√© was amazing! We met a lovely coupe from the states and enjoyed a wonderful evening in Venice!
reviews.title: Bucket List Birthday Anniversary

reviews.text: You can take your chances and simply turn up early to get a table but wiser to book if you plan to eat at the popular times around 8pm. Staff are friendly, helpful with the menu and wine list. The menu is varied and you should be able to find a meal to suit your requirements. Moderate prices and the food is made to order. Some dishes are for two people and may take time to prepare, such as the sea food risotto which we enjoyed greatly. Portions are large.  Wide rage of clientele including single diners, couples, groups of friends and families with children. Can recommend the artichoke, cream cheese and walnut starter, the aubergine,sea bass and veal dishes . Good value for money in a popular piazza.
reviews.title: Good spot for alfresco meal

reviews.text: Exhausted from walking everywhere I just want to find s good place to eat that wasn‚Äôt Taki g tourists for a ride! I read Jon‚Äôs review and I agree! Great food, great service and a pleasant experience! Bonus was it was right near my hotel!
reviews.title: What Jon20151 said!

Siamo stati in questo ristorante su consiglio dell‚Äôhotel dove alloggiavamo.
Pensavamo di trovare qualcosa di particolare, invece non √® nulla di pi√π che una pizzeria (anche se la sera non offrono pizza da menu), servizio da pizzeria, prezzi alti.

reviews.text: We dropped in for a quick bite during our trip in Venice. We had a nice cannelloni here, and some drinks. Nice staff.
reviews.title: Nice cannelloni

reviews.text:
Short version:

If you are reading this trying to decide on a place in Venice, JUST GO HERE.  It‚Äôs great!

Long version:

I love Venice in spite of way too many tourists.  

Way too many tourists means there is a lot of bad food.  For example, if you don‚Äôt see the pizza oven, then there‚Äôs a good chance you‚Äôre getting frozen pizza in Venice.  A lot of people won‚Äôt know the difference and, if they do, the restaurant serving the frozen pizza  doesn‚Äôt care because the person probably isn‚Äôt coming back to Venice anyway.

We‚Äôve also been to 4 star trip advisor places that were so bad even my kids won‚Äôt eat the pasta.  That‚Äôs what happens when there are way too many tourists writing reviews and assuming anything they eat in Italy is amazing.  WRONG!

With that preface:

This restaurant is EXCELLENT and a perfect choice if you only have one or two days in the city.  We have never been disappointed, and I recommend it to all my friends who go to Venice.  Everyone has enjoyed it!

It is fancy and a bit high end, but the price is worth it! They are famous for their mussel soup with the bread bowl top, and it is AMAZING.  However, everything else we tried has been great too during multiple visits over several years.  They are also super nice to kids (well, well behaved kids, if yours aren‚Äôt, please don‚Äôt go ruin it for everyone else) even though it is a white tablecloth type of place.
reviews.title: Perfect choice in city with bad tourist food

reviews.text: Nice Piazza to sit and have dinner as sun goes down and people watch! Enjoyed the food - pizza and chicken dish. Helpful service and prompt!
reviews.title: Nice food and service

reviews.title: Anniversary & Birthday

reviews.title: Bon d√Æner

reviews.text: I‚Äôm a Tiramisu lover and this was one of the best I had in my life! Expensive though, but the portion is well worth it.
reviews.title: Delicious Tiramisu

reviews.text: Good food and pleasant staff. Had a lovely early evening meal here before going to a concert. For the area and ambience, I thought it was good value and a pleasant dinner. Could easily go back and dally over a longer dinner.
reviews.title: Reasonable price

reviews.text:
We  had a nice time even though the weather outside was poor.  There was outdoor seating and they had blankets and umbrellas to keep the rain and cold off, but we opted to eat in.   

The staff was plentiful and friendly.  We were looking for a leisurely dinner and they actually rushed us a bit.  Perhaps because we were an early reservation and they wanted the table for the later crowd, but still, we were on vacation and wanted to take our time.  

They were already out of a few of the dishes on the menu. We ordered a variety of dishes and the low point was the fried seafood platter.  Just not really good at all.  The pasta with lobster was probably the best of the night.  The Linguine with clams was good (not great).  We enjoyed our appetizer of mushroom and cheese cannoli and of course we enjoyed the wine.  

We weren't sorry we went and it was a good experience but we wouldn't seek this restaurant out again.
reviews.title: Good but short of very good

reviews.text: Shame - saw the good reviews for their desserts and fancied a nightcap and dessert with my wife. Asked to sit down around 8:00 and got told only dinner - no drinks/ desserts.  I get it was peak time but there were loads of tables and we would have been 30 mins max. Instead we just went to the fantastic restaurant next door - Le Cafe - where we were seated with no fuss and got served excellently. Ah well, we won‚Äôt be going back here - even if we do want a full dinner...
reviews.title: Really Disappointed

reviews.text: A bit more pricey than the restaurants around it but definately worth it. Great and friendly service with fantastic food. Definately would recommend the draft beer too. We would definately come here again and recommend a visit for evening meal. Good atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, cracking food. Make sure if you visit venice you drop in here, you wont be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Classy and friendly

reviews.text: On the recommendation from the Gritti Palace concierge we ventured to A Beccafico.  We were a little hesitant when we arrived as the place only had a few tables booked, but were blown away when the entrees arrived.  We ordered five meals and one was better than the next.  From the seafood pasta to the squid each dish was plated beautifully and was as tasty as can be.  Service was a bit slow, but that could also be my New York impatient ness coming through.  All in all we were very happy with A Beccafico.
reviews.title: A Beccafico Surprise

reviews.text: Wir wollten zu zweit zum kurzen Lunch an einem Vierertisch sitzen, da der einte Platz in der Sonne war und der andere im Schatten. Es hatte viele freie Vierertische. Sehr unh√∂flich teilten sie uns mit, dass dies nicht gehe und es ihnen auch gleich sei, wenn wir gehen. Es geht ihnen wohl zu gut. Im artblue caf√© neben an wurden wir f√ºndig und weit willkommener empfangen. Absolut nicht empfehlenswerter Service!
reviews.title: Arrogant und unh√∂flich!

reviews.text:
Scoperta casuale ma felicissima.
Dicono che √® un po'pi√π caro dello standard ma forse lo standard non ha la stessa qualit√†.
Primo alla pescatora ottimo e filetto di manzo gustoso. Attenzione al cliente con crostino offerto da casa nell'attesa del primo e bign√® mignon che accompagna il caff√®.
Location e locale affascinate
reviews.title: Cena

reviews.text:
We walked into this restaurant for our first meal in Venice as it was close to where we were staying. I was skeptical at first because of some of the other reviews and the restaurant wasn't as full as the surrounding cafes, but the food exceeded my expectations - especially the mussel soup! We ordered it simply because the name of the soup has the restaurant's name in it, so we thought we'll try out their specialty, and boy was it the right call. The mussels were fresh, juicy and the flavor of the soup was superb. It was so good that we went back for another meal before our flight home. 

During the two meals there, we tried their 1. warm seafood salad for appetizer - it was good, lots of fresh seafood (mussels, clams, shrimps, squids), 2. mixed seafood pasta - it was good, but the toppings are the same as the warm seafood salad, so I wouldn't recommend ordering them both together like we did, 3. assorted marinated fish - I enjoyed this dish very much, light and yummy 4. lobster and crab pasta - it came highly recommended by the staff so we decided to give it a try and it was fantastic. At that point of the trip we've had a whole bunch of other types of seafood, so it was a nice change.
reviews.title: Amazing mussel soup!

reviews.text:
Tutto ottimo!
Siamo stati due volte ,in periodi diversi, in questo ristorante.tutte le scelte sono veramente da consigliare. Simpatico il cameriere. Ingredienti freschissimi, location suggestiva.
Ci ritorneremo
reviews.title: Vera cucina siciliana

Un plat chacun (~18‚Ç¨), un verre de vin et un Martini 87‚Ç¨ !!! 10‚Ç¨ le Martini! 12‚Ç¨ le verre de vin rouge... 
10‚Ç¨ le service, pour la qualit√© des plats c'est excessivement tr√®s tr√®s cher.
